Sir, excuse me, I did. I mounted my bike, and it bust in front of
the Cow Hospital. So I had to find a tonga.
subQuotationList: ['Sir, excuse me, I did. I mounted my bike, and it bust in front of\nthe Cow Hospital. So I had to find a tonga.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Bust in front of the Cow Hospital, did it? And how did you come
to be there?
subQuotationList: ['Bust in front of the Cow Hospital, did it? And how did you come\nto be there?']
speaker: Major Callendar

quoteText: I beg your pardon?
subQuotationList: ['I beg your pardon?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Oh Lord, oh Lord! When I live here
subQuotationList: ['Oh Lord, oh Lord! When I live here']
speaker: Major Callendar

quoteText:
and you
live there   not ten minutes from me   and the Cow Hospital is right
ever so far away the other side of you   _there_   then how did you
come to be passing the Cow Hospital on the way to me? Now do some
work for a change.
subQuotationList:
['and you
live there   not ten minutes from me   and the Cow Hospital is right
ever so far away the other side of you   _there_   then how did you
come to be passing the Cow Hospital on the way to me? Now do some
work for a change.']
speaker: Major Callendar

quoteText:
I must tell that to Mahmoud Ali,
it'll make him laugh,
subQuotationList: ["I must tell that to Mahmoud Ali,\nit'll make him laugh,"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Disaster may come, but we shall at all events get there safe, even if we do not get
back. It will, I think, create a good
impression should two doctors arrive at the same time.
subQuotationList: ['Disaster may come,', 'but we shall at all events get there safe, even if we do not get\nback.', 'It will, I think, create a good\nimpression should two doctors arrive at the same time.']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText:
How unhappy
I am!
subQuotationList: ['How unhappy\nI am!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: How unhappy I am!
subQuotationList: ['How unhappy I am!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Never, never shall I get over this, Most
certainly my career is a failure, and my sons will be badly brought
up.
subQuotationList: ['Never, never shall I get over this,', 'Most\ncertainly my career is a failure, and my sons will be badly brought\nup.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Maharajah, salaam,
subQuotationList: ['Maharajah, salaam,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Send it along
again.
subQuotationList: ['Send it along\nagain.']
speaker: A Stray Subaltern
referringExpression: he hit it back to Aziz and called

quoteText: All right.
subQuotationList: ['All right.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Often play?
subQuotationList: ['Often play?']
speaker: A Stray Subaltern

quoteText: Never.
subQuotationList: ['Never.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Let's have another chukker.
subQuotationList: ["Let's have another chukker."]
speaker: A Stray Subaltern

quoteText: Oh God! Don't you ever fall off?
subQuotationList: ['Oh God!', "Don't you ever fall off?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Plenty.
subQuotationList: ['Plenty.']
speaker: A Stray Subaltern

quoteText: Not you.
subQuotationList: ['Not you.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
If only they
were all like that,
subQuotationList: ['If only they\nwere all like that,']
speaker: _group

quoteText:
Dr. Aziz, Dr. Aziz, where you been? I waited ten full minutes'
time at your house, then I went.
subQuotationList: ["Dr. Aziz, Dr. Aziz, where you been? I waited ten full minutes'\ntime at your house, then I went."]
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText: I am so awfully sorry   I was compelled to go to the Post Office.
subQuotationList: ['I am so awfully sorry   I was compelled to go to the Post Office.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Post Office? Do you not send your
servants?
subQuotationList: ['Post Office? Do you not send your\nservants?']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText: I have so few   my scale is very small.
subQuotationList: ['I have so few   my scale is very small.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Your servant spoke to me. I saw your servant.
subQuotationList: ['Your servant spoke to me. I saw your servant.']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText:
But, Dr. Lal, consider. How could I send my servant when you were
coming: you come, we go, my house is left alone, my servant comes
back perhaps, and all my portable property has been carried away
by bad characters in the meantime. Would you have that? The cook
is deaf   I can never count on my cook   and the boy is only a little
boy. Never, never do I and Hassan leave the house at the same time
together. It is my fixed rule.
subQuotationList:
['But, Dr. Lal, consider. How could I send my servant when you were
coming: you come, we go, my house is left alone, my servant comes
back perhaps, and all my portable property has been carried away
by bad characters in the meantime. Would you have that? The cook
is deaf   I can never count on my cook   and the boy is only a little
boy. Never, never do I and Hassan leave the house at the same time
together. It is my fixed rule.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Panna Lal'], ['Dr. Panna Lal'], ['Dr. Panna Lal'], ['Dr. Aziz', 'Dr. Panna Lal'], ['Dr. Panna Lal']]]

quoteText:
Even if this so, what
prevents leaving a chit saying where you go?
subQuotationList: ['Even if this so, what\nprevents leaving a chit saying where you go?']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText:
Farther away, or
mine will start out of sympathy, It has been so rough and wild this
afternoon. It spoiled some most valuable blossoms in the club
garden, and had to be dragged back by four men. English ladies and
gentlemen looking on, and the Collector Sahib himself taking a
note. But, Dr. Aziz, I'll not take up your valuable time. This will
not interest you, who have so many engagements and telegrams. I am
just a poor old doctor who thought right to pay my respects when
I was asked and where I was asked. Your absence, I may remark, drew
commentaries.
subQuotationList:
['Farther away, or
mine will start out of sympathy,', "It has been so rough and wild this
afternoon. It spoiled some most valuable blossoms in the club
garden, and had to be dragged back by four men. English ladies and
gentlemen looking on, and the Collector Sahib himself taking a
note. But, Dr. Aziz, I'll not take up your valuable time. This will
not interest you, who have so many engagements and telegrams. I am
just a poor old doctor who thought right to pay my respects when
I was asked and where I was asked. Your absence, I may remark, drew
commentaries."]
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText: They can damn well comment.
subQuotationList: ['They can damn well comment.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: It is fine to be young. Damn well! Oh, very fine. Damn whom?
subQuotationList: ['It is fine to be young. Damn well! Oh, very fine. Damn whom?']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText: I go or not as I please.
subQuotationList: ['I go or not as I please.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Yet you promise me, and then fabricate this tale of a telegram.
Go forward, Dapple.
subQuotationList: ['Yet you promise me, and then fabricate this tale of a telegram.\nGo forward, Dapple.']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText: Please make yourself at home.
subQuotationList: ['Please make yourself at home.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
May I really, Mr. Fielding?
It's very good of you, I like unconventional
behaviour so extremely.
subQuotationList: ["May I really, Mr. Fielding?\nIt's very good of you,", 'I like unconventional\nbehaviour so extremely.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
The fact is I
have long wanted to meet you, I have heard so much
about your warm heart from the Nawab Bahadur. But where is one to
meet in a wretched hole like Chandrapore? When I was greener here, I'll tell you what. I used to wish
you to fall ill so that we could meet that way. I said to myself,
How does Mr. Fielding look this morning? Perhaps pale. And the
Civil Surgeon is pale too, he will not be able to attend upon him
when the shivering commences. I should have been sent for instead.
Then we would have had jolly talks, for you are a celebrated
student of Persian poetry.
subQuotationList:
['The fact is I
have long wanted to meet you,', 'I have heard so much
about your warm heart from the Nawab Bahadur. But where is one to
meet in a wretched hole like Chandrapore?', "When I was greener here, I'll tell you what. I used to wish
you to fall ill so that we could meet that way.", 'I said to myself,
How does Mr. Fielding look this morning? Perhaps pale. And the
Civil Surgeon is pale too, he will not be able to attend upon him
when the shivering commences. I should have been sent for instead.
Then we would have had jolly talks, for you are a celebrated
student of Persian poetry.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding']], [['Cyril Fielding'], ['The Nawab Badahur']], [['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz', 'Cyril Fielding']], [['Cyril Fielding'], ['Major Callendar'], ['Major Callendar'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText: You know me by sight, then.
subQuotationList: ['You know me by sight, then.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Of course, of course. You know me?
subQuotationList: ['Of course, of course. You know me?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I know you very well by name.
subQuotationList: ['I know you very well by name.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I have been here such a short time, and always in the bazaar. No
wonder you have never seen me, and I wonder you know my name. I
say, Mr. Fielding?
subQuotationList: ['I have been here such a short time, and always in the bazaar. No\nwonder you have never seen me, and I wonder you know my name. I\nsay, Mr. Fielding?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Yes?
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Guess what I look like before you come out. That will be a kind
of game.
subQuotationList: ['Guess what I look like before you come out. That will be a kind\nof game.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: You're five feet nine inches high,
subQuotationList: ["You're five feet nine inches high,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Jolly good. What next? Have I not a venerable white beard?
subQuotationList: ['Jolly good. What next? Have I not a venerable white beard?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Blast!
subQuotationList: ['Blast!']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Anything wrong?
subQuotationList: ['Anything wrong?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I've stamped on my last collar stud.
subQuotationList: ["I've stamped on my last collar stud."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Take mine, take mine.
subQuotationList: ['Take mine, take mine.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Have you a spare one?
subQuotationList: ['Have you a spare one?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Yes, yes, one minute.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, yes, one minute.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Not if you're wearing it yourself.
subQuotationList: ["Not if you're wearing it yourself."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: No, no, one in my pocket.
subQuotationList: ['No, no, one in my pocket.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Here it is,
subQuotationList: ['Here it is,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Come in with it if you don't mind the unconventionality.
subQuotationList: ["Come in with it if you don't mind the unconventionality."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: One minute again.
subQuotationList: ['One minute again.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Many thanks.
subQuotationList: ['Many thanks.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
But I always thought that Englishmen kept their rooms so tidy. It
seems that this is not so. I need not be so ashamed.
subQuotationList: ['But I always thought that Englishmen kept their rooms so tidy. It\nseems that this is not so. I need not be so ashamed.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Everything ranged coldly on
shelves was what _I_ thought.   I say, Mr. Fielding, is the stud
going to go in?
subQuotationList: ['Everything ranged coldly on\nshelves was what _I_ thought.   I say, Mr. Fielding, is the stud\ngoing to go in?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I hae ma doots.
subQuotationList: ['I hae ma doots.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
What's that last sentence, please? Will you teach me some new
words and so improve my English?
subQuotationList: ["What's that last sentence, please? Will you teach me some new\nwords and so improve my English?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Let me put in your stud. I see . . . the shirt back's hole is
rather small and to rip it wider a pity.
subQuotationList: ["Let me put in your stud. I see . . . the shirt back's hole is\nrather small and to rip it wider a pity."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Why in hell does one wear collars at all?
subQuotationList: ['Why in hell does one wear collars at all?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: We wear them to pass the Police.
subQuotationList: ['We wear them to pass the Police.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: What's that?
subQuotationList: ["What's that?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
If I'm biking in English dress   starch collar, hat with ditch   they
take no notice. When I wear a fez, they cry,    Your lamp's out!'
Lord Curzon did not consider this when he urged natives of India
to retain their picturesque costumes.   Hooray! Stud's gone
in.   Sometimes I shut my eyes and dream I have splendid clothes
again and am riding into battle behind Alamgir. Mr. Fielding, must
not India have been beautiful then, with the Mogul Empire at its
height and Alamgir reigning at Delhi upon the Peacock Throne?
subQuotationList:
["If I'm biking in English dress   starch collar, hat with ditch   they
take no notice. When I wear a fez, they cry,    Your lamp's out!'
Lord Curzon did not consider this when he urged natives of India
to retain their picturesque costumes.   Hooray! Stud's gone
in.   Sometimes I shut my eyes and dream I have splendid clothes
again and am riding into battle behind Alamgir. Mr. Fielding, must
not India have been beautiful then, with the Mogul Empire at its
height and Alamgir reigning at Delhi upon the Peacock Throne?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Two ladies are coming to tea to meet you   I think you know them.
subQuotationList: ['Two ladies are coming to tea to meet you   I think you know them.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText: Meet me? I know no ladies.
subQuotationList: ['Meet me? I know no ladies.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Not Mrs. Moore and Miss Quested?
subQuotationList: ['Not Mrs. Moore and Miss Quested?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Oh yes   I remember.
subQuotationList: ['Oh yes   I remember.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
An excessively aged lady;
but will you please repeat the name of her companion?
subQuotationList: ['An excessively aged lady;\nbut will you please repeat the name of her companion?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Miss Quested.
subQuotationList: ['Miss Quested.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Just as you wish.
subQuotationList: ['Just as you wish.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
You can talk to Miss Quested about the Peacock Throne if you
like   she's artistic, they say.
subQuotationList: ["You can talk to Miss Quested about the Peacock Throne if you\nlike   she's artistic, they say."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Is she a Post Impressionist?
subQuotationList: ['Is she a Post Impressionist?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Post Impressionism, indeed! Come along to tea. This world is
getting too much for me altogether.
subQuotationList: ['Post Impressionism, indeed! Come along to tea. This world is\ngetting too much for me altogether.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I do not
consider Mrs. Moore my friend, I only met her accidentally in my
mosque, a single meeting is too short to make a
friend,
subQuotationList:
['I do not
consider Mrs. Moore my friend, I only met her accidentally in my
mosque,', 'a single meeting is too short to make a
friend,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Besides the ladies I am expecting one of my assistants   Narayan
Godbole.
subQuotationList: ['Besides the ladies I am expecting one of my assistants   Narayan\nGodbole.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Oho, the Deccani Brahman!
subQuotationList: ['Oho, the Deccani Brahman!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: He wants the past back too, but not precisely Alamgir.
subQuotationList: ['He wants the past back too, but not precisely Alamgir.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I should think not. Do you know what Deccani Brahmans say? That
England conquered India from them   from them, mind, and not from
the Moguls. Is not that like their cheek? They have even bribed it
to appear in text-books, for they are so subtle and immensely rich.
Professor Godbole must be quite unlike all other Deccani Brahmans
from all I can hear say. A most sincere chap.
subQuotationList:
['I should think not. Do you know what Deccani Brahmans say? That
England conquered India from them   from them, mind, and not from
the Moguls. Is not that like their cheek? They have even bribed it
to appear in text-books, for they are so subtle and immensely rich.
Professor Godbole must be quite unlike all other Deccani Brahmans
from all I can hear say. A most sincere chap.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Why don't you fellows run a club in Chandrapore, Aziz?
subQuotationList: ["Why don't you fellows run a club in Chandrapore, Aziz?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Perhaps   some day . . . just now I see Mrs. Moore and   what's her
name   coming.
subQuotationList: ["Perhaps   some day . . . just now I see Mrs. Moore and   what's her\nname   coming."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I want to ask you something, Dr. Aziz, I heard from
Mrs. Moore how helpful you were to her in the mosque, and how
interesting. She learnt more about India in those few minutes' talk
with you than in the three weeks since we landed.
subQuotationList:
['I want to ask you something, Dr. Aziz,', "I heard from
Mrs. Moore how helpful you were to her in the mosque, and how
interesting. She learnt more about India in those few minutes' talk
with you than in the three weeks since we landed."]
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz']], [['Mrs. Moore'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText:
Oh, please do not mention a little thing like that. Is there
anything else I may tell you about my country?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, please do not mention a little thing like that. Is there\nanything else I may tell you about my country?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I want you to explain a disappointment we had this morning; it
must be some point of Indian etiquette.
subQuotationList: ['I want you to explain a disappointment we had this morning; it\nmust be some point of Indian etiquette.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
There honestly is none, We are by nature a most
informal people.
subQuotationList: ['There honestly is none,', 'We are by nature a most\ninformal people.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I am afraid we must have made some blunder and given offence,
subQuotationList: ['I am afraid we must have made some blunder and given offence,']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: That is even more impossible. But may I know the facts?
subQuotationList: ['That is even more impossible. But may I know the facts?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
An Indian lady and gentleman were to send their carriage for us
this morning at nine. It has never come. We waited and waited and
waited; we can't think what happened.
subQuotationList: ["An Indian lady and gentleman were to send their carriage for us\nthis morning at nine. It has never come. We waited and waited and\nwaited; we can't think what happened."]
speaker: Mrs. Moore
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText: Some misunderstanding,
subQuotationList: ['Some misunderstanding,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Oh no, it wasn't that, They even gave
up going to Calcutta to entertain us. We must have made some stupid
blunder, we both feel sure.
subQuotationList: ["Oh no, it wasn't that,", 'They even gave\nup going to Calcutta to entertain us. We must have made some stupid\nblunder, we both feel sure.']
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText: I wouldn't worry about that.
subQuotationList: ["I wouldn't worry about that."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Exactly what Mr. Heaslop tells me, If one doesn't worry, how's one to understand?
subQuotationList: ['Exactly what Mr. Heaslop tells me,', "If one doesn't worry, how's one to understand?"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Slack Hindus   they have no idea of society; I know them very well
because of a doctor at the hospital. Such a slack, unpunctual
fellow! It is as well you did not go to their house, for it would
give you a wrong idea of India. Nothing sanitary. I think for my
own part they grew ashamed of their house and that is why they did
not send.
subQuotationList:
['Slack Hindus   they have no idea of society; I know them very well
because of a doctor at the hospital. Such a slack, unpunctual
fellow! It is as well you did not go to their house, for it would
give you a wrong idea of India. Nothing sanitary. I think for my
own part they grew ashamed of their house and that is why they did
not send.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: That's a notion,
subQuotationList: ["That's a notion,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I do so hate mysteries,
subQuotationList: ['I do so hate mysteries,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: We English do.
subQuotationList: ['We English do.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I dislike them not because I'm English, but from my own personal
point of view,
subQuotationList: ["I dislike them not because I'm English, but from my own personal\npoint of view,"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I like mysteries but I rather dislike muddles,
subQuotationList: ['I like mysteries but I rather dislike muddles,']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: A mystery is a muddle.
subQuotationList: ['A mystery is a muddle.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Oh, do you think so, Mr. Fielding?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, do you think so, Mr. Fielding?']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
A mystery is only a high-sounding term for a muddle. No advantage
in stirring it up, in either case. Aziz and I know well that
India's a muddle.
subQuotationList: ["A mystery is only a high-sounding term for a muddle. No advantage\nin stirring it up, in either case. Aziz and I know well that\nIndia's a muddle."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: India's       Oh, what an alarming idea!
subQuotationList: ["India's       Oh, what an alarming idea!"]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
There'll be no muddle when you come to see me, Mrs. Moore and everyone   I invite you all   oh,
please.
subQuotationList: ["There'll be no muddle when you come to see me,", 'Mrs. Moore and everyone   I invite you all   oh,\nplease.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mrs. Moore']], [['Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText:
Oh, but we will talk
of something else now, I wish I lived here. See
this beautiful room! Let us admire it together for a little. See
those curves at the bottom of the arches. What delicacy! It is the
architecture of Question and Answer. Mrs. Moore, you are in India;
I am not joking.
subQuotationList:
['Oh, but we will talk
of something else now,', 'I wish I lived here. See
this beautiful room! Let us admire it together for a little. See
those curves at the bottom of the arches. What delicacy! It is the
architecture of Question and Answer. Mrs. Moore, you are in India;
I am not joking.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz', 'Adela Quested', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Mrs. Moore']], [['Dr. Aziz', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText:
I am doing justice here. A poor widow who has been robbed comes
along and I give her fifty rupees, to another a hundred, and so on
and so on. I should like that.
subQuotationList: ['I am doing justice here. A poor widow who has been robbed comes\nalong and I give her fifty rupees, to another a hundred, and so on\nand so on. I should like that.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Rupees don't last for ever, I'm afraid,
subQuotationList: ["Rupees don't last for ever, I'm afraid,"]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Mine would. God would give me more when he saw I gave. Always be
giving, like the Nawab Bahadur. My father was the same, that is
why he died poor.
subQuotationList: ['Mine would. God would give me more when he saw I gave. Always be\ngiving, like the Nawab Bahadur. My father was the same, that is\nwhy he died poor.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
So we would sit giving for ever   on a carpet instead of chairs,
that is the chief change between now and then, but I think we would
never punish anyone.
subQuotationList: ['So we would sit giving for ever   on a carpet instead of chairs,\nthat is the chief change between now and then, but I think we would\nnever punish anyone.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Poor criminal, give him another chance. It only makes a man worse
to go to prison and be corrupted.
subQuotationList: ['Poor criminal, give him another chance. It only makes a man worse\nto go to prison and be corrupted.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
We punish no one, no one, and in the evening we will give a great banquet with a nautch and
lovely girls shall shine on every side of the tank with fireworks
in their hands, and all shall be feasting and happiness until the
next day, when there shall be justice as before   fifty rupees, a
hundred, a thousand   till peace comes. Ah, why didn't we live in
that time?   But are you admiring Mr. Fielding's house? Do look how
the pillars are painted blue, and the verandah's pavilions   what do
you call them?   that are above us inside are blue also. Look at the
carving on the pavilions. Think of the hours it took. Their little
roofs are curved to imitate bamboo. So pretty   and the bamboos
waving by the tank outside. Mrs. Moore! Mrs. Moore!
subQuotationList:
['We punish no one, no one,', "and in the evening we will give a great banquet with a nautch and
lovely girls shall shine on every side of the tank with fireworks
in their hands, and all shall be feasting and happiness until the
next day, when there shall be justice as before   fifty rupees, a
hundred, a thousand   till peace comes. Ah, why didn't we live in
that time?   But are you admiring Mr. Fielding's house? Do look how
the pillars are painted blue, and the verandah's pavilions   what do
you call them?   that are above us inside are blue also. Look at the
carving on the pavilions. Think of the hours it took. Their little
roofs are curved to imitate bamboo. So pretty   and the bamboos
waving by the tank outside. Mrs. Moore! Mrs. Moore!"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Cyril Fielding', 'Adela Quested', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText: Well?
subQuotationList: ['Well?']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
You remember the water by our mosque? It comes down and fills this
tank   a skilful arrangement of the Emperors. They stopped here going
down into Bengal. They loved water. Wherever they went they created
fountains, gardens, hammams. I was telling Mr. Fielding I would
give anything to serve them.
subQuotationList:
['You remember the water by our mosque? It comes down and fills this
tank   a skilful arrangement of the Emperors. They stopped here going
down into Bengal. They loved water. Wherever they went they created
fountains, gardens, hammams. I was telling Mr. Fielding I would
give anything to serve them.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Then back with water
streaming over you and perhaps rather a pain inside. But I did not
mind. All my friends were paining with me. We have a proverb in
Urdu:    What does unhappiness matter when we are all unhappy
together?' which comes in conveniently after mangoes. Miss Quested,
do wait for mangoes. Why not settle altogether in India?
subQuotationList:
["Then back with water
streaming over you and perhaps rather a pain inside. But I did not
mind. All my friends were paining with me. We have a proverb in
Urdu:    What does unhappiness matter when we are all unhappy
together?' which comes in conveniently after mangoes. Miss Quested,
do wait for mangoes. Why not settle altogether in India?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I'm afraid I can't do that,
subQuotationList: ["I'm afraid I can't do that,"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Visitors like you are too rare.
subQuotationList: ['Visitors like you are too rare.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
They are indeed, Such affability is
seldom seen. But what can we offer to detain them?
subQuotationList: ['They are indeed,', 'Such affability is\nseldom seen. But what can we offer to detain them?']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Mangoes, mangoes.
subQuotationList: ['Mangoes, mangoes.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Even mangoes can be got in England now, They ship them in ice-cold rooms. You can make India in
England apparently, just as you can make England in India.
subQuotationList: ['Even mangoes can be got in England now,', 'They ship them in ice-cold rooms. You can make India in\nEngland apparently, just as you can make England in India.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Frightfully expensive in both cases,
subQuotationList: ['Frightfully expensive in both cases,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I suppose so.
subQuotationList: ['I suppose so.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: And nasty.
subQuotationList: ['And nasty.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Don't you come too, Adela; you dislike institutions.
subQuotationList: ["Don't you come too, Adela; you dislike institutions."]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: Yes, that is so,
subQuotationList: ['Yes, that is so,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I speak now as a doctor: no.
subQuotationList: ['I speak now as a doctor: no.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
But I will send you up a few healthy sweets. I will give myself
that pleasure.
subQuotationList: ['But I will send you up a few healthy sweets. I will give myself\nthat pleasure.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
Miss Quested, Professor Godbole's sweets are delicious, They will give you a real Indian treat. Ah, in my poor
position I can give you nothing.
subQuotationList: ["Miss Quested, Professor Godbole's sweets are delicious,", 'They will give you a real Indian treat. Ah, in my poor\nposition I can give you nothing.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I don't know why you say that, when you have so kindly asked us
to your house.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know why you say that, when you have so kindly asked us\nto your house."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Yes,
all that is settled,
subQuotationList: ['Yes,\nall that is settled,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I invite you all to see me in the Marabar Caves.
subQuotationList: ['I invite you all to see me in the Marabar Caves.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I shall be delighted.
subQuotationList: ['I shall be delighted.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Oh, that is a most magnificent entertainment compared to my poor
sweets. But has not Miss Quested visited our caves already?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, that is a most magnificent entertainment compared to my poor\nsweets. But has not Miss Quested visited our caves already?']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: No. I've not even heard of them.
subQuotationList: ["No. I've not even heard of them."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Not heard of them? The Marabar Caves in the Marabar
Hills?
subQuotationList: ['Not heard of them?', 'The Marabar Caves in the Marabar\nHills?']
speaker: _group

quoteText:
We hear nothing interesting up at the club. Only tennis and
ridiculous gossip.
subQuotationList: ['We hear nothing interesting up at the club. Only tennis and\nridiculous gossip.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I know.
subQuotationList: ['I know.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Then tell me everything you will, or I shall never understand
India. Are they the hills I sometimes see in the evening? What are
these caves?
subQuotationList: ['Then tell me everything you will, or I shall never understand\nIndia. Are they the hills I sometimes see in the evening? What are\nthese caves?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
My dear young sir,
the pot and the kettle! Have you ever heard of that useful proverb?
subQuotationList: ['My dear young sir,\nthe pot and the kettle! Have you ever heard of that useful proverb?']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Are they large caves?
subQuotationList: ['Are they large caves?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: No, not large.
subQuotationList: ['No, not large.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Do describe them, Professor Godbole.
subQuotationList: ['Do describe them, Professor Godbole.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: It will be a great honour.
subQuotationList: ['It will be a great honour.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
There is an entrance in the rock which you enter,
and through the entrance is the cave.
subQuotationList: ['There is an entrance in the rock which you enter,\nand through the entrance is the cave.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Something like the caves at Elephanta?
subQuotationList: ['Something like the caves at Elephanta?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Oh no, not at all; at Elephanta there are sculptures of Siva and
Parvati. There are no sculptures at Marabar.
subQuotationList: ['Oh no, not at all; at Elephanta there are sculptures of Siva and\nParvati. There are no sculptures at Marabar.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: They are immensely holy, no doubt,
subQuotationList: ['They are immensely holy, no doubt,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Oh no, oh no.
subQuotationList: ['Oh no, oh no.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Still, they are ornamented in some way.
subQuotationList: ['Still, they are ornamented in some way.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Oh no.
subQuotationList: ['Oh no.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
Well, why are they so famous? We all talk of the famous Marabar
Caves. Perhaps that is our empty brag.
subQuotationList: ['Well, why are they so famous? We all talk of the famous Marabar\nCaves. Perhaps that is our empty brag.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: No, I should not quite say that.
subQuotationList: ['No, I should not quite say that.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Describe them to this lady, then.
subQuotationList: ['Describe them to this lady, then.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: It will be a great pleasure.
subQuotationList: ['It will be a great pleasure.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: What's happened to Fielding? Where's my mother?
subQuotationList: ["What's happened to Fielding? Where's my mother?"]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Good evening!
subQuotationList: ['Good evening!']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I want you and mother at once. There's to be polo.
subQuotationList: ["I want you and mother at once. There's to be polo."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: I thought there was to be no polo.
subQuotationList: ['I thought there was to be no polo.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Everything's altered. Some soldier men have come in. Come along
and I'll tell you about it.
subQuotationList: ["Everything's altered. Some soldier men have come in. Come along\nand I'll tell you about it."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
Your mother will return shortly, sir, There is but little to see at our
poor college.
subQuotationList: ['Your mother will return shortly, sir,', 'There is but little to see at our\npoor college.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
Come along up and join us, Mr. Heaslop; sit down till your
mother turns up.
subQuotationList: ['Come along up and join us, Mr. Heaslop; sit down till your\nmother turns up.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
referringExpression: He had not risen with Godbole and now offensively friendly called

quoteText: He may not understand that. Allow me
subQuotationList: ['He may not understand that. Allow me']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Don't trouble to come, mother, we're just
starting.
subQuotationList: ["Don't trouble to come, mother,", "we're just\nstarting."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
I say, old man, do excuse me, but I think
perhaps you oughtn't to have left Miss Quested alone.
subQuotationList: ["I say, old man, do excuse me, but I think\nperhaps you oughtn't to have left Miss Quested alone."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
referringExpression: he hurried to Fielding drew him aside and said

quoteText: I'm sorry, what's up?
subQuotationList: ["I'm sorry, what's up?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Well . . . I'm the sun-dried bureaucrat, no doubt; still, I don't
like to see an English girl left smoking with two Indians.
subQuotationList: ["Well . . . I'm the sun-dried bureaucrat, no doubt; still, I don't\nlike to see an English girl left smoking with two Indians."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: She stopped, as she smokes, by her own wish, old man.
subQuotationList: ['She stopped, as she smokes, by her own wish, old man.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Yes, that's all right in England.
subQuotationList: ["Yes, that's all right in England."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: I really can't see the harm.
subQuotationList: ["I really can't see the harm."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
If you can't see, you can't see. . . . Can't you see that fellow's
a bounder?
subQuotationList: ["If you can't see, you can't see. . . . Can't you see that fellow's\na bounder?"]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
He isn't a bounder, His nerves are on edge,
that's all.
subQuotationList: ["He isn't a bounder,", "His nerves are on edge,\nthat's all."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: What should have upset his precious nerves?
subQuotationList: ['What should have upset his precious nerves?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: I don't know. He was all right when I left.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know. He was all right when I left."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Well, it's nothing I've said, I never
even spoke to him.
subQuotationList: ["Well, it's nothing I've said,", 'I never\neven spoke to him.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
Oh well, come along now, and take your ladies away; the catastrophe
over.
subQuotationList: ['Oh well, come along now, and take your ladies away; the catastrophe\nover.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Fielding . . . don't think I'm taking it badly, or anything of
that sort. . . . I suppose you won't come on to the polo with us?
We should all be delighted.
subQuotationList: ["Fielding . . . don't think I'm taking it badly, or anything of\nthat sort. . . . I suppose you won't come on to the polo with us?\nWe should all be delighted."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText:
I'm afraid I can't, thanks all the same. I'm awfully sorry you
feel I've been remiss. I didn't mean to be.
subQuotationList: ["I'm afraid I can't, thanks all the same. I'm awfully sorry you\nfeel I've been remiss. I didn't mean to be."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Good-bye, Mr. Fielding, and thank you so much. . . . What lovely
College buildings!
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye, Mr. Fielding, and thank you so much. . . . What lovely\nCollege buildings!']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: Good-bye, Mrs. Moore.
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye, Mrs. Moore.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Good-bye, Mr. Fielding. Such an interesting afternoon. . . .
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye, Mr. Fielding. Such an interesting afternoon. . . .']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Good-bye, Miss Quested.
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye, Miss Quested.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Good-bye, Dr. Aziz.
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye, Dr. Aziz.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: Good-bye, Mrs. Moore.
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye, Mrs. Moore.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Good-bye, Dr. Aziz.
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye, Dr. Aziz.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Good-bye, Miss Quested.
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye, Miss Quested.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
You'll jolly jolly well not forget those
caves, won't you? I'll fix the whole show up in a jiffy.
subQuotationList: ["You'll jolly jolly well not forget those\ncaves, won't you? I'll fix the whole show up in a jiffy."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Thank you. . .
subQuotationList: ['Thank you. . .']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
What a shame
you leave India so soon! Oh, do reconsider your decision, do stay.
subQuotationList: ['What a shame\nyou leave India so soon! Oh, do reconsider your decision, do stay.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Good-bye, Professor Godbole, It's a shame we never heard you sing.
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye, Professor Godbole,', "It's a shame we never heard you sing."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I may sing now,
subQuotationList: ['I may sing now,']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Thanks so much: what was that?
subQuotationList: ['Thanks so much: what was that?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I will explain in detail. It was a religious song. I placed myself
in the position of a milkmaiden. I say to Shri Krishna,
subQuotationList: ['I will explain in detail. It was a religious song. I placed myself\nin the position of a milkmaiden. I say to Shri Krishna,']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: The god refuses to come. I grow humble and say:
subQuotationList: ['The god refuses to come. I grow humble and say:']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
He refuses to come. This is repeated
several times. The song is composed in a raga appropriate to the
present hour, which is the evening.
subQuotationList: ['He refuses to come. This is repeated\nseveral times. The song is composed in a raga appropriate to the\npresent hour, which is the evening.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: But He comes in some other song, I hope?
subQuotationList: ['But He comes in some other song, I hope?']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Oh no, he refuses to come, I say to Him, Come, come, come, come,
come, come. He neglects to come.
subQuotationList: ['Oh no, he refuses to come,', 'I say to Him, Come, come, come, come,\ncome, come. He neglects to come.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: What was that about caves?
subQuotationList: ['What was that about caves?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
Mrs. Moore, your delightful doctor has decided on a picnic,
instead of a party in his house; we are to meet him out there   you,
myself, Mr. Fielding, Professor Godbole   exactly the same party.
subQuotationList: ['Mrs. Moore, your delightful doctor has decided on a picnic,\ninstead of a party in his house; we are to meet him out there   you,\nmyself, Mr. Fielding, Professor Godbole   exactly the same party.']
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mrs. Moore'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Professor Godbole']]]

quoteText: Out where?
subQuotationList: ['Out where?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: The Marabar Caves.
subQuotationList: ['The Marabar Caves.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Well, I'm blessed, Did he descend to
any details?
subQuotationList: ["Well, I'm blessed,", 'Did he descend to\nany details?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
He did not. If you had spoken to him, we could have arranged
them.
subQuotationList: ['He did not. If you had spoken to him, we could have arranged\nthem.']
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'Dr. Aziz']]]

quoteText: Have I said anything funny?
subQuotationList: ['Have I said anything funny?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
I was only thinking how the worthy doctor's collar climbed up his
neck.
subQuotationList: ["I was only thinking how the worthy doctor's collar climbed up his\nneck."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: I thought you were discussing the caves.
subQuotationList: ['I thought you were discussing the caves.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
So I am. Aziz was exquisitely dressed, from tie-pin to spats, but
he had forgotten his back collar-stud, and there you have the
Indian all over: inattention to detail; the fundamental slackness
that reveals the race. Similarly, to    meet' in the caves as if they
were the clock at Charing Cross, when they're miles from a station
and each other.
subQuotationList:
["So I am. Aziz was exquisitely dressed, from tie-pin to spats, but
he had forgotten his back collar-stud, and there you have the
Indian all over: inattention to detail; the fundamental slackness
that reveals the race. Similarly, to    meet' in the caves as if they
were the clock at Charing Cross, when they're miles from a station
and each other."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Have you been to them?
subQuotationList: ['Have you been to them?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: No, but I know all about them, naturally.
subQuotationList: ['No, but I know all about them, naturally.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Oh naturally!
subQuotationList: ['Oh naturally!']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Are you too pledged to this expedition, mother?
subQuotationList: ['Are you too pledged to this expedition, mother?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
Mother is pledged to nothing, Certainly not to this polo. Will you drive up to the bungalow
first, and drop me there, please? I prefer to rest.
subQuotationList: ['Mother is pledged to nothing,', 'Certainly not to this polo. Will you drive up to the bungalow\nfirst, and drop me there, please? I prefer to rest.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Drop me too, I don't want to watch polo either, I'm
sure.
subQuotationList: ['Drop me too,', "I don't want to watch polo either, I'm\nsure."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Simpler to drop the polo, I
won't have you messing about with Indians any more! If you want to
go to the Marabar Caves, you'll go under British auspices.
subQuotationList: ['Simpler to drop the polo,', "I\nwon't have you messing about with Indians any more! If you want to\ngo to the Marabar Caves, you'll go under British auspices."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText:
I've never heard of these caves, I don't know what or where they
are, but I really can't have so much quarrelling and tiresomeness!
subQuotationList: ["I've never heard of these caves, I don't know what or where they\nare,", "but I really can't have", 'so much quarrelling and tiresomeness!']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: We must have a thorough talk, Ronny, I'm afraid.
subQuotationList: ["We must have a thorough talk, Ronny, I'm afraid."]
speaker: Adela Quested
referringExpression: she forced out of herself the undigested remark

quoteText:
My temper's rotten, I must apologize, I didn't
mean to order you and mother about, but of course the way those
Bengalis let you down this morning annoyed me, and I don't want
that sort of thing to keep happening.
subQuotationList:
["My temper's rotten, I must apologize,", "I didn't
mean to order you and mother about, but of course the way those
Bengalis let you down this morning annoyed me, and I don't want
that sort of thing to keep happening."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: It's nothing to do with them that I . . .
subQuotationList: ["It's nothing to do with them that I . . ."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
No, but Aziz would make some similar muddle over the caves. He
meant nothing by the invitation, I could tell by his voice; it's
just their way of being pleasant.
subQuotationList: ["No, but Aziz would make some similar muddle over the caves. He\nmeant nothing by the invitation, I could tell by his voice; it's\njust their way of being pleasant."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
It's something very different, nothing to do with caves, that I
wanted to talk over with you.
subQuotationList: ["It's something very different, nothing to do with caves, that I\nwanted to talk over with you."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I've finally decided we are not going to be married, my dear boy.
subQuotationList: ["I've finally decided we are not going to be married, my dear boy."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
You never said we should marry, my dear girl;
you never bound either yourself or me   don't let this upset you.
subQuotationList: ["You never said we should marry, my dear girl;\nyou never bound either yourself or me   don't let this upset you."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText:
But let us discuss things; it's all so
frightfully important, we mustn't make false steps. I want next to
hear your point of view about me   it might help us both.
subQuotationList: ["But let us discuss things; it's all so\nfrightfully important, we mustn't make false steps. I want next to\nhear your point of view about me   it might help us both."]
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested']]]

quoteText:
I don't much believe in this
discussing   besides, I'm so dead with all this extra work Mohurram's
bringing, if you'll excuse me.
subQuotationList: ["I don't much believe in this\ndiscussing   besides, I'm so dead with all this extra work Mohurram's\nbringing, if you'll excuse me."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
I only want everything to be absolutely clear between us, and to
answer any questions you care to put to me on my conduct.
subQuotationList: ['I only want everything to be absolutely clear between us, and to\nanswer any questions you care to put to me on my conduct.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
But I haven't got any questions. You've acted within your rights,
you were quite right to come out and have a look at me doing my
work, it was an excellent plan, and anyhow it's no use talking
further   we should only get up steam.
subQuotationList:
["But I haven't got any questions. You've acted within your rights,
you were quite right to come out and have a look at me doing my
work, it was an excellent plan, and anyhow it's no use talking
further   we should only get up steam."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
I suppose that there is nothing else; it's unpardonable of me to
have given you and your mother all this bother,
subQuotationList: ["I suppose that there is nothing else; it's unpardonable of me to\nhave given you and your mother all this bother,"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Yes, nothing else, We've been awfully British over it, but
I suppose that's all right.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, nothing else,', "We've been awfully British over it, but\nI suppose that's all right."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: As we are British, I suppose it is.
subQuotationList: ['As we are British, I suppose it is.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Anyhow we've not quarrelled, Ronny.
subQuotationList: ["Anyhow we've not quarrelled, Ronny."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Oh, that would have been too absurd. Why should we quarrel?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, that would have been too absurd. Why should we quarrel?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: I think we shall keep friends.
subQuotationList: ['I think we shall keep friends.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I know we shall.
subQuotationList: ['I know we shall.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Quite so.
subQuotationList: ['Quite so.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Do you know what the name
of that green bird up above us is?
subQuotationList: ['Do you know what the name\nof that green bird up above us is?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Bee-eater.
subQuotationList: ['Bee-eater.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Oh no, Ronny, it has red bars on its wings.
subQuotationList: ['Oh no, Ronny, it has red bars on its wings.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Parrot,
subQuotationList: ['Parrot,']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Good gracious no.
subQuotationList: ['Good gracious no.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
McBryde has an illustrated bird book, I'm
no good at all at birds, in fact I'm useless at any information
outside my own job. It's a great pity.
subQuotationList: ['McBryde has an illustrated bird book,', "I'm\nno good at all at birds, in fact I'm useless at any information\noutside my own job. It's a great pity."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: So am I. I'm useless at everything.
subQuotationList: ["So am I. I'm useless at everything."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
What do I hear? What most improbable
statement have I heard? An English lady useless? No, no, no, no,
no.
subQuotationList: ['What do I hear?', 'What most improbable\nstatement have I heard? An English lady useless? No, no, no, no,\nno.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Hallo, Nawab Bahadur! Been watching the polo again?
subQuotationList: ['Hallo, Nawab Bahadur! Been watching the polo again?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: I have, sahib, I have.
subQuotationList: ['I have, sahib, I have.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: How do you do?
subQuotationList: ['How do you do?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Would half an hour's spin entertain you at
all?
subQuotationList: ["Would half an hour's spin entertain you at\nall?"]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Oughtn't we to get back to the bungalow.
subQuotationList: ["Oughtn't we to get back to the bungalow."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Why?
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
I think perhaps I ought to see your mother and discuss future
plans.
subQuotationList: ['I think perhaps I ought to see your mother and discuss future\nplans.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: That's as you like, but there's no hurry, is there?
subQuotationList: ["That's as you like, but there's no hurry, is there?"]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Let me take you to the bungalow, and first the little spin,
subQuotationList: ['Let me take you to the bungalow, and first the little spin,']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText:
He may show you some aspect of the country I can't, and he's a
real loyalist. I thought you might care for a bit of a change.
subQuotationList: ["He may show you some aspect of the country I can't, and he's a\nreal loyalist. I thought you might care for a bit of a change."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The Nawab Badahur'], ['Adela Quested'], ['The Nawab Badahur'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText:
Despite my
advanced years, I am learning to drive, Man can learn
everything if he will but try.
subQuotationList: ['Despite my\nadvanced years, I am learning to drive,', 'Man can learn\neverything if he will but try.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText:
I do not do the actual steering. I sit and ask my
chauffeur questions, and thus learn the reason for everything that
is done before I do it myself. By this method serious and I may
say ludicrous accidents, such as befell one of my compatriots
during that delightful reception at the English Club, are avoided.
Our good Panna Lal! I hope, sahib, that great damage was not done
to your flowers. Let us have our little spin down the Gangavati
road. Half one league onwards!
subQuotationList:
['I do not do the actual steering. I sit and ask my
chauffeur questions, and thus learn the reason for everything that
is done before I do it myself. By this method serious and I may
say ludicrous accidents, such as befell one of my compatriots
during that delightful reception at the English Club, are avoided.
Our good Panna Lal! I hope, sahib, that great damage was not done
to your flowers. Let us have our little spin down the Gangavati
road. Half one league onwards!']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Panna Lal'], ['Dr. Panna Lal'], ['Dr. Panna Lal']]]

quoteText: What's the damage?
subQuotationList: ["What's the damage?"]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
You give me five
minutes' time, I'll take you any dam anywhere.
subQuotationList: ["You give me five\nminutes' time, I'll take you any dam anywhere."]
speaker: Mr. Harris
referringExpression: The Eurasian inclined to be flustered rallied to the sound of his voice and every inch an Englishman replied
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Ronny Heaslop'], ['Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Ronny Heaslop']]]

quoteText: Frightened, Adela?
subQuotationList: ['Frightened, Adela?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Not a bit.
subQuotationList: ['Not a bit.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I consider not to be frightened the height of folly,
subQuotationList: ['I consider not to be frightened the height of folly,']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Well, it's all over now, tears are useless, We had some luck butting that tree.
subQuotationList: ["Well, it's all over now, tears are useless,", 'We had some luck butting that tree.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
All over . . . oh yes, the danger is past, let us smoke cigarettes,
let us do anything we please. Oh yes . . . enjoy ourselves   oh my
merciful God . . .
subQuotationList: ['All over . . . oh yes, the danger is past, let us smoke cigarettes,\nlet us do anything we please. Oh yes . . . enjoy ourselves   oh my\nmerciful God . . .']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur']]]

quoteText: Wasn't the bridge. We skidded.
subQuotationList: ["Wasn't the bridge. We skidded."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
We didn't skid, We ran into
an animal.
subQuotationList: ["We didn't skid,", 'We ran into\nan animal.']
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur']], [['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur']]]

quoteText: An animal?
subQuotationList: ['An animal?']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: A large animal rushed up out of the dark on the right and hit us.
subQuotationList: ['A large animal rushed up out of the dark on the right and hit us.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: By Jove, she's right, The paint's gone.
subQuotationList: ["By Jove, she's right,", "The paint's gone."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: By Jove, sir, your lady is right,
subQuotationList: ['By Jove, sir, your lady is right,']
speaker: Mr. Harris

quoteText: Of course I'm right. I saw its hairy back quite plainly.
subQuotationList: ["Of course I'm right. I saw its hairy back quite plainly."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I say, Adela, what was it?
subQuotationList: ['I say, Adela, what was it?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
I don't know the animals any better than the birds here   too big
for a goat.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know the animals any better than the birds here   too big\nfor a goat."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Exactly, too big for a goat . . .
subQuotationList: ['Exactly, too big for a goat . . .']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Let's go into this; let's look for its tracks.
subQuotationList: ["Let's go into this; let's look for its tracks."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur']]]

quoteText: Exactly; you wish to borrow this electric torch.
subQuotationList: ['Exactly; you wish to borrow this electric torch.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: I believe it was a buffalo,
subQuotationList: ['I believe it was a buffalo,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Exactly.
subQuotationList: ['Exactly.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Unless it was a hyena.
subQuotationList: ['Unless it was a hyena.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Excellent, a hyena, Mr. Harris!
subQuotationList: ['Excellent, a hyena,', 'Mr. Harris!']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Half a mo-ment. Give me ten minutes' time.
subQuotationList: ["Half a mo-ment. Give me ten minutes' time."]
speaker: Mr. Harris

quoteText: Sahib says hyena.
subQuotationList: ['Sahib says hyena.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText:
Don't worry Mr. Harris. He saved us from a nasty smash. Harris,
well done!
subQuotationList: ["Don't worry Mr. Harris. He saved us from a nasty smash. Harris,\nwell done!"]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Harris'], ['Mr. Harris'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur'], ['Mr. Harris']]]

quoteText:
A smash, sahib, that would not have taken place had he obeyed and
taken us Gangavati side, instead of Marabar.
subQuotationList: ['A smash, sahib, that would not have taken place had he obeyed and\ntaken us Gangavati side, instead of Marabar.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Mr. Harris'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested', 'The Nawab Badahur']]]

quoteText:
My fault that. I told him to come this way because the road's
better. Mr. Lesley has made it pukka right up to the hills.
subQuotationList: ["My fault that. I told him to come this way because the road's\nbetter. Mr. Lesley has made it pukka right up to the hills."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Ah, now I begin to understand.
subQuotationList: ['Ah, now I begin to understand.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Not at all,
subQuotationList: ['Not at all,']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
Mr. Heaslop, Miss Quested, what are you holding up an innocent
female for?
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Heaslop, Miss Quested, what are you holding up an innocent\nfemale for?']
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText: We've had a breakdown.
subQuotationList: ["We've had a breakdown."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: But how putrid!
subQuotationList: ['But how putrid!']
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText: We ran into a hyena!
subQuotationList: ['We ran into a hyena!']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: How absolutely rotten!
subQuotationList: ['How absolutely rotten!']
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText: Can you give us a lift?
subQuotationList: ['Can you give us a lift?']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Yes, indeed.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, indeed.']
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText: Take me too,
subQuotationList: ['Take me too,']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Heh, what about me?
subQuotationList: ['Heh, what about me?']
speaker: Mr. Harris

quoteText:
Now what's all this? I'm not an omnibus, I've a harmonium and two dogs in here with me as it is.
I'll take three of you if one'll sit in front and nurse a pug. No
more.
subQuotationList: ["Now what's all this? I'm not an omnibus,", "I've a harmonium and two dogs in here with me as it is.\nI'll take three of you if one'll sit in front and nurse a pug. No\nmore."]
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText: I will sit in front,
subQuotationList: ['I will sit in front,']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Then hop in: I've no notion who you are.
subQuotationList: ["Then hop in: I've no notion who you are."]
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText:
Heh no, what about my dinner? I can't be left alone all the
night.
subQuotationList: ["Heh no, what about my dinner? I can't be left alone all the\nnight."]
speaker: Mr. Harris

quoteText:
Nussu will bring you out some suitable dinner upon a bicycle, I
shall despatch him with all possible speed. Meanwhile, repair my
car.
subQuotationList: ['Nussu will bring you out some suitable dinner upon a bicycle,', 'I\nshall despatch him with all possible speed. Meanwhile, repair my\ncar.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText:
I don't believe in these
people letting you down, If I didn't snatch like the
devil, I should be nowhere. He doesn't want the car, silly fool!
Surely it's to the credit of his State I should be seen about in
it at Chandrapore during my leave. He ought to look at it that way.
Anyhow he's got to look at it that way. My Maharani's different   my
Maharani's a dear. That's her fox terrier, poor little devil. I
fished them out both with the driver. Imagine taking dogs to a
Chiefs' Conference! As sensible as taking Chiefs, perhaps. The harmonium   the harmonium's my little
mistake, I own. They rather had me over the harmonium. I meant it
to stop on the train. Oh lor'!
subQuotationList:
["I don't believe in these
people letting you down,", "If I didn't snatch like the
devil, I should be nowhere. He doesn't want the car, silly fool!
Surely it's to the credit of his State I should be seen about in
it at Chandrapore during my leave. He ought to look at it that way.
Anyhow he's got to look at it that way. My Maharani's different   my
Maharani's a dear. That's her fox terrier, poor little devil. I
fished them out both with the driver. Imagine taking dogs to a
Chiefs' Conference! As sensible as taking Chiefs, perhaps.", "The harmonium   the harmonium's my little
mistake, I own. They rather had me over the harmonium. I meant it
to stop on the train. Oh lor'!"]
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText:
They always sack me before that happens, and then I get another
job. The whole of India seethes with Maharanis and Ranis and Begums
who clamour for such as me.
subQuotationList: ['They always sack me before that happens, and then I get another\njob. The whole of India seethes with Maharanis and Ranis and Begums\nwho clamour for such as me.']
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText: Really. I had no idea.
subQuotationList: ['Really. I had no idea.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
How could you have any idea, Mr. Heaslop? What should he know
about Maharanis, Miss Quested? Nothing. At least I should hope
not.
subQuotationList: ['How could you have any idea, Mr. Heaslop? What should he know\nabout Maharanis, Miss Quested? Nothing. At least I should hope\nnot.']
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText: I understand those big people are not particularly interesting,
subQuotationList: ['I understand those big people are not particularly interesting,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Ah, there you're wrong. They're priceless.
subQuotationList: ["Ah, there you're wrong. They're priceless."]
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText:
I would scarcely call her wrong, A Native State, a Hindu State, the wife of a ruler of a Hindu
State, may beyond doubt be a most excellent lady, and let it not
be for a moment supposed that I suggest anything against the
character of Her Highness the Maharani of Mudkul. But I fear she
will be uneducated, I fear she will be superstitious. Indeed, how
could she be otherwise? What opportunity of education has such a
lady had? Oh, superstition is terrible, terrible! oh, it is the
great defect in our Indian character! Oh, it is the duty of
each and every citizen to shake superstition off, and though I have
little experience of Hindu States, and none of this particular one,
namely Mudkul (the Ruler, I fancy, has a salute of but eleven
guns)   yet I cannot imagine that they have been as successful as
British India, where we see reason and orderliness spreading in
every direction, like a most health-giving flood!
subQuotationList:
['I would scarcely call her wrong,', 'A Native State, a Hindu State, the wife of a ruler of a Hindu
State, may beyond doubt be a most excellent lady, and let it not
be for a moment supposed that I suggest anything against the
character of Her Highness the Maharani of Mudkul. But I fear she
will be uneducated, I fear she will be superstitious. Indeed, how
could she be otherwise? What opportunity of education has such a
lady had? Oh, superstition is terrible, terrible! oh, it is the
great defect in our Indian character!', 'Oh, it is the duty of
each and every citizen to shake superstition off, and though I have
little experience of Hindu States, and none of this particular one,
namely Mudkul (the Ruler, I fancy, has a salute of but eleven
guns)   yet I cannot imagine that they have been as successful as
British India, where we see reason and orderliness spreading in
every direction, like a most health-giving flood!']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Golly!
subQuotationList: ['Golly!']
speaker: Miss Derek

quoteText:
Ronny, I should like to take
back what I said on the Maidan.
subQuotationList: ['Ronny, I should like to take\nback what I said on the Maidan.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Come along and let's tell the mater all this
subQuotationList: ["Come along and let's tell the mater all this"]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
Look here, both of you, see India if you like and as you
like   I know I made myself rather ridiculous at Fielding's, but . . .
it's different now. I wasn't quite sure of myself.
subQuotationList: ["Look here, both of you, see India if you like and as you\nlike   I know I made myself rather ridiculous at Fielding's, but . . .\nit's different now. I wasn't quite sure of myself."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText:
My duties here are evidently finished, I don't want to see India
now; now for my passage back,
subQuotationList: ["My duties here are evidently finished, I don't want to see India\nnow; now for my passage back,"]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: What does our old gentleman of the car think?
subQuotationList: ['What does our old gentleman of the car think?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Our old gentleman is helpful and sound, as he always is over
public affairs. You've seen in him our show Indian.
subQuotationList: ["Our old gentleman is helpful and sound, as he always is over\npublic affairs. You've seen in him our show Indian."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The Nawab Badahur'], ['The Nawab Badahur'], ['Adela Quested'], ['The Nawab Badahur']]]

quoteText: Have I really?
subQuotationList: ['Have I really?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
I'm afraid so. Incredible, aren't they, even the best of them?
They're all   they all forget their back collar studs sooner or
later. You've had to do with three sets of Indians to-day, the
Bhattacharyas, Aziz, and this chap, and it really isn't a
coincidence that they've all let you down.
subQuotationList:
["I'm afraid so. Incredible, aren't they, even the best of them?
They're all   they all forget their back collar studs sooner or
later. You've had to do with three sets of Indians to-day, the
Bhattacharyas, Aziz, and this chap, and it really isn't a
coincidence that they've all let you down."]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: I like Aziz, Aziz is my real friend,
subQuotationList: ['I like Aziz, Aziz is my real friend,']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
When the animal runs into us the Nawab loses his head, deserts
his unfortunate chauffeur, intrudes upon Miss Derek . . . no great
crimes, no great crimes, but no white man would have done it.
subQuotationList: ['When the animal runs into us the Nawab loses his head, deserts\nhis unfortunate chauffeur, intrudes upon Miss Derek . . . no great\ncrimes, no great crimes, but no white man would have done it.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The Nawab Badahur', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested'], ['The Nawab Badahur'], ['The Nawab Badahur'], ['The Nawab Badahur'], ['Miss Derek']]]

quoteText: What animal?
subQuotationList: ['What animal?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Oh, we had a small accident on the Marabar road. Adela thinks it
was a hyena.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, we had a small accident on the Marabar road. Adela thinks it\nwas a hyena.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: An accident?
subQuotationList: ['An accident?']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Nothing; no one hurt. Our excellent host awoke much rattled from
his dreams, appeared to think it was our fault, and chanted exactly,
exactly.
subQuotationList: ['Nothing; no one hurt. Our excellent host awoke much rattled from\nhis dreams, appeared to think it was our fault, and chanted exactly,\nexactly.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The Nawab Badahur'], ['The Nawab Badahur'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: A ghost!
subQuotationList: ['A ghost!']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Yes, nothing criminal, but there's the native,
and there's one of the reasons why we don't admit him to our clubs,
and how a decent girl like Miss Derek can take service under
natives puzzles me. . . . But I must get on with my work. Krishna!
subQuotationList:
['Yes, nothing criminal,', "but there's the native,
and there's one of the reasons why we don't admit him to our clubs,
and how a decent girl like Miss Derek can take service under
natives puzzles me. . . . But I must get on with my work. Krishna!"]
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
Will you play Patience with your future mother-in-law, dear Adela,
or does it seem too tame?
subQuotationList: ['Will you play Patience with your future mother-in-law, dear Adela,\nor does it seem too tame?']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
I should like to   I don't feel a bit excited   I'm just glad it's
settled up at last, but I'm not conscious of vast changes. We are
all three the same people still.
subQuotationList: ["I should like to   I don't feel a bit excited   I'm just glad it's\nsettled up at last, but I'm not conscious of vast changes. We are\nall three the same people still."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: That's much the best feeling to have.
subQuotationList: ["That's much the best feeling to have."]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: I suppose so,
subQuotationList: ['I suppose so,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
I feared at Mr. Fielding's that it might be settled the other way
. . . black knave on a red queen. . . .
subQuotationList: ["I feared at Mr. Fielding's that it might be settled the other way\n. . . black knave on a red queen. . . ."]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
You heard me tell Aziz and Godbole I wasn't
stopping in their country. I didn't mean it, so why did I say it?
I feel I haven't been   frank enough, attentive enough, or something.
It's as if I got everything out of proportion. You have been so
very good to me, and I meant to be good when I sailed, but somehow
I haven't been. . . . Mrs. Moore, if one isn't absolutely honest,
what is the use of existing?
subQuotationList:
["You heard me tell Aziz and Godbole I wasn't
stopping in their country. I didn't mean it, so why did I say it?
I feel I haven't been   frank enough, attentive enough, or something.
It's as if I got everything out of proportion. You have been so
very good to me, and I meant to be good when I sailed, but somehow
I haven't been. . . . Mrs. Moore, if one isn't absolutely honest,
what is the use of existing?"]
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mrs. Moore'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Professor Godbole'], ['Professor Godbole', 'Dr. Aziz'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore']]]

subQuotationList: ["I wouldn't worry,", "It's partly the odd surroundings;\nyou and I keep on attending to trifles instead of what's important;\nwe are what the people here call    new.'"]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: You mean that my bothers are mixed up with India?
subQuotationList: ['You mean that my bothers are mixed up with India?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: India's
subQuotationList: ["India's"]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: What made you call it a ghost?
subQuotationList: ['What made you call it a ghost?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Call what a ghost?
subQuotationList: ['Call what a ghost?']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
The animal thing that hit us. Didn't you say    Oh, a ghost,' in
passing.
subQuotationList: ["The animal thing that hit us. Didn't you say    Oh, a ghost,' in\npassing."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I couldn't have been thinking of what I was saying.
subQuotationList: ["I couldn't have been thinking of what I was saying."]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: It was probably a hyena, as a matter of fact.
subQuotationList: ['It was probably a hyena, as a matter of fact.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Ah, very likely.
subQuotationList: ['Ah, very likely.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
If I had been killed, what
matter? it must happen sometime; but they who trusted me
subQuotationList: ['If I had been killed, what\nmatter? it must happen sometime; but they who trusted me']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText:
You know,
Nureddin, you know, my
dear fellow, we Moslems simply must get rid of these superstitions,
or India will never advance. How long must I hear of the savage
pig upon the Marabar Road? Your grandfather belongs to another generation, and I respect and
love the old gentleman, as you know. I say nothing against him,
only that it is wrong for us, because we are young. I want you to
promise me   Nureddin, are you listening?   not to believe in Evil
Spirits, and if I die (for my health grows very weak) to bring up
my three children to disbelieve in them too.
subQuotationList:
['You know,
Nureddin,', 'you know, my
dear fellow, we Moslems simply must get rid of these superstitions,
or India will never advance. How long must I hear of the savage
pig upon the Marabar Road?', 'Your grandfather belongs to another generation, and I respect and
love the old gentleman, as you know. I say nothing against him,
only that it is wrong for us, because we are young. I want you to
promise me   Nureddin, are you listening?   not to believe in Evil
Spirits, and if I die (for my health grows very weak) to bring up
my three children to disbelieve in them too.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Red ten on a black knave,
subQuotationList: ['Red ten on a black knave,']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: No Englishman understands us except Mr. Fielding,
subQuotationList: ['No Englishman understands us except Mr. Fielding,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
but how shall I see him again? If he entered this room
the disgrace of it would kill me.
subQuotationList: ['but how shall I see him again? If he entered this room\nthe disgrace of it would kill me.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
That's
India all over . . . how like us . . . there we are . . .
subQuotationList: ["That's\nIndia all over . . . how like us . . . there we are . . ."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Hassan!
subQuotationList: ['Hassan!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Look at those flies, brother;
subQuotationList: ['Look at those flies, brother;']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Huzoor, those are flies.
subQuotationList: ['Huzoor, those are flies.']
speaker: Hassan

quoteText: Good, good, they are, excellent, but why have I called you?
subQuotationList: ['Good, good, they are, excellent, but why have I called you?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: To drive them elsewhere,
subQuotationList: ['To drive them elsewhere,']
speaker: Hassan

quoteText: Driven elsewhere, they always return.
subQuotationList: ['Driven elsewhere, they always return.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Huzoor.
subQuotationList: ['Huzoor.']
speaker: Hassan

quoteText:
You must make some arrangement against flies; that is why you are
my servant,
subQuotationList: ['You must make some arrangement against flies; that is why you are\nmy servant,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Good, very good. Now what have you to do?
subQuotationList: ['Good, very good. Now what have you to do?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Kill flies.
