subQuotationList: ['Kill flies.']
speaker: Hassan

quoteText: Good. Do it.
subQuotationList: ['Good. Do it.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Aziz, my dear fellow, we are greatly concerned,
subQuotationList: ['Aziz, my dear fellow, we are greatly concerned,']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: When a doctor falls ill it is a serious matter,
subQuotationList: ['When a doctor falls ill it is a serious matter,']
speaker: Syed Mohammed
referringExpression: said the voice of Mr Syed Mohammed

quoteText: When an engineer falls ill, it is equally important,
subQuotationList: ['When an engineer falls ill, it is equally important,']
speaker: Mr. Haq
referringExpression: said the voice of Mr Haq

quoteText: Oh yes, we are all jolly important, our salaries prove it.
subQuotationList: ['Oh yes, we are all jolly important, our salaries prove it.']
speaker: Syed Mohammed

quoteText:
Dr. Aziz took tea with our Principal last Thursday afternoon, Professor Godbole, who also
attended, has sickened too, which seems rather a curious thing,
sir, does it not?
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Aziz took tea with our Principal last Thursday afternoon,', 'Professor Godbole, who also\nattended, has sickened too, which seems rather a curious thing,\nsir, does it not?']
speaker: Rafi

quoteText: Humbug!
subQuotationList: ['Humbug!']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: Humbug, most certainly,
subQuotationList: ['Humbug, most certainly,']
speaker: _group

quoteText:
Is Professor Godbole ill? I am sincerely sorry. How do you
do, Mr. Syed Mohammed, Mr. Haq? How very kind of you to enquire
after my health! How do you do, Hamidullah? But you bring me bad
news. What is wrong with him, the excellent fellow?
subQuotationList:
['Is Professor Godbole ill?', 'I am sincerely sorry.', 'How do you
do, Mr. Syed Mohammed, Mr. Haq? How very kind of you to enquire
after my health! How do you do, Hamidullah? But you bring me bad
news. What is wrong with him, the excellent fellow?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Why don't you answer, Rafi? You're the great authority,
subQuotationList: ["Why don't you answer, Rafi? You're the great authority,"]
speaker: Syed Mohammed

quoteText:
Yes, Rafi's the great man, Rafi
is the Sherlock Holmes of Chandrapore. Speak up, Rafi.
subQuotationList: ["Yes, Rafi's the great man,", 'Rafi\nis the Sherlock Holmes of Chandrapore. Speak up, Rafi.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: Diarrh  a,
subQuotationList: ['Diarrh  a,']
speaker: Rafi

quoteText:
If this is so, this is a very serious thing: this is scarcely the
end of March. Why have I not been informed?
subQuotationList: ['If this is so, this is a very serious thing: this is scarcely the\nend of March. Why have I not been informed?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Dr. Panna Lal attends him, sir.
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Panna Lal attends him, sir.']
speaker: Rafi

quoteText:
Oh yes, both Hindus; there we have it; they hang together like
flies and keep everything dark. Rafi, come here. Sit down. Tell me
all the details. Is there vomiting also?
subQuotationList: ['Oh yes, both Hindus; there we have it; they hang together like\nflies and keep everything dark. Rafi, come here. Sit down. Tell me\nall the details. Is there vomiting also?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Oh yes indeed, sir, and the serious pains.
subQuotationList: ['Oh yes indeed, sir, and the serious pains.']
speaker: Rafi

quoteText: That settles it. In twenty-four hours he will be dead.
subQuotationList: ['That settles it. In twenty-four hours he will be dead.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: All illness proceeds from Hindus,
subQuotationList: ['All illness proceeds from Hindus,']
speaker: Mr. Haq

quoteText:
That is exactly my
own view.
subQuotationList: ['That is exactly my\nown view.']
speaker: Syed Mohammed

quoteText:
Aziz,
Aziz, my dear boy, we must be going, we are already late. Get well
quickly, for I do not know what our little circle would do without
you.
subQuotationList:
['Aziz,
Aziz, my dear boy, we must be going, we are already late. Get well
quickly, for I do not know what our little circle would do without
you.']
speaker: Mr. Haq
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah'], ['Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah'], ['Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah', 'Mr. Haq', 'Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz']]]

quoteText: I shall not forget those affectionate words,
subQuotationList: ['I shall not forget those affectionate words,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Add mine to them,
subQuotationList: ['Add mine to them,']
speaker: Syed Mohammed

quoteText: Thank you, Mr. Syed Mohammed, I will.
subQuotationList: ['Thank you, Mr. Syed Mohammed, I will.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: And mine,
subQuotationList: ['And mine,']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: And, sir, accept mine,
subQuotationList: ['And, sir, accept mine,']

Gentlemen, you will excuse, I have come to enquire by Major
Callendar's orders,
subQuotationList: ["Gentlemen, you will excuse, I have come to enquire by Major\nCallendar's orders,"]

quoteText: Here he lies,

addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

subQuotationList: ['Your hand also, please.', 'Some temperature.']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal
referringExpression: He took it gazed at the flies on the ceiling and finally announced

How is
stomach? how head?
subQuotationList: ['How is\nstomach?', 'how head?']

This is a great relief to us, it is very good of you to call,
Doctor Sahib,
subQuotationList: ['This is a great relief to us, it is very good of you to call,\nDoctor Sahib,']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText: We know how busy you are.
subQuotationList: ['We know how busy you are.']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText: Yes, that is true.

quoteText:
He has not a minute, he is due double sharp at Government College
now,

quoteText: You attend Professor Godbole there perhaps?
subQuotationList: ['You attend Professor Godbole there perhaps?']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText: We hope his diarrh  a is ceasing.

speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText:
We are in some anxiety over him   he and Dr. Aziz are great friends.
If you could tell us the name of his complaint we should be grateful
to you.
subQuotationList: ['We are in some anxiety over him   he and Dr. Aziz are great friends.\nIf you could tell us the name of his complaint we should be grateful\nto you.']

quoteText: H  morrhoids.
subQuotationList: ['H  morrhoids.']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText: And so much, my dear Rafi, for your cholera,
subQuotationList: ['And so much, my dear Rafi, for your cholera,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Cholera, cholera, what next, what now? Who spreads such untrue reports about my patients?
subQuotationList: ['Cholera, cholera, what next, what now?', 'Who spreads such untrue reports about my patients?']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText:
I hear cholera, I hear bubonic plague, I hear every species of
lie. Where will it end, I ask myself sometimes. This city is full
of misstatements, and the originators of them ought to be discovered
and punished authoritatively.
subQuotationList:
['I hear cholera, I hear bubonic plague, I hear every species of
lie. Where will it end, I ask myself sometimes. This city is full
of misstatements, and the originators of them ought to be discovered
and punished authoritatively.']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText:
Rafi, do you hear that? Now why do you stuff us up with all this
humbug?
subQuotationList: ['Rafi, do you hear that? Now why do you stuff us up with all this\nhumbug?']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText: That is no reason you should bring a charge against a doctor,

speaker: Ram Chand

quoteText: Exactly, exactly,
subQuotationList: ['Exactly, exactly,']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText:

apologize properly, Rafi, I can see your uncle wishes it, You have not yet said that you are sorry for the trouble you have
caused this gentleman by your carelessness.
subQuotationList: ['You must\napologize properly, Rafi, I can see your uncle wishes it,', 'You have not yet said that you are sorry for the trouble you have\ncaused this gentleman by your carelessness.']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

subQuotationList: ['It is only a boy,']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText: Even boys must learn,
subQuotationList: ['Even boys must learn,']
speaker: Ram Chand

quoteText: Your own son failing to pass the lowest standard, I think,
subQuotationList: ['Your own son failing to pass the lowest standard, I think,']
speaker: Syed Mohammed

quoteText:
Oh, indeed? Oh yes, perhaps. He has not the advantage of a relative
in the Prosperity Printing Press.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, indeed? Oh yes, perhaps. He has not the advantage of a relative\nin the Prosperity Printing Press.']

Nor you the advantage of conducting their cases in the Courts any
longer.

I say!
Is he ill or isn't he ill?

addressees: ['Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: It is good of Mr. Fielding to condescend to visit our friend, We are touched by this great kindness.

Don't talk to him like that, he doesn't want it, and he doesn't

come here. Sit down again. I'm delighted you could come with Mr.
Hamidullah, my dear boy; it will help me to recover, seeing you.

subQuotationList: ['Why, no! There are six people present in my small room already.\nPlease remain seated, if you will excuse the informality.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
addressees: ['Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: He is ill and he is not ill, And I suppose that most of us are in that same case.
subQuotationList: ['He is ill and he is not ill,', 'And I suppose that most of us are in that same case.']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText:
The whole world looks to be dying, still it doesn't die, so we
must assume the existence of a beneficent Providence.
subQuotationList: ["The whole world looks to be dying, still it doesn't die, so we\nmust assume the existence of a beneficent Providence."]
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText: Oh, that is true, how true!
subQuotationList: ['Oh, that is true, how true!']
speaker: Mr. Haq
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: Does Mr. Fielding think it's true?.
subQuotationList: ["Does Mr. Fielding think it's true?."]
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText: Think which true? The world isn't dying. I'm certain of that!
subQuotationList: ["Think which true? The world isn't dying. I'm certain of that!"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: No, no   the existence of Providence.
subQuotationList: ['No, no   the existence of Providence.']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText: Well, I don't believe in Providence.
subQuotationList: ["Well, I don't believe in Providence."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: But how then can you believe in God?
subQuotationList: ['But how then can you believe in God?']
speaker: Syed Mohammed
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: I don't believe in God.
subQuotationList: ["I don't believe in God."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText:
Is it correct that
most are atheists in England now?
subQuotationList: ['Is it correct that\nmost are atheists in England now?']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText:
The educated thoughtful people? I should say so, though they don't
like the name. The truth is that the West doesn't bother much over
belief and disbelief in these days. Fifty years ago, or even when
you and I were young, much more fuss was made.
subQuotationList:
["The educated thoughtful people? I should say so, though they don't
like the name. The truth is that the West doesn't bother much over
belief and disbelief in these days. Fifty years ago, or even when
you and I were young, much more fuss was made."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: And does not morality also decline?
subQuotationList: ['And does not morality also decline?']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText:
It depends what you call   yes, yes, I suppose morality does
decline.
subQuotationList: ['It depends what you call   yes, yes, I suppose morality does\ndecline.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText:
Excuse the question, but if this is the case, how is England
justified in holding India?
subQuotationList: ['Excuse the question, but if this is the case, how is England\njustified in holding India?']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText:
It's a question I can't get my
mind on to, I'm out here personally because I needed
a job. I cannot tell you why England is here or whether she ought
to be here. It's beyond me.
subQuotationList:
["It's a question I can't get my
mind on to,", "I'm out here personally because I needed
a job. I cannot tell you why England is here or whether she ought
to be here. It's beyond me."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: Well-qualified Indians also need jobs in the educational.
subQuotationList: ['Well-qualified Indians also need jobs in the educational.']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText: I guess they do; I got in first,
subQuotationList: ['I guess they do; I got in first,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText:
Then excuse me again   is it fair an Englishman should occupy one
when Indians are available? Of course I mean nothing personally.
Personally we are delighted you should be here, and we benefit
greatly by this frank talk.
subQuotationList:
['Then excuse me again   is it fair an Englishman should occupy one
when Indians are available? Of course I mean nothing personally.
Personally we are delighted you should be here, and we benefit
greatly by this frank talk.']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Hamidullah'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Hamidullah']]]

quoteText:
I'm delighted
to be here too   that's my answer, there's my only excuse. I can't
tell you anything about fairness. It mayn't have been fair I should
have been born. I take up some other fellow's air, don't I, whenever
I breathe? Still, I'm glad it's happened, and I'm glad I'm out
here. However big a badmash one is   if one's happy in consequence,
that is some justification.
subQuotationList:
["I'm delighted
to be here too   that's my answer, there's my only excuse. I can't
tell you anything about fairness. It mayn't have been fair I should
have been born. I take up some other fellow's air, don't I, whenever
I breathe? Still, I'm glad it's happened, and I'm glad I'm out
here. However big a badmash one is   if one's happy in consequence,
that is some justification."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText:
And those Englishmen who are not delighted
to be in India   have they no excuse?
subQuotationList: ['And those Englishmen who are not delighted\nto be in India   have they no excuse?']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText: None. Chuck 'em out.
subQuotationList: ["None. Chuck 'em out."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: It may be difficult to separate them from the rest,
subQuotationList: ['It may be difficult to separate them from the rest,']
speaker: Hamidullah
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi']

quoteText:
Worse than difficult, wrong, No Indian
gentleman approves chucking out as a proper thing. Here we differ
from those other nations. We are so spiritual.
subQuotationList: ['Worse than difficult, wrong,', 'No Indian\ngentleman approves chucking out as a proper thing. Here we differ\nfrom those other nations. We are so spiritual.']
speaker: Ram Chand
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: Oh that is true, how true!
subQuotationList: ['Oh that is true, how true!']
speaker: Mr. Haq
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText:
Is it true, Mr. Haq? I don't consider us spiritual. We can't
co-ordinate, we can't co-ordinate, it only comes to that. We can't
keep engagements, we can't catch trains. What more than this is
the so-called spirituality of India? You and I ought to be at the
Committee of Notables, we're not; our friend Dr. Lal ought to be
with his patients, he isn't. So we go on, and so we shall continue
to go, I think, until the end of time.
subQuotationList:
["Is it true, Mr. Haq? I don't consider us spiritual. We can't
co-ordinate, we can't co-ordinate, it only comes to that. We can't
keep engagements, we can't catch trains. What more than this is
the so-called spirituality of India? You and I ought to be at the
Committee of Notables, we're not; our friend Dr. Lal ought to be
with his patients, he isn't. So we go on, and so we shall continue
to go, I think, until the end of time."]
speaker: Ram Chand
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Haq'], ['Mr. Haq'], ['Mr. Haq', 'Ram Chand'], ['Dr. Panna Lal'], ['Dr. Panna Lal'], ['Dr. Panna Lal']]]

quoteText:
It is not the end of time, it is scarcely ten-thirty, ha, ha! Gentlemen,
if I may be allowed to say a few words, what an interesting talk,
also thankfulness and gratitude to Mr. Fielding in the first place
teaches our sons and gives them all the great benefits of his
experience and judgment
subQuotationList:
['It is not the end of time, it is scarcely ten-thirty, ha, ha!', 'Gentlemen,
if I may be allowed to say a few words, what an interesting talk,
also thankfulness and gratitude to Mr. Fielding in the first place
teaches our sons and gives them all the great benefits of his
experience and judgment']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText: Dr. Lal!
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Lal!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
addressees: ['Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: Dr. Aziz?
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Aziz?']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText: You sit on my leg.
subQuotationList: ['You sit on my leg.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
addressees: ['Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: I beg pardon, but some might say your leg kicks.
subQuotationList: ['I beg pardon, but some might say your leg kicks.']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText: Come along, we tire the invalid in either case,
subQuotationList: ['Come along, we tire the invalid in either case,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding
addressees: ['Dr. Aziz', 'Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Hassan', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah'], ['Dr. Aziz']]]

quoteText:
Aziz has a high opinion of you, he only did not speak because of
his illness.
subQuotationList: ['Aziz has a high opinion of you, he only did not speak because of\nhis illness.']
speaker: _unknowable
addressees: ['Ram Chand', 'Dr. Panna Lal', 'Cyril Fielding', 'Mr. Haq', 'Syed Mohammed', 'Rafi', 'Hamidullah']

quoteText: I quite understand,
subQuotationList: ['I quite understand,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Here's your home, Here's the celebrated hospitality of the East. Look
at the flies. Look at the chunam coming off the walls. Isn't it
jolly? Now I suppose you want to be off, having seen an Oriental
interior.
subQuotationList:
["Here's your home,", "Here's the celebrated hospitality of the East. Look
at the flies. Look at the chunam coming off the walls. Isn't it
jolly? Now I suppose you want to be off, having seen an Oriental
interior."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Anyhow, you want to rest.
subQuotationList: ['Anyhow, you want to rest.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I can rest the whole day, thanks to worthy Dr. Lal. Major
Callendar's spy, I suppose you know, but this time it didn't work.
I am allowed to have a slight temperature.
subQuotationList: ["I can rest the whole day, thanks to worthy Dr. Lal. Major\nCallendar's spy, I suppose you know, but this time it didn't work.\nI am allowed to have a slight temperature."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Callendar doesn't trust anyone, English or Indian: that's his
character, and I wish you weren't under him; but you are, and
that's that.
subQuotationList: ["Callendar doesn't trust anyone, English or Indian: that's his\ncharacter, and I wish you weren't under him; but you are, and\nthat's that."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Before you go, for you are evidently in a great hurry, will you
please unlock that drawer? Do you see a piece of brown paper at
the top?
subQuotationList: ['Before you go, for you are evidently in a great hurry, will you\nplease unlock that drawer? Do you see a piece of brown paper at\nthe top?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Open it.
subQuotationList: ['Open it.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Who is this?
subQuotationList: ['Who is this?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
She was my wife. You are the first Englishman she has ever come
before. Now put her photograph away.
subQuotationList: ['She was my wife. You are the first Englishman she has ever come\nbefore. Now put her photograph away.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Really, I don't know why you pay me this great
compliment, Aziz, but I do appreciate it.
subQuotationList: ["Really, I don't know why you pay me this great\ncompliment, Aziz, but I do appreciate it."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Oh, it's nothing, she was not a highly educated woman or even
beautiful, but put it away. You would have seen her, so why should
you not see her photograph?
subQuotationList: ["Oh, it's nothing, she was not a highly educated woman or even\nbeautiful, but put it away. You would have seen her, so why should\nyou not see her photograph?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: You would have allowed me to see her?
subQuotationList: ['You would have allowed me to see her?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Why not? I believe in the purdah, but I should have told her you
were my brother, and she would have seen you. Hamidullah saw her,
and several others.
subQuotationList: ['Why not? I believe in the purdah, but I should have told her you\nwere my brother, and she would have seen you. Hamidullah saw her,\nand several others.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Did she think they were your brothers?
subQuotationList: ['Did she think they were your brothers?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Of course not, but the word exists and is convenient. All men are
my brothers, and as soon as one behaves as such he may see my
wife.
subQuotationList: ['Of course not, but the word exists and is convenient. All men are\nmy brothers, and as soon as one behaves as such he may see my\nwife.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
And when the whole world behaves as such, there will be no more
purdah?
subQuotationList: ['And when the whole world behaves as such, there will be no more\npurdah?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
It is because you can say and feel such a remark as that, that I
show you the photograph,
subQuotationList: ['It is because you can say and feel such a remark as that, that I\nshow you the photograph,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
It is beyond the power of most men. It is because you behave well
while I behave badly that I show it you. I never expected you to
come back just now when I called you. I thought, Mr. Fielding, no one can ever
realize how much kindness we Indians need, we do not even realize
it ourselves. But we know when it has been given. We do not forget,
though we may seem to. Kindness, more kindness, and even after that
more kindness. I assure you it is the only hope.
subQuotationList:
['It is beyond the power of most men. It is because you behave well
while I behave badly that I show it you. I never expected you to
come back just now when I called you. I thought,', 'Mr. Fielding, no one can ever
realize how much kindness we Indians need, we do not even realize
it ourselves. But we know when it has been given. We do not forget,
though we may seem to. Kindness, more kindness, and even after that
more kindness. I assure you it is the only hope.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding']], [['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText:
We can't build up India except on what we feel.
What is the use of all these reforms, and Conciliation Committees
for Mohurram, and shall we cut the tazia short or shall we carry
it another route, and Councils of Notables and official parties
where the English sneer at our skins?
subQuotationList:
["We can't build up India except on what we feel.
What is the use of all these reforms, and Conciliation Committees
for Mohurram, and shall we cut the tazia short or shall we carry
it another route, and Councils of Notables and official parties
where the English sneer at our skins?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
It's beginning at the wrong end, isn't it? I know, but institutions
and the governments don't.
subQuotationList: ["It's beginning at the wrong end, isn't it? I know, but institutions\nand the governments don't."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Put her away, she is of no importance, she is dead, I showed her to you because I have nothing else to show.
You may look round the whole of my bungalow now, and empty
everything. I have no other secrets, my three children live away
with their grandmamma, and that is all.
subQuotationList:
['Put her away, she is of no importance, she is dead,', 'I showed her to you because I have nothing else to show.
You may look round the whole of my bungalow now, and empty
everything. I have no other secrets, my three children live away
with their grandmamma, and that is all.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I shall not really be intimate with this fellow, nor with anyone.
subQuotationList: ['I shall not really be intimate with this fellow,', 'nor with anyone.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: How did you like the two ladies you met last Thursday?
subQuotationList: ['How did you like the two ladies you met last Thursday?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: How do you like Englishwomen generally?
subQuotationList: ['How do you like Englishwomen generally?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Hamidullah liked them in England. Here we never look at them. Oh
no, much too careful. Let's talk of something else.
subQuotationList: ["Hamidullah liked them in England. Here we never look at them. Oh\nno, much too careful. Let's talk of something else."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Hamidullah's right: they are much nicer in England. There's
something that doesn't suit them out here.
subQuotationList: ["Hamidullah's right: they are much nicer in England. There's\nsomething that doesn't suit them out here."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Why are you not married?
subQuotationList: ['Why are you not married?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Because I have more or
less come through without it, I was thinking of telling you a little about myself some day if
I can make it interesting enough. The lady I liked wouldn't marry
me   that is the main point, but that's fifteen years ago and now
means nothing.
subQuotationList:
['Because I have more or
less come through without it,', "I was thinking of telling you a little about myself some day if
I can make it interesting enough. The lady I liked wouldn't marry
me   that is the main point, but that's fifteen years ago and now
means nothing."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: But you haven't children.
subQuotationList: ["But you haven't children."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: None.
subQuotationList: ['None.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Excuse the following question: have you any illegitimate children?
subQuotationList: ['Excuse the following question: have you any illegitimate children?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: No. I'd willingly tell you if I had.
subQuotationList: ["No. I'd willingly tell you if I had."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Then your name will entirely die out.
subQuotationList: ['Then your name will entirely die out.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: It must.
subQuotationList: ['It must.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Well.
subQuotationList: ['Well.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
This indifference is what the Oriental
will never understand.
subQuotationList: ['This indifference is what the Oriental\nwill never understand.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I don't care for children.
subQuotationList: ["I don't care for children."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Caring has nothing to do with it,
subQuotationList: ['Caring has nothing to do with it,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I don't feel their absence, I don't want them weeping around my
death-bed and being polite about me afterwards, which I believe is
the general notion. I'd far rather leave a thought behind me than
a child. Other people can have children. No obligation, with
England getting so chock-a-block and overrunning India for jobs.
subQuotationList:
["I don't feel their absence, I don't want them weeping around my
death-bed and being polite about me afterwards, which I believe is
the general notion. I'd far rather leave a thought behind me than
a child. Other people can have children. No obligation, with
England getting so chock-a-block and overrunning India for jobs."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Why don't you marry Miss Quested?
subQuotationList: ["Why don't you marry Miss Quested?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Good God! why, the girl's a prig.
subQuotationList: ["Good God! why, the girl's a prig."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Prig, prig? Kindly explain. Isn't that a bad word?
subQuotationList: ["Prig, prig? Kindly explain. Isn't that a bad word?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Oh, I don't know her, but she struck me as one of the more pathetic
products of Western education. She depresses me.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, I don't know her, but she struck me as one of the more pathetic\nproducts of Western education. She depresses me."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: But prig, Mr. Fielding? How's that?
subQuotationList: ["But prig, Mr. Fielding? How's that?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
She goes on and on as if she's at a lecture   trying ever so hard
to understand India and life, and occasionally taking a note.
subQuotationList: ["She goes on and on as if she's at a lecture   trying ever so hard\nto understand India and life, and occasionally taking a note."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I thought her so nice and sincere.
subQuotationList: ['I thought her so nice and sincere.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
So she probably is, But I can't
marry her if I wanted to, for she has just become engaged to the
City Magistrate.
subQuotationList: ['So she probably is,', "But I can't\nmarry her if I wanted to, for she has just become engaged to the\nCity Magistrate."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Has she indeed? I am so glad!
subQuotationList: ['Has she indeed? I am so glad!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
It's the old mother's doing. She was afraid her dear boy would
choose for himself, so she brought out the girl on purpose, and
flung them together until it happened.
subQuotationList: ["It's the old mother's doing. She was afraid her dear boy would\nchoose for himself, so she brought out the girl on purpose, and\nflung them together until it happened."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: Mrs. Moore did not mention that to me among her plans.
subQuotationList: ['Mrs. Moore did not mention that to me among her plans.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I may have got it wrong   I'm out of club gossip. But anyhow they're
engaged to be married.
subQuotationList: ["I may have got it wrong   I'm out of club gossip. But anyhow they're\nengaged to be married."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Yes, you're out of it, my poor chap, No Miss Quested
for Mr. Fielding. However, she was not beautiful. She has
practically no breasts, if you come to think of it.
subQuotationList: ["Yes, you're out of it, my poor chap,", 'No Miss Quested\nfor Mr. Fielding. However, she was not beautiful. She has\npractically no breasts, if you come to think of it.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding']], [['Adela Quested'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText:
For the City Magistrate they shall be sufficient perhaps, and he
for her. For you I shall arrange a lady with breasts like mangoes.
. . .
subQuotationList: ['For the City Magistrate they shall be sufficient perhaps, and he\nfor her. For you I shall arrange a lady with breasts like mangoes.\n. . .']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: No, you won't.
subQuotationList: ["No, you won't."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I will not really, and besides your position makes it dangerous
for you.
subQuotationList: ['I will not really, and besides your position makes it dangerous\nfor you.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
You can't be
too careful in every way, Mr. Fielding; whatever you say or do in
this damned country there is always some envious fellow on the
look-out. You may be surprised to know that there were at least
three spies sitting here when you came to enquire. I was really a
good deal upset that you talked in that fashion about God. They
will certainly report it.
subQuotationList:
["You can't be
too careful in every way, Mr. Fielding; whatever you say or do in
this damned country there is always some envious fellow on the
look-out. You may be surprised to know that there were at least
three spies sitting here when you came to enquire. I was really a
good deal upset that you talked in that fashion about God. They
will certainly report it."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText: To whom?
subQuotationList: ['To whom?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
That's all very well, but you spoke against morality also, and
you said you had come to take other people's jobs. All that was
very unwise. This is an awful place for scandal. Why, actually one
of your own pupils was listening.
subQuotationList:
["That's all very well, but you spoke against morality also, and
you said you had come to take other people's jobs. All that was
very unwise. This is an awful place for scandal. Why, actually one
of your own pupils was listening."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Thanks for telling me that; yes, I must try and be more careful.
If I'm interested, I'm apt to forget myself. Still, it doesn't do
real harm.
subQuotationList: ["Thanks for telling me that; yes, I must try and be more careful.\nIf I'm interested, I'm apt to forget myself. Still, it doesn't do\nreal harm."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: But speaking out may get you into trouble.
subQuotationList: ['But speaking out may get you into trouble.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: It's often done so in the past.
subQuotationList: ["It's often done so in the past."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
There, listen to that! But the end of it might be that you lost
your job.
subQuotationList: ['There, listen to that! But the end of it might be that you lost\nyour job.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: If I do, I do. I shall survive it. I travel light.
subQuotationList: ['If I do, I do. I shall survive it. I travel light.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Travel light! You are a most extraordinary race, Is it your climate, or what?
subQuotationList: ['Travel light! You are a most extraordinary race,', 'Is it your climate, or what?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Plenty of Indians travel light too   saddhus and such. It's one of
the things I admire about your country. Any man can travel light
until he has a wife or children. That's part of my case against
marriage. I'm a holy man minus the holiness. Hand that on to your
three spies, and tell them to put it in their pipes.
subQuotationList:
["Plenty of Indians travel light too   saddhus and such. It's one of
the things I admire about your country. Any man can travel light
until he has a wife or children. That's part of my case against
marriage. I'm a holy man minus the holiness. Hand that on to your
three spies, and tell them to put it in their pipes."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I can't be sacked from my job, because my job's Education. I
believe in teaching people to be individuals, and to understand
other individuals. It's the only thing I do believe in. At
Government College, I mix it up with trigonometry, and so on. When
I'm a saddhu, I shall mix it up with something else.
subQuotationList:
["I can't be sacked from my job, because my job's Education. I
believe in teaching people to be individuals, and to understand
other individuals. It's the only thing I do believe in. At
Government College, I mix it up with trigonometry, and so on. When
I'm a saddhu, I shall mix it up with something else."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
You might tell your servant to bring my horse. He doesn't seem to
appreciate my Urdu.
subQuotationList: ["You might tell your servant to bring my horse. He doesn't seem to\nappreciate my Urdu."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I know. I gave him orders not to. Such are the tricks we play on
unfortunate Englishmen. Poor Mr. Fielding! But I will release you
now. Oh dear! With the exception of yourself and Hamidullah, I have
no one to talk to in this place. You like Hamidullah, don't you?
subQuotationList:
["I know. I gave him orders not to. Such are the tricks we play on
unfortunate Englishmen. Poor Mr. Fielding! But I will release you
now. Oh dear! With the exception of yourself and Hamidullah, I have
no one to talk to in this place. You like Hamidullah, don't you?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Very much.
subQuotationList: ['Very much.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Do you promise to come at once to us when you are in trouble?
subQuotationList: ['Do you promise to come at once to us when you are in trouble?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I never can be in trouble.
subQuotationList: ['I never can be in trouble.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: There goes a queer chap, I trust he won't come to grief,
subQuotationList: ["There goes a queer chap, I trust he won't come to grief,"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
But
you've come, after all. Oh how very very kind of you! This is the happiest moment in all my life.
subQuotationList: ["But\nyou've come, after all. Oh how very very kind of you!", 'This is the happiest moment in all my life.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
You don't require tickets   please stop your servant. There are no
tickets on the Marabar branch line; it is its peculiarity. You come
to the carriage and rest till Mr. Fielding joins us. Did you know
you are to travel purdah? Will you like that?
subQuotationList:
["You don't require tickets   please stop your servant. There are no
tickets on the Marabar branch line; it is its peculiarity. You come
to the carriage and rest till Mr. Fielding joins us. Did you know
you are to travel purdah? Will you like that?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText:
Send back your servant, He is unnecessary. Then
we shall all be Moslems together.
subQuotationList: ['Send back your servant,', 'He is unnecessary. Then\nwe shall all be Moslems together.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
And he is such a horrible servant. Antony, you can go; we don't
want you,
subQuotationList: ["And he is such a horrible servant. Antony, you can go; we don't\nwant you,"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Master told me to come.
subQuotationList: ['Master told me to come.']
speaker: Antony

quoteText: Mistress tells you to go.
subQuotationList: ['Mistress tells you to go.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Master says, keep near the ladies all the morning.
subQuotationList: ['Master says, keep near the ladies all the morning.']
speaker: Antony

quoteText: Well, your ladies won't have you.
subQuotationList: ["Well, your ladies won't have you."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Do
get rid of him, Dr. Aziz!
subQuotationList: ['Do\nget rid of him, Dr. Aziz!']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Mohammed Latif!
subQuotationList: ['Mohammed Latif!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Here is my cousin, Mr. Mohammed Latif. Oh no, don't shake hands.
He is an Indian of the old-fashioned sort, he prefers to salaam.
There, I told you so. Mohammed Latif, how beautifully you salaam.
See, he hasn't understood; he knows no English.
subQuotationList:
["Here is my cousin, Mr. Mohammed Latif. Oh no, don't shake hands.
He is an Indian of the old-fashioned sort, he prefers to salaam.
There, I told you so. Mohammed Latif, how beautifully you salaam.
See, he hasn't understood; he knows no English."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mohammed Latif'], ['Mohammed Latif'], ['Mohammed Latif'], ['Mohammed Latif'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Mohammed Latif'], ['Mohammed Latif'], ['Mohammed Latif']]]

quoteText: You spick lie,
subQuotationList: ['You spick lie,']
speaker: Mohammed Latif

quoteText:
I spick a lie! Oh, jolly good. Isn't he a funny old man? We will
have great jokes with him later. He does all sorts of little
things. He is not nearly as stupid as you think, and awfully poor.
It's lucky ours is a large family.
subQuotationList:
["I spick a lie! Oh, jolly good. Isn't he a funny old man? We will
have great jokes with him later. He does all sorts of little
things. He is not nearly as stupid as you think, and awfully poor.
It's lucky ours is a large family."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mohammed Latif'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore', 'Dr. Aziz'], ['Mohammed Latif'], ['Mohammed Latif'], ['Mohammed Latif'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText:
But you get inside, make yourselves at home; yes,
you lie down.
subQuotationList: ['But you get inside, make yourselves at home; yes,\nyou lie down.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Excuse me, now I must meet our other two guests!
subQuotationList: ['Excuse me, now I must meet our other two guests!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Tell me another time, brother, when I have more leisure, for now,
as I have already explained, we have to give pleasure to non-Moslems.
Three will be Europeans, one a Hindu, which must not be forgotten.
Every attention must be paid to Professor Godbole, lest he feel
that he is inferior to my other guests.
subQuotationList:
['Tell me another time, brother, when I have more leisure, for now,
as I have already explained, we have to give pleasure to non-Moslems.
Three will be Europeans, one a Hindu, which must not be forgotten.
Every attention must be paid to Professor Godbole, lest he feel
that he is inferior to my other guests.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mohammed Latif'], ['Mohammed Latif', 'Dr. Aziz'], ['Professor Godbole'], ['Professor Godbole'], ['Professor Godbole'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText: I will discuss philosophy with him.
subQuotationList: ['I will discuss philosophy with him.']
speaker: Mohammed Latif

quoteText:
That will be kind of you; but the servants are even more important.
We must not convey an impression of disorganization. It can be
done, and I expect you to do it . . .
subQuotationList: ['That will be kind of you; but the servants are even more important.\nWe must not convey an impression of disorganization. It can be\ndone, and I expect you to do it . . .']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Merciful God!
subQuotationList: ['Merciful God!']
speaker: Mohammed Latif

quoteText: We're monkeys, don't worry,
subQuotationList: ["We're monkeys, don't worry,"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Mr. Fielding!
Mr. Fielding!
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Fielding!\nMr. Fielding!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Bad, bad, you have destroyed me.
subQuotationList: ['Bad, bad, you have destroyed me.']
speaker: _unknowable
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Mohammed Latif', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore', 'Professor Godbole']

quoteText: Godbole's pujah did it,
subQuotationList: ["Godbole's pujah did it,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Jump on, I must have you,
subQuotationList: ['Jump on, I must have you,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Right, give a hand.
subQuotationList: ['Right, give a hand.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: He's not to, he'll kill himself,
subQuotationList: ["He's not to, he'll kill himself,"]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: I'm all right, you're all right, don't worry,
subQuotationList: ["I'm all right, you're all right, don't worry,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
referringExpression: He scrambled on to his feet and bawled

quoteText: Mrs. Moore, Miss Quested, our expedition is a ruin.
subQuotationList: ['Mrs. Moore, Miss Quested, our expedition is a ruin.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Get in, get in; you'll kill yourself as well as Mr. Fielding. I
see no ruin.
subQuotationList: ["Get in, get in; you'll kill yourself as well as Mr. Fielding. I\nsee no ruin."]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: How is that? Oh, explain to me!
subQuotationList: ['How is that? Oh, explain to me!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: We shall be all Moslems together now, as you promised.
subQuotationList: ['We shall be all Moslems together now, as you promised.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Get in, Dr. Aziz, you make us giddy, If
they're so foolish as to miss the train, that's their loss, not
ours.
subQuotationList: ['Get in, Dr. Aziz, you make us giddy,', "If\nthey're so foolish as to miss the train, that's their loss, not\nours."]
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Mrs. Moore', 'Adela Quested']], [['Cyril Fielding', 'Professor Godbole'], ['Cyril Fielding', 'Professor Godbole']]]

quoteText: I am to blame. I am the host.
subQuotationList: ['I am to blame. I am the host.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Nonsense, go to your carriage. We're going to have a delightful
time without them.
subQuotationList: ["Nonsense, go to your carriage. We're going to have a delightful\ntime without them."]
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Cyril Fielding', 'Professor Godbole']]]

quoteText:
Mohammed Latif, by the way, what is in these caves, brother? Why
are we all going to see them?
subQuotationList: ['Mohammed Latif, by the way, what is in these caves, brother? Why\nare we all going to see them?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: What a nice cheerful servant! What a relief after Antony!
subQuotationList: ['What a nice cheerful servant! What a relief after Antony!']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: They startle one rather. A strange place to make tea in,
subQuotationList: ['They startle one rather. A strange place to make tea in,']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
I want to sack Antony. His behaviour on the platform has decided
me.
subQuotationList: ['I want to sack Antony. His behaviour on the platform has decided\nme.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Anyhow, we must get a second servant, because at Simla you will
be at the hotel, and I don't think Ronny's Baldeo . . .
subQuotationList: ["Anyhow, we must get a second servant, because at Simla you will\nbe at the hotel, and I don't think Ronny's Baldeo . . ."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Very well, you get another servant, and I'll keep Antony with me.
I am used to his unappetizing ways. He will see me through the Hot
Weather.
subQuotationList: ["Very well, you get another servant, and I'll keep Antony with me.\nI am used to his unappetizing ways. He will see me through the Hot\nWeather."]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
I don't believe in the Hot Weather. People like Major Callendar
who always talk about it   it's in the hope of making one feel
inexperienced and small, like their everlasting,    I've been twenty
years in this country.'
subQuotationList:
["I don't believe in the Hot Weather. People like Major Callendar
who always talk about it   it's in the hope of making one feel
inexperienced and small, like their everlasting,    I've been twenty
years in this country.'"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
I believe in the Hot Weather, but never did I suppose it would
bottle me up as it will.
subQuotationList: ['I believe in the Hot Weather, but never did I suppose it would\nbottle me up as it will.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
I won't be bottled up, I've no patience with
these women here who leave their husbands grilling in the plains.
Mrs. McBryde hasn't stopped down once since she married; she leaves
her quite intelligent husband alone half the year, and then's
surprised she's out of touch with him.
subQuotationList:
["I won't be bottled up,", "I've no patience with
these women here who leave their husbands grilling in the plains.
Mrs. McBryde hasn't stopped down once since she married; she leaves
her quite intelligent husband alone half the year, and then's
surprised she's out of touch with him."]
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Mrs. Mcbryde'], ['Mrs. Mcbryde'], ['Mrs. Mcbryde'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Mrs. Mcbryde'], ['Mr. Mcbryde']]]

quoteText: She has children, you see.
subQuotationList: ['She has children, you see.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: Oh yes, that's true,
subQuotationList: ["Oh yes, that's true,"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
It is the children who are the first consideration. Until they
are grown up, and married off. When that happens one has again the
right to live for oneself   in the plains or the hills, as suits.
subQuotationList: ['It is the children who are the first consideration. Until they\nare grown up, and married off. When that happens one has again the\nright to live for oneself   in the plains or the hills, as suits.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: Oh yes, you're perfectly right. I never thought it out.
subQuotationList: ["Oh yes, you're perfectly right. I never thought it out."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: If one has not become too stupid and old.
subQuotationList: ['If one has not become too stupid and old.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
My idea now is that my cousins shall find me a servant in Simla,
at all events to see me through the wedding, after which Ronny
means to reorganize his staff entirely. He does it very well for
a bachelor; still, when he is married no doubt various changes will
have to be made   his old servants won't want to take their orders
from me, and I don't blame them.
subQuotationList:
["My idea now is that my cousins shall find me a servant in Simla,
at all events to see me through the wedding, after which Ronny
means to reorganize his staff entirely. He does it very well for
a bachelor; still, when he is married no doubt various changes will
have to be made   his old servants won't want to take their orders
from me, and I don't blame them."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Anything to be seen of the hills?
subQuotationList: ['Anything to be seen of the hills?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Only various shades of the dark.
subQuotationList: ['Only various shades of the dark.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: We can't be far from the place where my hyena was.
subQuotationList: ["We can't be far from the place where my hyena was."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Perhaps this is mine; anyhow, the road runs parallel with
the railway.
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps this is mine; anyhow, the road runs parallel with\nthe railway.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
I will fetch you from Simla when it's cool enough. I will unbottle
you in fact, We then see some of
the Mogul stuff   how appalling if we let you miss the Taj!   and then
I will see you off at Bombay. Your last glimpse of this country
really shall be interesting.
subQuotationList:
["I will fetch you from Simla when it's cool enough. I will unbottle
you in fact,", 'We then see some of
the Mogul stuff   how appalling if we let you miss the Taj!   and then
I will see you off at Bombay. Your last glimpse of this country
really shall be interesting.']
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore']], [['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested'], ['Ronny Heaslop', 'Adela Quested'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText: They're rather wonderful.
subQuotationList: ["They're rather wonderful."]
speaker: Adela Quested
referringExpression: Adela had ceased to plan and leant out of a window saying

quoteText:
I'ld not have missed this for anything, Look, the sun's rising   this'll be absolutely
magnificent   come quickly   look. I wouldn't have missed this for
anything. We should never have seen it if we'd stuck to the Turtons
and their eternal elephants.
subQuotationList:
["I'ld not have missed this for anything,", "Look, the sun's rising   this'll be absolutely
magnificent   come quickly   look. I wouldn't have missed this for
anything. We should never have seen it if we'd stuck to the Turtons
and their eternal elephants."]
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore', 'Adela Quested'], ['Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Turton'], ['Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Turton']]]

quoteText:
Ah, that must be the false dawn   isn't it caused by dust in the
upper layers of the atmosphere that couldn't fall down during the
night? I think Mr. McBryde said so. Well, I must admit that England
has it as regards sunrises. Do you remember Grasmere?
subQuotationList:
["Ah, that must be the false dawn   isn't it caused by dust in the
upper layers of the atmosphere that couldn't fall down during the
night? I think Mr. McBryde said so. Well, I must admit that England
has it as regards sunrises. Do you remember Grasmere?"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Ah, dearest Grasmere!
subQuotationList: ['Ah, dearest Grasmere!']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Good morning, good morning, put on your topis, Put on your topis at once, the early sun
is highly dangerous for heads. I speak as a doctor.
subQuotationList: ['Good morning, good morning, put on your topis,', 'Put on your topis at once, the early sun\nis highly dangerous for heads. I speak as a doctor.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Good morning, good morning, put on your own.
subQuotationList: ['Good morning, good morning, put on your own.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Not for my thick head,
subQuotationList: ['Not for my thick head,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Nice creature he is,
subQuotationList: ['Nice creature he is,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Listen   Mohammed Latif says    Good morning' next.
subQuotationList: ["Listen   Mohammed Latif says    Good morning' next."]
speaker: _unknowable

quoteText:
Dr. Aziz, what's happened to your hills? The train has forgotten
to stop.
subQuotationList: ["Dr. Aziz, what's happened to your hills? The train has forgotten\nto stop."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Perhaps it is a circular train and goes back to Chandrapore
without a break. Who knows!
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps it is a circular train and goes back to Chandrapore\nwithout a break. Who knows!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Oh, what a surprise!
subQuotationList: ['Oh, what a surprise!']
speaker: _group

quoteText:
It takes an hour to get there, an hour to get back, and two hours
for the caves, which we will call three, The
train back is at eleven-thirty, and you will be sitting down to
your tiffin in Chandrapore with Mr. Heaslop at exactly your usual
hour, namely, one-fifteen. I know everything about you. Four
hours   quite a small expedition   and an hour extra for misfortunes,
which occur somewhat frequently among my people. My idea is to plan
everything without consulting you; but you, Mrs. Moore, or Miss
Quested, you are at any moment to make alterations if you wish,
even if it means giving up the caves. Do you agree? Then mount this
wild animal.
subQuotationList:
['It takes an hour to get there, an hour to get back, and two hours
for the caves, which we will call three,', 'The
train back is at eleven-thirty, and you will be sitting down to
your tiffin in Chandrapore with Mr. Heaslop at exactly your usual
hour, namely, one-fifteen. I know everything about you. Four
hours   quite a small expedition   and an hour extra for misfortunes,
which occur somewhat frequently among my people. My idea is to plan
everything without consulting you; but you, Mrs. Moore, or Miss
Quested, you are at any moment to make alterations if you wish,
even if it means giving up the caves. Do you agree? Then mount this
wild animal.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText: A snake!
subQuotationList: ['A snake!']
speaker: Adela Quested
referringExpression: Miss Quested saw a thin dark object reared on end at the farther side of a watercourse and said

quoteText: It isn't a snake.
subQuotationList: ["It isn't a snake."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: A horrid, stuffy place really,
subQuotationList: ['A horrid, stuffy place really,']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: How quick your servants are!
subQuotationList: ['How quick your servants are!']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
I thought we would eat this before our caves, and breakfast
after.
subQuotationList: ['I thought we would eat this before our caves, and breakfast\nafter.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Isn't this breakfast?
subQuotationList: ["Isn't this breakfast?"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: This breakfast? Did you think I should treat you so strangely?
subQuotationList: ['This breakfast? Did you think I should treat you so strangely?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: How very well it is all arranged.
subQuotationList: ['How very well it is all arranged.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
That you shall tell me when I return to Chandrapore. Whatever
disgraces I bring upon myself, you remain my guests.
subQuotationList: ['That you shall tell me when I return to Chandrapore. Whatever\ndisgraces I bring upon myself, you remain my guests.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Oh,
what more can I do for her?
subQuotationList: ['Oh,\nwhat more can I do for her?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Do you ever remember our mosque,
Mrs. Moore?
subQuotationList: ['Do you ever remember our mosque,\nMrs. Moore?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I do. I do,
subQuotationList: ['I do. I do,']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: And how rough and rude I was, and how good you were.
subQuotationList: ['And how rough and rude I was, and how good you were.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: And how happy we both were.
subQuotationList: ['And how happy we both were.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Friendships last longest that begin like that, I think. Shall I
ever entertain your other children?
subQuotationList: ['Friendships last longest that begin like that, I think. Shall I\never entertain your other children?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Do you know about the others? She will never talk about them to
me,
subQuotationList: ['Do you know about the others? She will never talk about them to\nme,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Ralph and Stella, yes, I know everything about them. But we must
not forget to visit our caves. One of the dreams of my life is
accomplished in having you both here as my guests. You cannot
imagine how you have honoured me. I feel like the Emperor Babur.
subQuotationList:
['Ralph and Stella, yes, I know everything about them. But we must
not forget to visit our caves. One of the dreams of my life is
accomplished in having you both here as my guests. You cannot
imagine how you have honoured me. I feel like the Emperor Babur.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText: Why like him?
subQuotationList: ['Why like him?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Because my ancestors came down with him from Afghanistan. They
joined him at Herat. He also had often no more elephants than one,
none sometimes, but he never ceased showing hospitality. When he
fought or hunted or ran away, he would always stop for a time among
hills, just like us; he would never let go of hospitality and
pleasure, and if there was only a little food, he would have it
arranged nicely, and if only one musical instrument, he would
compel it to play a beautiful tune. I take him as my ideal. He is
the poor gentleman, and he became a great king.
subQuotationList:
['Because my ancestors came down with him from Afghanistan. They
joined him at Herat. He also had often no more elephants than one,
none sometimes, but he never ceased showing hospitality. When he
fought or hunted or ran away, he would always stop for a time among
hills, just like us; he would never let go of hospitality and
pleasure, and if there was only a little food, he would have it
arranged nicely, and if only one musical instrument, he would
compel it to play a beautiful tune. I take him as my ideal. He is
the poor gentleman, and he became a great king.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I thought another Emperor is your favourite   I forget the name   you
mentioned him at Mr. Fielding's: what my book calls Aurangzebe.
subQuotationList: ["I thought another Emperor is your favourite   I forget the name   you\nmentioned him at Mr. Fielding's: what my book calls Aurangzebe."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Alamgir? Oh yes, he was of course the more pious. But Babur   never
in his whole life did he betray a friend, so I can only think of
him this morning. And you know how he died? He laid down his life
for his son. A death far more difficult than battle. They were
caught in the heat. They should have gone back to Kabul for the
bad weather, but could not for reasons of state, and at Agra
Humayun fell sick. Babur walked round the bed three times, and
said,
subQuotationList:
['Alamgir? Oh yes, he was of course the more pious. But Babur   never
in his whole life did he betray a friend, so I can only think of
him this morning. And you know how he died? He laid down his life
for his son. A death far more difficult than battle. They were
caught in the heat. They should have gone back to Kabul for the
bad weather, but could not for reasons of state, and at Agra
Humayun fell sick. Babur walked round the bed three times, and
said,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
and he did bear it away; the fever
left his son and came to him instead, and he died. That is why I
prefer Babur to Alamgir. I ought not to do so, but I do. However,
I mustn't delay you. I see you are ready to start.
subQuotationList:
["and he did bear it away; the fever
left his son and came to him instead, and he died. That is why I
prefer Babur to Alamgir. I ought not to do so, but I do. However,
I mustn't delay you. I see you are ready to start."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Not at all, We enjoy
talk like this very much.
subQuotationList: ['Not at all,', 'We enjoy\ntalk like this very much.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
I always enjoy conversing about the Moguls. It is the chief
pleasure I know. You see, those first six emperors were all most
wonderful men, and as soon as one of them is mentioned, no matter
which, I forget everything else in the world except the other five.
You could not find six such kings in all the countries of the
earth, not, I mean, coming one after the other   father, son.
subQuotationList:
['I always enjoy conversing about the Moguls. It is the chief
pleasure I know. You see, those first six emperors were all most
wonderful men, and as soon as one of them is mentioned, no matter
which, I forget everything else in the world except the other five.
You could not find six such kings in all the countries of the
earth, not, I mean, coming one after the other   father, son.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Tell us something about Akbar.
subQuotationList: ['Tell us something about Akbar.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Ah, you have heard the name of Akbar. Good. Hamidullah   whom you
shall meet   will tell you that Akbar is the greatest of all. I say,
subQuotationList: ['Ah, you have heard the name of Akbar. Good. Hamidullah   whom you\nshall meet   will tell you that Akbar is the greatest of all. I say,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText: which makes Hamidullah cry,
subQuotationList: ['which makes Hamidullah cry,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
But Babur always repented afterwards, which makes the entire
difference, and Akbar never repented of the new religion he invented
instead of the Holy Koran.
subQuotationList: ['But Babur always repented afterwards, which makes the entire\ndifference, and Akbar never repented of the new religion he invented\ninstead of the Holy Koran.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
But wasn't Akbar's new religion very fine? It was to embrace the
whole of India.
subQuotationList: ["But wasn't Akbar's new religion very fine? It was to embrace the\nwhole of India."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Miss Quested, fine but foolish. You keep your religion, I mine.
That is the best. Nothing embraces the whole of India, nothing,
nothing, and that was Akbar's mistake.
subQuotationList: ["Miss Quested, fine but foolish. You keep your religion, I mine.\nThat is the best. Nothing embraces the whole of India, nothing,\nnothing, and that was Akbar's mistake."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Oh, do you feel that, Dr. Aziz? I hope
you're not right. There will have to be something universal in this
country   I don't say religion, for I'm not religious, but something,
or how else are barriers to be broken down?
subQuotationList:
['Oh, do you feel that, Dr. Aziz?', "I hope
you're not right. There will have to be something universal in this
country   I don't say religion, for I'm not religious, but something,
or how else are barriers to be broken down?"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Take my own case, I don't know whether you happen to have heard,
but I'm going to marry Mr. Heaslop.
subQuotationList: ['Take my own case,', "I don't know whether you happen to have heard,\nbut I'm going to marry Mr. Heaslop."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: On which my heartiest congratulations.
subQuotationList: ['On which my heartiest congratulations.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Mrs. Moore, may I put our difficulty to Dr. Aziz   I mean our
Anglo-Indian one?
subQuotationList: ['Mrs. Moore, may I put our difficulty to Dr. Aziz   I mean our\nAnglo-Indian one?']
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore', 'Adela Quested'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Mrs. Moore', 'Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: It is your difficulty, not mine, my dear.
subQuotationList: ['It is your difficulty, not mine, my dear.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Ah, that's true. Well, by marrying Mr. Heaslop, I shall become
what is known as an Anglo-Indian.
subQuotationList: ["Ah, that's true. Well, by marrying Mr. Heaslop, I shall become\nwhat is known as an Anglo-Indian."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Impossible. Take back such a
terrible remark.
subQuotationList: ['Impossible. Take back such a\nterrible remark.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
But I shall; it's inevitable. I can't avoid the label. What I do
hope to avoid is the mentality. Women like
subQuotationList: ["But I shall; it's inevitable. I can't avoid the label. What I do\nhope to avoid is the mentality. Women like"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Some women are so   well,
ungenerous and snobby about Indians, and I should feel too ashamed
for words if I turned like them, but   and here's my difficulty   there's
nothing special about me, nothing specially good or strong, which
will help me to resist my environment and avoid becoming like them.
I've most lamentable defects. That's why I want Akbar's    universal
religion' or the equivalent to keep me decent and sensible. Do you
see what I mean?
subQuotationList:
["Some women are so   well,
ungenerous and snobby about Indians, and I should feel too ashamed
for words if I turned like them, but   and here's my difficulty   there's
nothing special about me, nothing specially good or strong, which
will help me to resist my environment and avoid becoming like them.
I've most lamentable defects. That's why I want Akbar's    universal
religion' or the equivalent to keep me decent and sensible. Do you
see what I mean?"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
You are certain to be happy with any relative
of Mrs. Moore's,
subQuotationList: ["You are certain to be happy with any relative\nof Mrs. Moore's,"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Oh, my happiness   that's quite another problem. I want to consult
you about this Anglo-Indian difficulty. Can you give me any advice?
subQuotationList: ["Oh, my happiness   that's quite another problem. I want to consult\nyou about this Anglo-Indian difficulty. Can you give me any advice?"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
You are absolutely unlike the others, I assure you. You will never
be rude to my people.
subQuotationList: ['You are absolutely unlike the others, I assure you. You will never\nbe rude to my people.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I am told we all get rude after a year.
subQuotationList: ['I am told we all get rude after a year.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Then you are told a lie,
subQuotationList: ['Then you are told a lie,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Come along,
subQuotationList: ['Come along,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Did you see the reflection of his match   rather pretty?
subQuotationList: ['Did you see the reflection of his match   rather pretty?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I forget . . .
subQuotationList: ['I forget . . .']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: But he says this isn't a good cave, the best are on the Kawa Dol.
subQuotationList: ["But he says this isn't a good cave, the best are on the Kawa Dol."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I don't think I shall go on to there. I dislike climbing.
subQuotationList: ["I don't think I shall go on to there. I dislike climbing."]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Very well, let's sit down again in the shade until breakfast's
ready.
subQuotationList: ["Very well, let's sit down again in the shade until breakfast's\nready."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Ah, but that'll disappoint him so; he has taken such trouble. You
should go on; you don't mind.
subQuotationList: ["Ah, but that'll disappoint him so; he has taken such trouble. You\nshould go on; you don't mind."]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: Perhaps I ought to,
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps I ought to,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Certainly, Miss Quested, so you and I will go together, and leave
Mrs. Moore here, and we will not be long, yet we will not hurry,
because we know that will be her wish.
subQuotationList: ['Certainly, Miss Quested, so you and I will go together, and leave\nMrs. Moore here, and we will not be long, yet we will not hurry,\nbecause we know that will be her wish.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested', 'Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested', 'Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested', 'Dr. Aziz'], ['Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText: Quite right. I'm sorry not to come too, but I'm a poor walker.
subQuotationList: ["Quite right. I'm sorry not to come too, but I'm a poor walker."]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Dear Mrs. Moore, what does anything matter so long as you are my
guests? I am very glad you are _not_ coming, which sounds strange,
but you are treating me with true frankness, as a friend.
subQuotationList: ['Dear Mrs. Moore, what does anything matter so long as you are my\nguests? I am very glad you are _not_ coming, which sounds strange,\nbut you are treating me with true frankness, as a friend.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Yes, I am your friend, So may I
make another suggestion? Don't let so many people come with you
this time. I think you may find it more convenient.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, I am your friend,', "So may I\nmake another suggestion? Don't let so many people come with you\nthis time. I think you may find it more convenient."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Exactly, exactly,
subQuotationList: ['Exactly, exactly,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Is that all right?
subQuotationList: ['Is that all right?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Quite right, now enjoy yourselves, and when you come back tell me
all about it.
subQuotationList: ['Quite right, now enjoy yourselves, and when you come back tell me\nall about it.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: I am going to be ill,
subQuotationList: ['I am going to be ill,']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
pretty sure they should come on some
interesting old carvings soon,
subQuotationList: ['pretty sure they should come on some\ninteresting old carvings soon,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: What about love?
subQuotationList: ['What about love?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Do I take you too fast?
subQuotationList: ['Do I take you too fast?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
No, I'm all right,
thanks,
subQuotationList: ["No, I'm all right,\nthanks,"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Are you married, Dr. Aziz?
subQuotationList: ['Are you married, Dr. Aziz?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Yes, indeed, do come and see my wife
subQuotationList: ['Yes, indeed, do come and see my wife']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Thank you,
subQuotationList: ['Thank you,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: She is not in Chandrapore just now.
subQuotationList: ['She is not in Chandrapore just now.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: And have you children?
subQuotationList: ['And have you children?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Yes, indeed, three,
subQuotationList: ['Yes, indeed, three,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Are they a great pleasure to you?
subQuotationList: ['Are they a great pleasure to you?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Why, naturally, I adore them,
subQuotationList: ['Why, naturally, I adore them,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I suppose so.
subQuotationList: ['I suppose so.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Have you one wife or more than one?
subQuotationList: ['Have you one wife or more than one?']
speaker: Adela Quested
referringExpression: she gave rein to the subject of marriage and said

quoteText: One, one in my own particular case,
subQuotationList: ['One, one in my own particular case,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Damn the English even at their
best,
subQuotationList: ['Damn the English even at their\nbest,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: sight-seeing bores me,
subQuotationList: ['sight-seeing bores me,']
speaker: Adela Quested
referringExpression: she also went into a cave thinking

quoteText: Which cave?
subQuotationList: ['Which cave?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
You should have kept her in sight, it was your duty, Here are twelve caves at least. How am I to know which
contains my guest? Which is the cave I was in myself?
subQuotationList: ['You should have kept her in sight, it was your duty,', 'Here are twelve caves at least. How am I to know which\ncontains my guest? Which is the cave I was in myself?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Merciful Heavens, Miss
Quested is lost,
subQuotationList: ['Merciful Heavens, Miss\nQuested is lost,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Shout!
subQuotationList: ['Shout!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Come here!
subQuotationList: ['Come here!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
This is the end of my career, my guest is
lost.
subQuotationList: ['This is the end of my career, my guest is\nlost.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Fielding! Oh, I have so wanted you!
subQuotationList: ['Fielding! Oh, I have so wanted you!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Why haven't you gone
to the Marabar?
subQuotationList: ["Why haven't you gone\nto the Marabar?"]
speaker: Miss Derek
referringExpression: She had met Fielding by chance at the post office said

quoteText: Aziz, can I have a drink?
subQuotationList: ['Aziz, can I have a drink?']
