speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Certainly not.
subQuotationList: ['Certainly not.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Mr. Fielding!
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Fielding!']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: Good morning again!
subQuotationList: ['Good morning again!']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Mr. Fielding, have you seen Miss Quested?
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Fielding, have you seen Miss Quested?']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: But I've only just arrived. Where is she?
subQuotationList: ["But I've only just arrived. Where is she?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I do not know.
subQuotationList: ['I do not know.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: Aziz! Where have you put Miss Quested to?
subQuotationList: ['Aziz! Where have you put Miss Quested to?']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
Oh, she's all right, she went down to see Miss Derek. Well, here's luck!
Chin-chin!
subQuotationList: ["Oh, she's all right,", "she went down to see Miss Derek. Well, here's luck!\nChin-chin!"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Here's luck, but chin-chin I do refuse, Here's to India!
subQuotationList: ["Here's luck, but chin-chin I do refuse,", "Here's to India!"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Here's luck, and here's to England!
subQuotationList: ["Here's luck, and here's to England!"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Oh yes, that's quite likely, I knew they'd gone for
a spin.
subQuotationList: ["Oh yes, that's quite likely,", "I knew they'd gone for\na spin."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Chandrapore? The man's made a mistake,
subQuotationList: ["Chandrapore? The man's made a mistake,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Oh no, why?
subQuotationList: ['Oh no, why?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: What's happened?
subQuotationList: ["What's happened?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Miss Derek is most unsatisfactory and restless,
always in a hurry, always wanting something new; she will do
anything in the world except go back to the Indian lady who pays
her.
subQuotationList:
['Miss Derek is most unsatisfactory and restless,
always in a hurry, always wanting something new; she will do
anything in the world except go back to the Indian lady who pays
her.']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
She wasn't in
a hurry when I left her. There was no question of returning to
Chandrapore. It looks to me as if Miss Quested's in the hurry.
subQuotationList: ["She wasn't in\na hurry when I left her. There was no question of returning to\nChandrapore. It looks to me as if Miss Quested's in the hurry."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
referringExpression: Fielding who didnt dislike Miss Derek replied

quoteText: Adela?   she's never been in a hurry in her life,
subQuotationList: ["Adela?   she's never been in a hurry in her life,"]
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText:
I say it'll prove to be Miss Quested's wish, in fact I know it
is,
subQuotationList: ["I say it'll prove to be Miss Quested's wish, in fact I know it\nis,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Aziz is a charming
fellow,
subQuotationList: ['Aziz is a charming\nfellow,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I know,
subQuotationList: ['I know,']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: He has taken endless trouble to make a success of our picnic.
subQuotationList: ['He has taken endless trouble to make a success of our picnic.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
It is quite natural about Miss Quested, We were having an interesting talk with our guide,
then the car was seen, so she decided to go down to her friend.
subQuotationList: ['It is quite natural about Miss Quested,', 'We were having an interesting talk with our guide,\nthen the car was seen, so she decided to go down to her friend.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
She ran to her friend, I to mine, And now I am with my friends and they are with
me and each other, which is happiness.
subQuotationList: ['She ran to her friend, I to mine,', 'And now I am with my friends and they are with\nme and each other, which is happiness.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Miss Derek']], [['Mrs. Moore', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Mrs. Moore', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Mrs. Moore', 'Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText:
I knew these women would
make trouble,
subQuotationList: ['I knew these women would\nmake trouble,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
This man, having missed
the train, tries to blame us
subQuotationList: ['This man, having missed\nthe train, tries to blame us']
speaker: Mrs. Moore

quoteText: Aziz, exactly where and how did you leave Miss Quested?
subQuotationList: ['Aziz, exactly where and how did you leave Miss Quested?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Up there.
subQuotationList: ['Up there.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: But how
subQuotationList: ['But how']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I suppose the guide
helped her.
subQuotationList: ['I suppose the guide\nhelped her.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Oh, rather, most helpful.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, rather, most helpful.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Is there a path off the top?
subQuotationList: ['Is there a path off the top?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Millions of paths, my dear fellow.
subQuotationList: ['Millions of paths, my dear fellow.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: But you saw them get down safe?
subQuotationList: ['But you saw them get down safe?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Yes, yes, she and Miss Derek, and go off in the car.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, yes, she and Miss Derek, and go off in the car.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Then the guide came back to you?
subQuotationList: ['Then the guide came back to you?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Exactly. Got a cigarette?
subQuotationList: ['Exactly. Got a cigarette?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I hope she wasn't ill,
subQuotationList: ["I hope she wasn't ill,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: She would have wanted me, if she was ill, to attend her.
subQuotationList: ['She would have wanted me, if she was ill, to attend her.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Yes, that sounds sense.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, that sounds sense.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I see you're worrying, let's talk of other things, Miss Quested was always to do what she wished, it was our
arrangement. I see you are worrying on my account, but really I
don't mind, I never notice trifles.
subQuotationList: ["I see you're worrying, let's talk of other things,", "Miss Quested was always to do what she wished, it was our\narrangement. I see you are worrying on my account, but really I\ndon't mind, I never notice trifles."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz', 'Cyril Fielding']], [['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText:
I do worry on your account. I consider they have been impolite! She had no right to dash away
from your party, and Miss Derek had no right to abet her.
subQuotationList: ['I do worry on your account. I consider they have been impolite!', 'She had no right to dash away\nfrom your party, and Miss Derek had no right to abet her.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested', 'Miss Derek']], [['Dr. Aziz'], ['Miss Derek'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: Aziz, have you figured out what this picnic will cost you?
subQuotationList: ['Aziz, have you figured out what this picnic will cost you?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Sh! my dear chap, don't mention that part. Hundreds and hundreds
of rupees. The completed account will be too awful; my friends'
servants have robbed me right and left, and as for an elephant,
she apparently eats gold. I can trust you not to repeat this. And
M.L.   please employ initials, he listens   is far the worst of all.
subQuotationList:
["Sh! my dear chap, don't mention that part. Hundreds and hundreds
of rupees. The completed account will be too awful; my friends'
servants have robbed me right and left, and as for an elephant,
she apparently eats gold. I can trust you not to repeat this. And
M.L.   please employ initials, he listens   is far the worst of all."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I told you he's no good.
subQuotationList: ["I told you he's no good."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: He is plenty of good for himself; his dishonesty will ruin me.
subQuotationList: ['He is plenty of good for himself; his dishonesty will ruin me.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Aziz, how monstrous!
subQuotationList: ['Aziz, how monstrous!']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I am delighted with him really, he has made my guests comfortable;
besides, it is my duty to employ him, he is my cousin. If money
goes, money comes. If money stays, death comes. Did you ever hear
that useful Urdu proverb? Probably not, for I have just invented
it.
subQuotationList:
['I am delighted with him really, he has made my guests comfortable;
besides, it is my duty to employ him, he is my cousin. If money
goes, money comes. If money stays, death comes. Did you ever hear
that useful Urdu proverb? Probably not, for I have just invented
it.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
My proverbs are: A penny saved is a penny earned; A stitch in time
saves nine; Look before you leap; and the British Empire rests on
them. You will never kick us out, you know, until you cease
employing M.L.'s and such.
subQuotationList:
["My proverbs are: A penny saved is a penny earned; A stitch in time
saves nine; Look before you leap; and the British Empire rests on
them. You will never kick us out, you know, until you cease
employing M.L.'s and such."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Oh, kick you out? Why should I trouble over that dirty job? Leave
it to the politicians. . . . No, when I was a student I got excited
over your damned countrymen, certainly; but if they'll let me get
on with my profession and not be too rude to me officially, I
really don't ask for more.
subQuotationList:
["Oh, kick you out? Why should I trouble over that dirty job? Leave
it to the politicians. . . . No, when I was a student I got excited
over your damned countrymen, certainly; but if they'll let me get
on with my profession and not be too rude to me officially, I
really don't ask for more."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: But you do; you take them to a picnic.
subQuotationList: ['But you do; you take them to a picnic.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
This picnic is nothing to do with English or Indian; it is an
expedition of friends.
subQuotationList: ['This picnic is nothing to do with English or Indian; it is an\nexpedition of friends.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Dr. Aziz, it is my highly
painful duty to arrest you.
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Aziz, it is my highly\npainful duty to arrest you.']
speaker: Mr. Haq
referringExpression: Mr Haq the Inspector of Police flung open the door of their carriage and said

quoteText: Hullo, some mistake,
subQuotationList: ['Hullo, some mistake,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Sir, they are my instructions. I know nothing.
subQuotationList: ['Sir, they are my instructions. I know nothing.']
speaker: Mr. Haq

quoteText: On what charge do you arrest him?
subQuotationList: ['On what charge do you arrest him?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I am under instructions not to say.
subQuotationList: ['I am under instructions not to say.']
speaker: Mr. Haq

quoteText: Don't answer me like that. Produce your warrant.
subQuotationList: ["Don't answer me like that. Produce your warrant."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Sir, excuse me, no warrant is required under these particular
circumstances. Refer to Mr. McBryde.
subQuotationList: ['Sir, excuse me, no warrant is required under these particular\ncircumstances. Refer to Mr. McBryde.']
speaker: Mr. Haq

quoteText:
Very well, so we will. Come along, Aziz, old man; nothing to fuss
about, some blunder.
subQuotationList: ['Very well, so we will. Come along, Aziz, old man; nothing to fuss\nabout, some blunder.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Dr. Aziz, will you kindly come?   a closed conveyance stands in
readiness.
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Aziz, will you kindly come?   a closed conveyance stands in\nreadiness.']
speaker: Mr. Haq

quoteText: That will compel me to use force,
subQuotationList: ['That will compel me to use force,']
speaker: Mr. Haq

quoteText:
Oh, for God's sake Dear fellow, we're coming
to McBryde together, and enquire what's gone wrong   he's a decent
fellow, it's all unintentional . . . he'll apologize. Never, never
act the criminal.
subQuotationList:
["Oh, for God's sake", "Dear fellow, we're coming
to McBryde together, and enquire what's gone wrong   he's a decent
fellow, it's all unintentional . . . he'll apologize. Never, never
act the criminal."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: My children and my name!
subQuotationList: ['My children and my name!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Nothing of the sort. Put your hat straight and take my arm. I'll
see you through.
subQuotationList: ["Nothing of the sort. Put your hat straight and take my arm. I'll\nsee you through."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Ah, thank God, he comes,
subQuotationList: ['Ah, thank God, he comes,']
speaker: Mr. Haq

quoteText:
The worst thing in my whole
career has happened, Miss Quested has been insulted in
one of the Marabar caves.
subQuotationList: ['The worst thing in my whole\ncareer has happened,', 'Miss Quested has been insulted in\none of the Marabar caves.']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText: Oh no, oh no, no,
subQuotationList: ['Oh no, oh no, no,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: She escaped   by God's grace.
subQuotationList: ["She escaped   by God's grace."]
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText: Oh no, no, but not Aziz . . . not Aziz . . .
subQuotationList: ['Oh no, no, but not Aziz . . . not Aziz . . .']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Absolutely impossible, grotesque.
subQuotationList: ['Absolutely impossible, grotesque.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I called you to preserve you from the odium that would attach to
you if you were seen accompanying him to the Police Station,
subQuotationList: ['I called you to preserve you from the odium that would attach to\nyou if you were seen accompanying him to the Police Station,']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText: Oh no,
subQuotationList: ['Oh no,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Who lodges this infamous charge?
subQuotationList: ['Who lodges this infamous charge?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Miss Derek and   the victim herself. . . .
subQuotationList: ['Miss Derek and   the victim herself. . . .']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText: Miss Quested herself definitely accuses him of
subQuotationList: ['Miss Quested herself definitely accuses him of']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText: Then she's mad.
subQuotationList: ["Then she's mad."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I cannot pass that last remark, You
will withdraw it instantly. It is the type of remark you have
permitted yourself to make ever since you came to Chandrapore.
subQuotationList: ['I cannot pass that last remark,', 'You\nwill withdraw it instantly. It is the type of remark you have\npermitted yourself to make ever since you came to Chandrapore.']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText: I'm excessively sorry, sir; I certainly withdraw it unconditionally.
subQuotationList: ["I'm excessively sorry, sir; I certainly withdraw it unconditionally."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Pray, Mr. Fielding, what induced you to speak to me in such a
tone?
subQuotationList: ['Pray, Mr. Fielding, what induced you to speak to me in such a\ntone?']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText:
The news gave me a very great shock, so I must ask you to forgive
me. I cannot believe that Dr. Aziz is guilty.
subQuotationList: ['The news gave me a very great shock, so I must ask you to forgive\nme. I cannot believe that Dr. Aziz is guilty.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
That   that is a repetition of
your insult in an aggravated form.
subQuotationList: ['That   that is a repetition of\nyour insult in an aggravated form.']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText:
If I may venture to say so, no, I make no reflection on the good faith
of the two ladies, but the charge they are bringing against Aziz
rests upon some mistake, and five minutes will clear it up. The
man's manner is perfectly natural; besides, I know him to be
incapable of infamy.
subQuotationList:
['If I may venture to say so, no,', "I make no reflection on the good faith
of the two ladies, but the charge they are bringing against Aziz
rests upon some mistake, and five minutes will clear it up. The
man's manner is perfectly natural; besides, I know him to be
incapable of infamy."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
It does indeed rest upon a mistake, It does indeed. I have had twenty-five years'
experience of this country and during those twenty-five years I have never known
anything but disaster result when English people and Indians
attempt to be intimate socially. Intercourse, yes. Courtesy, by
all means. Intimacy   never, never. The whole weight of my authority
is against it. I have been in charge at Chandrapore for six years,
and if everything has gone smoothly, if there has been mutual
respect and esteem, it is because both peoples kept to this simple
rule. New-comers set our traditions aside, and in an instant what
you see happens, the work of years is undone and the good name of
my District ruined for a generation. I   I   can't see the end of this
day's work, Mr. Fielding. You, who are imbued with modern ideas   no
doubt you can. I wish I had never lived to see its beginning, I
know that. It is the end of me. That a lady, that a young lady
engaged to my most valued subordinate   that she   an English girl
fresh from England   that I should have lived
subQuotationList:
['It does indeed rest upon a mistake,', "It does indeed. I have had twenty-five years'
experience of this country", "and during those twenty-five years I have never known
anything but disaster result when English people and Indians
attempt to be intimate socially. Intercourse, yes. Courtesy, by
all means. Intimacy   never, never. The whole weight of my authority
is against it. I have been in charge at Chandrapore for six years,
and if everything has gone smoothly, if there has been mutual
respect and esteem, it is because both peoples kept to this simple
rule. New-comers set our traditions aside, and in an instant what
you see happens, the work of years is undone and the good name of
my District ruined for a generation. I   I   can't see the end of this
day's work, Mr. Fielding. You, who are imbued with modern ideas   no
doubt you can. I wish I had never lived to see its beginning, I
know that. It is the end of me. That a lady, that a young lady
engaged to my most valued subordinate   that she   an English girl
fresh from England   that I should have lived"]
speaker: Mr. Turton
referringExpression: came the thin biting voice of the other
mentionTextsList: [[], [], ['Mr. Fielding', 'You', 'you', 'a lady', 'a young lady\nengaged to my most valued subordinate', 'she', 'an English girl\nfresh from England']]
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [], [['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText:
I came down particularly on your account   while poor Heaslop got
his mother away. I regarded it as the most friendly thing I could
do. I meant to tell you that there will be an informal meeting at
the club this evening to discuss the situation, but I am doubtful
whether you will care to come. Your visits there are always
infrequent.
subQuotationList:
['I came down particularly on your account   while poor Heaslop got
his mother away. I regarded it as the most friendly thing I could
do. I meant to tell you that there will be an informal meeting at
the club this evening to discuss the situation, but I am doubtful
whether you will care to come. Your visits there are always
infrequent.']
speaker: Mr. Turton
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText:
I shall certainly come, sir, and I am most grateful to you for
all the trouble you have taken over me. May I venture to ask   where
Miss Quested is.
subQuotationList: ['I shall certainly come, sir, and I am most grateful to you for\nall the trouble you have taken over me. May I venture to ask   where\nMiss Quested is.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Worse and worse, appalling,
subQuotationList: ['Worse and worse, appalling,']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText:
I know what you're like at last;
you shall pay for this, you shall squeal.
subQuotationList: ["I know what you're like at last;\nyou shall pay for this, you shall squeal."]
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText:
I have to detain you until you get bail, but no doubt your friends will be applying for it, and of
course they will be allowed to visit you, under regulations. I am
given certain information, and have to act on it   I'm not your
judge.
subQuotationList:
['I have to detain you until you get bail,', "but no doubt your friends will be applying for it, and of
course they will be allowed to visit you, under regulations. I am
given certain information, and have to act on it   I'm not your
judge."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: Another of them found out,
subQuotationList: ['Another of them found out,']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: What is the charge, precisely?
subQuotationList: ['What is the charge, precisely?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
That he followed her into the cave and made insulting advances.
She hit at him with her field-glasses; he pulled at them and the
strap broke, and that is how she got away. When we searched him
just now, they were in his pocket.
subQuotationList:
['That he followed her into the cave and made insulting advances.
She hit at him with her field-glasses; he pulled at them and the
strap broke, and that is how she got away. When we searched him
just now, they were in his pocket.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz']]]

quoteText: Oh no, oh no, no; it'll be cleared up in five minutes,
subQuotationList: ["Oh no, oh no, no; it'll be cleared up in five minutes,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Have a look at them.
subQuotationList: ['Have a look at them.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: Did she say any more?
subQuotationList: ['Did she say any more?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
There was an echo that appears to have frightened her. Did you go
into those caves?
subQuotationList: ['There was an echo that appears to have frightened her. Did you go\ninto those caves?']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: I saw one of them. There was an echo. Did it get on her nerves?
subQuotationList: ['I saw one of them. There was an echo. Did it get on her nerves?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I couldn't worry her overmuch with questions. She'll have plenty
to go through in the witness-box. They don't bear thinking about,
these next weeks. I wish the Marabar Hills and all they contain
were at the bottom of the sea. Evening after evening one saw them
from the club, and they were just a harmless name. . . . Yes, we
start already. I heard some more
from Miss Derek   she is an old friend of us both and talks freely;
well   her account is that you went off to locate the camp, and
almost at once she heard stones falling on the Kawa Dol and saw
Miss Quested running straight down the face of a precipice. Well.
She climbed up a sort of gully to her, and found her practically
done for   her helmet off
subQuotationList:
["I couldn't worry her overmuch with questions. She'll have plenty
to go through in the witness-box. They don't bear thinking about,
these next weeks. I wish the Marabar Hills and all they contain
were at the bottom of the sea. Evening after evening one saw them
from the club, and they were just a harmless name. . . . Yes, we
start already.", 'I heard some more
from Miss Derek   she is an old friend of us both and talks freely;
well   her account is that you went off to locate the camp, and
almost at once she heard stones falling on the Kawa Dol and saw
Miss Quested running straight down the face of a precipice. Well.
She climbed up a sort of gully to her, and found her practically
done for   her helmet off']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde
referringExpression: McBryde sighed gave permission and continued
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']], [['Miss Derek'], ['Miss Derek'], ['Cyril Fielding', 'Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Miss Derek'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Miss Derek'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: Was a guide not with her?
subQuotationList: ['Was a guide not with her?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
No. She had got among some cactuses. Miss Derek saved her life
coming just then   she was beginning to fling herself about. She
helped her down to the car. Miss Quested couldn't stand the Indian
driver, cried,
subQuotationList:
["No. She had got among some cactuses. Miss Derek saved her life
coming just then   she was beginning to fling herself about. She
helped her down to the car. Miss Quested couldn't stand the Indian
driver, cried,"]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Miss Derek'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText:
and it was that that put our friend
on the track of what had happened. They made straight for our
bungalow, and are there now. That's the story as far as I know it
yet. She sent the driver to join you. I think she behaved with
great sense.
subQuotationList:
["and it was that that put our friend
on the track of what had happened. They made straight for our
bungalow, and are there now. That's the story as far as I know it
yet. She sent the driver to join you. I think she behaved with
great sense."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: I suppose there's no possibility of my seeing Miss Quested?
subQuotationList: ["I suppose there's no possibility of my seeing Miss Quested?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I hardly think that would do. Surely.
subQuotationList: ['I hardly think that would do. Surely.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: I was afraid you'ld say that. I should very much like to.
subQuotationList: ["I was afraid you'ld say that. I should very much like to."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
She is in no state to see anyone. Besides, you don't know her
well.
subQuotationList: ["She is in no state to see anyone. Besides, you don't know her\nwell."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
Hardly at all. . . . But you see I believe she's under some
hideous delusion, and that that wretched boy is innocent.
subQuotationList: ["Hardly at all. . . . But you see I believe she's under some\nhideous delusion, and that that wretched boy is innocent."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I had
no idea that was in your mind,
subQuotationList: ['I had\nno idea that was in your mind,']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
Those field-glasses upset me for a minute, but I've thought since:
it's impossible that, having attempted to assault her, he would
put her glasses into his pocket.
subQuotationList: ["Those field-glasses upset me for a minute, but I've thought since:\nit's impossible that, having attempted to assault her, he would\nput her glasses into his pocket."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Quite possible, I'm afraid; when an Indian goes bad, he goes not
only very bad, but very queer.
subQuotationList: ["Quite possible, I'm afraid; when an Indian goes bad, he goes not\nonly very bad, but very queer."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: I don't follow.
subQuotationList: ["I don't follow."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
How should you? When you think of crime you think of English
crime. The psychology here is different. I dare say you'll tell me
next that he was quite normal when he came down from the hill to
greet you. No reason he should not be. Read any of the Mutiny
records; which, rather than the Bhagavad Gita, should be your Bible
in this country. Though I'm not sure that the one and the other
are not closely connected. Am I not being beastly? But, you see,
Fielding, as I've said to you once before, you're a schoolmaster,
and consequently you come across these people at their best. That's
what puts you wrong. They can be charming as boys. But I know them
as they really are, after they have developed into men. Look at
this, for instance.
subQuotationList:
["How should you? When you think of crime you think of English
crime. The psychology here is different. I dare say you'll tell me
next that he was quite normal when he came down from the hill to
greet you. No reason he should not be. Read any of the Mutiny
records; which, rather than the Bhagavad Gita, should be your Bible
in this country. Though I'm not sure that the one and the other
are not closely connected. Am I not being beastly? But, you see,
Fielding, as I've said to you once before, you're a schoolmaster,
and consequently you come across these people at their best. That's
what puts you wrong. They can be charming as boys. But I know them
as they really are, after they have developed into men. Look at
this, for instance."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText:
I am going
through the contents. They are not edifying. Here is a letter from
a friend who apparently keeps a brothel.
subQuotationList: ['I am going\nthrough the contents. They are not edifying. Here is a letter from\na friend who apparently keeps a brothel.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: I don't want to hear his private letters.
subQuotationList: ["I don't want to hear his private letters."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
It'll have to be quoted in Court, as bearing on his morals. He
was fixing up to see women at Calcutta.
subQuotationList: ["It'll have to be quoted in Court, as bearing on his morals. He\nwas fixing up to see women at Calcutta."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: Oh, that'll do, that'll do.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, that'll do, that'll do."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I dare say you have the right to throw stones at a young man for
doing that, but I haven't. I did the same at his age.
subQuotationList: ["I dare say you have the right to throw stones at a young man for\ndoing that, but I haven't. I did the same at his age."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Miss Quested really cannot be seen? You do know that for a
certainty?
subQuotationList: ['Miss Quested really cannot be seen? You do know that for a\ncertainty?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
You have never explained to me what's in your mind here. Why on
earth do you want to see her?
subQuotationList: ["You have never explained to me what's in your mind here. Why on\nearth do you want to see her?"]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
On the off chance of her recanting before you send in that report
and he's committed for trial, and the whole thing goes to blazes.
Old man, don't argue about this, but do of your goodness just ring
up your wife or Miss Derek and enquire. It'll cost you nothing.
subQuotationList:
["On the off chance of her recanting before you send in that report
and he's committed for trial, and the whole thing goes to blazes.
Old man, don't argue about this, but do of your goodness just ring
up your wife or Miss Derek and enquire. It'll cost you nothing."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Mrs. Mcbryde'], ['Miss Derek'], ['Mr. Mcbryde']]]

quoteText:
It's no use ringing up them, Callendar settles a question like that, of course. You
haven't grasped that she's seriously ill.
subQuotationList: ["It's no use ringing up them,", "Callendar settles a question like that, of course. You\nhaven't grasped that she's seriously ill."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: He's sure to refuse, it's all he exists for,
subQuotationList: ["He's sure to refuse, it's all he exists for,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I only wanted to ask her whether she is certain, dead certain,
that it was Aziz who followed her into the cave.
subQuotationList: ['I only wanted to ask her whether she is certain, dead certain,\nthat it was Aziz who followed her into the cave.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Possibly my wife might ask her that much.
subQuotationList: ['Possibly my wife might ask her that much.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
But _I_ wanted to ask her. I want someone who believes in him to
ask her.
subQuotationList: ['But _I_ wanted to ask her. I want someone who believes in him to\nask her.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: What difference does that make?
subQuotationList: ['What difference does that make?']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: She is among people who disbelieve in Indians.
subQuotationList: ['She is among people who disbelieve in Indians.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Well, she tells her own story, doesn't she?
subQuotationList: ["Well, she tells her own story, doesn't she?"]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: I know, but she tells it to you.
subQuotationList: ['I know, but she tells it to you.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
A bit too finespun.
Anyhow, Callendar won't hear of you seeing her. I'm sorry to say
he gave a bad account just now. He says that she is by no means
out of danger.
subQuotationList:
["A bit too finespun.
Anyhow, Callendar won't hear of you seeing her. I'm sorry to say
he gave a bad account just now. He says that she is by no means
out of danger."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Major Callendar'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Major Callendar'], ['Major Callendar'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: I must put this report through now, Fielding.
subQuotationList: ['I must put this report through now, Fielding.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: I wish you wouldn't.
subQuotationList: ["I wish you wouldn't."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: How can I not?
subQuotationList: ['How can I not?']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
I feel that things are rather unsatisfactory as well as most
disastrous. We are heading for a most awful smash. I can see your
prisoner, I suppose.
subQuotationList: ['I feel that things are rather unsatisfactory as well as most\ndisastrous. We are heading for a most awful smash. I can see your\nprisoner, I suppose.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: His own people seem in touch with him all right.
subQuotationList: ['His own people seem in touch with him all right.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: Well, when he's done with them.
subQuotationList: ["Well, when he's done with them."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I wouldn't keep you waiting; good heavens, you take precedence of
any Indian visitor, of course. I meant what's the good. Why mix
yourself up with pitch?
subQuotationList: ["I wouldn't keep you waiting; good heavens, you take precedence of\nany Indian visitor, of course. I meant what's the good. Why mix\nyourself up with pitch?"]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: I say he's innocent
subQuotationList: ["I say he's innocent"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Innocence or guilt, why mix yourself up? What's the good?
subQuotationList: ["Innocence or guilt, why mix yourself up? What's the good?"]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
Oh, good, good, One's got to breathe occasionally, at least I have. I
mayn't see her, and now I mayn't see him. I promised him to come
up here with him to you, but Turton called me off before I could
get two steps.
subQuotationList:
['Oh, good, good,', "One's got to breathe occasionally, at least I have. I
mayn't see her, and now I mayn't see him. I promised him to come
up here with him to you, but Turton called me off before I could
get two steps."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Adela Quested'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Mr. Turton']]]

quoteText:
Sort of all-white thing the Burra Sahib would do, We shall all have to hang
together, old man, I'm afraid. I'm your junior in years, I know,
but very much your senior in service; you don't happen to know this
poisonous country as well as I do, and you must take it from me
that the general situation is going to be nasty at Chandrapore
during the next few weeks, very nasty indeed.
subQuotationList:
['Sort of all-white thing the Burra Sahib would do,', "We shall all have to hang
together, old man, I'm afraid. I'm your junior in years, I know,
but very much your senior in service; you don't happen to know this
poisonous country as well as I do, and you must take it from me
that the general situation is going to be nasty at Chandrapore
during the next few weeks, very nasty indeed."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Turton']], [['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText: So I have just told you.
subQuotationList: ['So I have just told you.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
But at a time like this there's no room for   well   personal views.
The man who doesn't toe the line is lost.
subQuotationList: ["But at a time like this there's no room for   well   personal views.\nThe man who doesn't toe the line is lost."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: I see what you mean.
subQuotationList: ['I see what you mean.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
No, you don't see entirely. He not only loses himself, he weakens
his friends. If you leave the line, you leave a gap in the line.
These jackals
subQuotationList: ["No, you don't see entirely. He not only loses himself, he weakens\nhis friends. If you leave the line, you leave a gap in the line.\nThese jackals"]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
are looking with
all their eyes for a gap.
subQuotationList: ['are looking with\nall their eyes for a gap.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: Can I visit Aziz?
subQuotationList: ['Can I visit Aziz?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: No.
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
You may see him on a magistrate's order, but on my own
responsibility I don't feel justified. It might lead to more
complications.
subQuotationList: ["You may see him on a magistrate's order, but on my own\nresponsibility I don't feel justified. It might lead to more\ncomplications."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
To whom do I
apply for an order?
subQuotationList: ['To whom do I\napply for an order?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: City Magistrate.
subQuotationList: ['City Magistrate.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: That sounds comfortable!
subQuotationList: ['That sounds comfortable!']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Yes, one can't very well worry poor Heaslop.
subQuotationList: ["Yes, one can't very well worry poor Heaslop."]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: Photographs of women. Ah!
subQuotationList: ['Photographs of women. Ah!']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: That's his wife,
subQuotationList: ["That's his wife,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: How do you know that?
subQuotationList: ['How do you know that?']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: He told me.
subQuotationList: ['He told me.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Wife
indeed, I know those wives!
subQuotationList: ['Wife\nindeed, I know those wives!']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
Well,
you must trot off now, old man, and the Lord help us, the Lord help
us all. . .
subQuotationList: ['Well,\nyou must trot off now, old man, and the Lord help us, the Lord help\nus all. . .']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText: It's all a mistake,
subQuotationList: ["It's all a mistake,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Ah, ah, has some evidence come?
subQuotationList: ['Ah, ah, has some evidence come?']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: It will come,
subQuotationList: ['It will come,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Ah, yes, Mr. Fielding; but when once an Indian has been arrested,
we do not know where it will stop.
subQuotationList: ['Ah, yes, Mr. Fielding; but when once an Indian has been arrested,\nwe do not know where it will stop.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
You are very good to greet me in this public fashion, I appreciate
it; but, Mr. Fielding, nothing convinces a magistrate except
evidence. Did Mr. McBryde make any remark when my card came in? Do
you think my application annoyed him, will prejudice him against
my friend at all? If so, I will gladly retire.
subQuotationList:
['You are very good to greet me in this public fashion, I appreciate
it; but, Mr. Fielding, nothing convinces a magistrate except
evidence. Did Mr. McBryde make any remark when my card came in? Do
you think my application annoyed him, will prejudice him against
my friend at all? If so, I will gladly retire.']
speaker: Hamidullah
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Dr. Aziz']]]

quoteText: He's not annoyed, and if he was, what does it matter?
subQuotationList: ["He's not annoyed, and if he was, what does it matter?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Ah, it's all very well for you to speak like that, but we have to
live in this country.
subQuotationList: ["Ah, it's all very well for you to speak like that, but we have to\nlive in this country."]
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: First and foremost, the question of bail . . .
subQuotationList: ['First and foremost, the question of bail . . .']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Why drag in him, though?
subQuotationList: ['Why drag in him, though?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

subQuotationList: ["Oh no, we must hit with all our strength. When I saw my friend's\nprivate papers carried in just now in the arms of a dirty policeman,\nI said to myself,    Amritrao is the man to clear up this.'"]
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
Don't complicate,
let the cards play themselves, We're bound to win, there's nothing
else we can do. She will never be able to substantiate the charge.
subQuotationList: ["Don't complicate,\nlet the cards play themselves,", "We're bound to win, there's nothing\nelse we can do. She will never be able to substantiate the charge."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: At a crisis, the English are really unequalled.
subQuotationList: ['At a crisis, the English are really unequalled.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
Good-bye, then, my dear Hamidullah (we must drop the    Mr.' now).
Give Aziz my love when you see him, and tell him to keep calm,
calm, calm. I shall go back to the College now. If you want me,
ring me up; if you don't, don't, for I shall be very busy.
subQuotationList:
["Good-bye, then, my dear Hamidullah (we must drop the    Mr.' now).
Give Aziz my love when you see him, and tell him to keep calm,
calm, calm. I shall go back to the College now. If you want me,
ring me up; if you don't, don't, for I shall be very busy."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Good-bye, my dear Fielding, and you actually are on our side
against your own people?
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye, my dear Fielding, and you actually are on our side\nagainst your own people?']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: Yes. Definitely.
subQuotationList: ['Yes. Definitely.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
May I now take my leave? Now I take
my leave, I must tell you how glad I am to hear that after all you
succeeded in reaching the Marabar. I feared my unpunctuality had
prevented you, but you went (a far pleasanter method) in Miss
Derek's car. I hope the expedition was a successful one.
subQuotationList:
['May I now take my leave?', "Now I take
my leave, I must tell you how glad I am to hear that after all you
succeeded in reaching the Marabar. I feared my unpunctuality had
prevented you, but you went (a far pleasanter method) in Miss
Derek's car. I hope the expedition was a successful one."]
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: The news has not reached you yet, I can see.
subQuotationList: ['The news has not reached you yet, I can see.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Oh yes.
subQuotationList: ['Oh yes.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: No; there has been a terrible catastrophe about Aziz.
subQuotationList: ['No; there has been a terrible catastrophe about Aziz.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Oh yes. That is all round the College.
subQuotationList: ['Oh yes. That is all round the College.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
Well, the expedition where that occurs can scarcely be called a
successful one,
subQuotationList: ['Well, the expedition where that occurs can scarcely be called a\nsuccessful one,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I cannot say. I was not present.
subQuotationList: ['I cannot say. I was not present.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: I am most frightfully cut up,
subQuotationList: ['I am most frightfully cut up,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

subQuotationList: ['So I saw at once on entering your office. I must not detain you,\nbut I have a small private difficulty on which I want your help;\nI am leaving your service shortly, as you know.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Yes, alas!
subQuotationList: ['Yes, alas!']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
And am returning to my birthplace in Central India to take charge
of education there. I want to start a High School there on sound
English lines, that shall be as like Government College as
possible.
subQuotationList:
['And am returning to my birthplace in Central India to take charge
of education there. I want to start a High School there on sound
English lines, that shall be as like Government College as
possible.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Well?
subQuotationList: ['Well?']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
At present there is only vernacular education at Mau. I shall feel
it my duty to change all that. I shall advise His Highness to
sanction at least a High School in the Capital, and if possible
another in each pargana.
subQuotationList:
['At present there is only vernacular education at Mau. I shall feel
it my duty to change all that. I shall advise His Highness to
sanction at least a High School in the Capital, and if possible
another in each pargana.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
The point   the point on which I desire your help is this: what name
should be given to the school?
subQuotationList: ['The point   the point on which I desire your help is this: what name\nshould be given to the school?']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: A name? A name for a school?
subQuotationList: ['A name? A name for a school?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Yes, a name, a suitable title, by which it can be called, by which
it may be generally known.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, a name, a suitable title, by which it can be called, by which\nit may be generally known.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
Really   I have no names for schools in my head. I can think of
nothing but our poor Aziz. Have you grasped that at the present
moment he is in prison?
subQuotationList: ['Really   I have no names for schools in my head. I can think of\nnothing but our poor Aziz. Have you grasped that at the present\nmoment he is in prison?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Oh yes. Oh no, I do not expect an answer to my question now. I
only meant that when you are at leisure, you might think the matter
over, and suggest two or three alternative titles for schools. I
had thought of the    Mr. Fielding High School,' but failing that,
the    King-Emperor George the Fifth.'
subQuotationList:
["Oh yes. Oh no, I do not expect an answer to my question now. I
only meant that when you are at leisure, you might think the matter
over, and suggest two or three alternative titles for schools. I
had thought of the    Mr. Fielding High School,' but failing that,
the    King-Emperor George the Fifth.'"]
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Godbole!
subQuotationList: ['Godbole!']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Is Aziz innocent or guilty?
subQuotationList: ['Is Aziz innocent or guilty?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
That is for the Court to decide. The verdict will be in strict
accordance with the evidence, I make no doubt.
subQuotationList: ['That is for the Court to decide. The verdict will be in strict\naccordance with the evidence, I make no doubt.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
Yes, yes, but your personal opinion. Here's a man we both like,
generally esteemed; he lives here quietly doing his work. Well,
what's one to make of it? Would he or would he not do such a
thing?
subQuotationList:
["Yes, yes, but your personal opinion. Here's a man we both like,
generally esteemed; he lives here quietly doing his work. Well,
what's one to make of it? Would he or would he not do such a
thing?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor Godbole'], ['Professor Godbole', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz']]]

quoteText:
Ah, that is rather a different question from your previous one,
and also more difficult: I mean difficult in our philosophy. Dr.
Aziz is a most worthy young man, I have a great regard for him;
but I think you are asking me whether the individual can commit
good actions or evil actions, and that is rather difficult for us.
subQuotationList:
['Ah, that is rather a different question from your previous one,
and also more difficult: I mean difficult in our philosophy. Dr.
Aziz is a most worthy young man, I have a great regard for him;
but I think you are asking me whether the individual can commit
good actions or evil actions, and that is rather difficult for us.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
I ask you: did he do it or not? Is that plain? I know he didn't,
and from that I start. I mean to get at the true explanation in a
couple of days. My last notion is that it's the guide who went
round with them. Malice on Miss Quested's part   it couldn't be that,
though Hamidullah thinks so. She has certainly had some appalling
experience. But you tell me, oh no   because good and evil are the
same.
subQuotationList:
["I ask you: did he do it or not? Is that plain? I know he didn't,
and from that I start. I mean to get at the true explanation in a
couple of days. My last notion is that it's the guide who went
round with them. Malice on Miss Quested's part   it couldn't be that,
though Hamidullah thinks so. She has certainly had some appalling
experience. But you tell me, oh no   because good and evil are the
same."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Professor Godbole'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Hamidullah'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Professor Godbole']]]

quoteText:
No, not exactly, please, according to our philosophy. Because
nothing can be performed in isolation. All perform a good action,
when one is performed, and when an evil action is performed, all
perform it. To illustrate my meaning, let me take the case in point
as an example.
subQuotationList:
['No, not exactly, please, according to our philosophy. Because
nothing can be performed in isolation. All perform a good action,
when one is performed, and when an evil action is performed, all
perform it. To illustrate my meaning, let me take the case in point
as an example.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
I am informed that an evil action was performed in the Marabar
Hills, and that a highly esteemed English lady is now seriously
ill in consequence. My answer to that is this: that action was
performed by Dr. Aziz.
subQuotationList:
['I am informed that an evil action was performed in the Marabar
Hills, and that a highly esteemed English lady is now seriously
ill in consequence. My answer to that is this: that action was
performed by Dr. Aziz.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: It was performed by the guide.
subQuotationList: ['It was performed by the guide.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
It was performed
by you.
subQuotationList: ['It was performed\nby you.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
It was
performed by me.
subQuotationList: ['It was\nperformed by me.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
And by my students. It was even performed by the lady herself.
When evil occurs, it expresses the whole of the universe. Similarly
when good occurs.
subQuotationList: ['And by my students. It was even performed by the lady herself.\nWhen evil occurs, it expresses the whole of the universe. Similarly\nwhen good occurs.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
And similarly when suffering occurs, and so on and so forth, and
everything is anything and nothing something,
subQuotationList: ['And similarly when suffering occurs, and so on and so forth, and\neverything is anything and nothing something,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Excuse me, you are now again changing the basis of our discussion.
We were discussing good and evil. Suffering is merely a matter for
the individual. If a young lady has sunstroke, that is a matter of
no significance to the universe. Oh no, not at all. Oh no, not the
least. It is an isolated matter, it only concerns herself. If she
thought her head did not ache, she would not be ill, and that would
end it. But it is far otherwise in the case of good and evil. They
are not what we think them, they are what they are, and each of us
has contributed to both.
subQuotationList:
['Excuse me, you are now again changing the basis of our discussion.
We were discussing good and evil. Suffering is merely a matter for
the individual. If a young lady has sunstroke, that is a matter of
no significance to the universe. Oh no, not at all. Oh no, not the
least. It is an isolated matter, it only concerns herself. If she
thought her head did not ache, she would not be ill, and that would
end it. But it is far otherwise in the case of good and evil. They
are not what we think them, they are what they are, and each of us
has contributed to both.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: You're preaching that evil and good are the same.
subQuotationList: ["You're preaching that evil and good are the same."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Oh no, excuse me once again. Good and evil are different, as their
names imply. But, in my own humble opinion, they are both of them
aspects of my Lord. He is present in the one, absent in the other,
and the difference between presence and absence is great, as great
as my feeble mind can grasp. Yet absence implies presence, absence
is not non-existence, and we are therefore entitled to repeat,
   Come, come, come, come.'
subQuotationList:
["Oh no, excuse me once again. Good and evil are different, as their
names imply. But, in my own humble opinion, they are both of them
aspects of my Lord. He is present in the one, absent in the other,
and the difference between presence and absence is great, as great
as my feeble mind can grasp. Yet absence implies presence, absence
is not non-existence, and we are therefore entitled to repeat,
   Come, come, come, come.'"]
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
But did you
have time to visit any of the interesting Marabar antiquities?
subQuotationList: ['But did you\nhave time to visit any of the interesting Marabar antiquities?']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Did you not even see the tank by the usual camping ground?
subQuotationList: ['Did you not even see the tank by the usual camping ground?']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Yes, yes,
subQuotationList: ['Yes, yes,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: That is good, then you saw the Tank of the Dagger.
subQuotationList: ['That is good, then you saw the Tank of the Dagger.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText:
dagger fell from his hand, and to
commemorate miracle he built Tank.
subQuotationList: ['dagger fell from his hand, and to\ncommemorate miracle he built Tank.']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: You deserted me,
subQuotationList: ['You deserted me,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
What can we do for
our sister?
subQuotationList: ['What can we do for\nour sister?']
speaker: _group
referringExpression: was the only thought of Mesdames Callendar and Lesley

quoteText: She is my own darling girl,
subQuotationList: ['She is my own darling girl,']
speaker: Mrs. Turton
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Mrs. Callendar', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'A Stray Subaltern', 'Miss Derek', 'Mrs. Blakiston']

quoteText:
Why don't one think more of
other people?
subQuotationList: ["Why don't one think more of\nother people?"]
speaker: Miss Derek
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Mrs. Callendar', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'A Stray Subaltern', 'Mrs. Blakiston']

quoteText: Don't worry, Mrs. Blakiston, those drums are only Mohurram,
subQuotationList: ["Don't worry, Mrs. Blakiston, those drums are only Mohurram,"]
speaker: _unknowable
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Mrs. Callendar', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'A Stray Subaltern', 'Miss Derek', 'Mrs. Blakiston']

quoteText: Then they've started,
subQuotationList: ["Then they've started,"]
speaker: Mrs. Blakiston
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Mrs. Callendar', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'A Stray Subaltern', 'Miss Derek']

quoteText:
No, of course not, and anyhow, they're not coming to the
club.
subQuotationList: ["No, of course not, and anyhow, they're not coming to the\nclub."]
speaker: _unknowable
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Mrs. Callendar', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'A Stray Subaltern', 'Miss Derek', 'Mrs. Blakiston']

quoteText:
And they're not coming to the Burra Sahib's bungalow
either, my dear, and that's where you and your baby'll sleep
tonight,
subQuotationList: ["And they're not coming to the Burra Sahib's bungalow\neither, my dear, and that's where you and your baby'll sleep\ntonight,"]
speaker: Mrs. Turton
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Mrs. Callendar', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'A Stray Subaltern', 'Miss Derek', 'Mrs. Blakiston']

quoteText:
I want
to talk specially to the ladies, Not the least cause

quoteText:
Will all ladies leave the smoking-room now, please? And remember what I have said. We look
to you to help us through a difficult time, and you can help us by
behaving as if everything is normal. It is all I ask. Can I rely
on you?

['Will all ladies leave the smoking-room now, please?', 'And remember what I have said. We look

quoteText:
_And_ a jolly suggestion, The army's got
to come in sooner or later. (A special train was in his mind
inseparable from troops.) This would never have happened if Barabas
Hill was under military control. Station a bunch of Gurkhas at the
entrance of the cave was all that was wanted.
subQuotationList:

to come in sooner or later. (A special train was in his mind

quoteText:
English no good, Native
troops for this country. Give me the sporting type of native, give
me Gurkhas, give me Rajputs, give me Jats, give me the Punjabi,
give me Sikhs, give me Marathas, Bhils, Afridis and Pathans, and
really if it comes to that, I don't mind if you give me the scums
of the bazaars. Properly led, mind. I'd lead them anywhere
subQuotationList:
['English no good,', "Native
troops for this country. Give me the sporting type of native, give
me Gurkhas, give me Rajputs, give me Jats, give me the Punjabi,
give me Sikhs, give me Marathas, Bhils, Afridis and Pathans, and
really if it comes to that, I don't mind if you give me the scums
of the bazaars. Properly led, mind. I'd lead them anywhere"]

quoteText:
Don't start carrying arms about. I want everything to go on
precisely as usual, until there's cause for the contrary. Get the
womenfolk off to the hills, but do it quietly, and for Heaven's
sake no more talk of special trains. Never mind what you think or
feel. Possibly I have feelings too. One isolated Indian has
attempted   is charged with an attempted crime.
subQuotationList:
["Don't start carrying arms about. I want everything to go on
precisely as usual, until there's cause for the contrary. Get the
womenfolk off to the hills, but do it quietly, and for Heaven's
sake no more talk of special trains. Never mind what you think or
feel. Possibly I have feelings too. One isolated Indian has
attempted   is charged with an attempted crime."]
speaker: Mr. Turton
referringExpression: The Collector nodded at him pleasantly and said

quoteText:
Act upon that fact until there are
more facts, Assume every Indian is an angel.
subQuotationList: ['Act upon that fact until there are\nmore facts,', 'Assume every Indian is an angel.']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText:
Right you are, Burra Sahib. . . . Angels. . . .
Exactly. . . .
subQuotationList: ['Right you are, Burra Sahib. . . . Angels. . . .\nExactly. . . .']
speaker: _unknowable

quoteText:
Exactly what I said. The
native's all right if you get him alone. Lesley! Lesley! You
remember the one I had a knock with on your Maidan last month.
Well, he was all right. Any native who plays polo is all right.
What you've got to stamp on is these educated classes, and, mind,
I do know what I'm talking about this time.
subQuotationList:
["Exactly what I said. The
native's all right if you get him alone. Lesley! Lesley! You
remember the one I had a knock with on your Maidan last month.
Well, he was all right. Any native who plays polo is all right.
What you've got to stamp on is these educated classes, and, mind,
I do know what I'm talking about this time."]

quoteText: H'm!

No one's out of danger
in this country as long as they have a temperature,

speaker: Major Callendar

speaker: Major Callendar

quoteText: How's the old lady?

quoteText: Temperature.

quoteText: My wife heard she was sinking.

quoteText:
So she may be. I guarantee nothing. I really can't be plagued with
questions, Lesley.
subQuotationList: ["So she may be. I guarantee nothing. I really can't be plagued with\nquestions, Lesley."]
speaker: Major Callendar

quoteText: Sorry, old man.

speaker: Mrs. Lesley

quoteText: Heaslop's just behind me.
subQuotationList: ["Heaslop's just behind me."]
speaker: Major Callendar

quoteText:
I wish to God I hadn't given my jewel of an assistant leave. I'ld
cut my tongue out first. To feel I'm responsible, that's what hits
me. To refuse, and then give in under pressure. That is what I did,
my sons, that is what I did.
subQuotationList:
["I wish to God I hadn't given my jewel of an assistant leave. I'ld
cut my tongue out first. To feel I'm responsible, that's what hits
me. To refuse, and then give in under pressure. That is what I did,
my sons, that is what I did."]

quoteText:
I understood an Englishman
was to accompany the expedition. That is why I gave in.
subQuotationList: ['I understood an Englishman\nwas to accompany the expedition. That is why I gave in.']
speaker: Major Callendar
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Mr. Turton', 'A Stray Subaltern']

quoteText:
No one blames you, my dear Callendar, We are all to blame in the sense that we ought to have seen
the expedition was insufficiently guaranteed, and stopped it. I
knew about it myself; we lent our car this morning to take the
ladies to the station. We are all implicated in that sense, but
not an atom of blame attaches to you personally.
subQuotationList:
['No one blames you, my dear Callendar,', 'We are all to blame in the sense that we ought to have seen
the expedition was insufficiently guaranteed, and stopped it. I
knew about it myself; we lent our car this morning to take the
ladies to the station. We are all implicated in that sense, but
not an atom of blame attaches to you personally.']

quoteText:
I don't feel that. I wish I could. Responsibility is a very awful
thing, and I've no use for the man who shirks it.

addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Major Callendar', 'A Stray Subaltern']

quoteText:
Heaslop warned Miss Quested's servant last night never to lose
sight of her. Prisoner got hold of this and managed to leave him
behind. Bribed him. Heaslop has just found out the whole story,
with names and sums   a well-known pimp to those people gave the
money, Mohammed Latif by name. So much for the servant. What about
the Englishman   our friend here? How did they get rid of him? Money
again.

his prayers. I know those prayers!

quoteText:
Heaslop also
found out something from his mother. Aziz paid a herd of natives
to suffocate her in a cave. That was the end of her, or would have
been only she got out. Nicely planned, wasn't it? Neat. Then he
could go on with the girl. He and she and a guide, provided by the
same Mohammed Latif. Guide now can't be found. Pretty.
subQuotationList:
["Heaslop also
found out something from his mother. Aziz paid a herd of natives

It's not the time for sitting down. It's the
time for action. Call in the troops and clear the bazaars.

nothing that's said inside the club will go outside the club?

addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Mr. Turton', 'A Stray Subaltern']

Oh, nothing. I only heard a rumour that a certain member here
present has been seeing the prisoner this afternoon. You can't run
with the hare and hunt with the hounds, at least not in this
country.

Oh please   please
all sit down, I only want to listen what has been decided.
subQuotationList: ['Oh please   please\nall sit down, I only want to listen what has been decided.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
referringExpression: Ronny who had not seen him said

quoteText:
Heaslop, I'm telling them I'm against any show of force, I don't know whether you will feel
as I do, but that is how I am situated. When the verdict is
obtained, it will be another matter.
subQuotationList: ["Heaslop, I'm telling them I'm against any show of force,", "I don't know whether you will feel\nas I do, but that is how I am situated. When the verdict is\nobtained, it will be another matter."]

addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Major Callendar', 'A Stray Subaltern']

quoteText: You are sure to know best; I have no experience, Burra Sahib.

speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: How is your mother, old boy?
subQuotationList: ['How is your mother, old boy?']
speaker: Mr. Turton
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Mr. Turton', 'A Stray Subaltern']

quoteText: Better, thank you. I wish everyone would sit down.

speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Some have never got up,
subQuotationList: ['Some have never got up,']

Heaslop, next time bail's wanted, ring up the old doctor before
giving it; his shoulders are broad, and, speaking in the strictest
confidence, don't take the old doctor's opinion too seriously. He's
a blithering idiot, we can always leave it at that, but he'll do
the little he can towards keeping in quod the Oh, but he has one of his friends here.
