speaker: Adela Quested
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Mr. Das', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText:
Now, Miss Quested, let us go on. I will read you
the words of the deposition which you signed two hours later in my
bungalow.
subQuotationList: ['Now, Miss Quested, let us go on. I will read you\nthe words of the deposition which you signed two hours later in my\nbungalow.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Mr. Das', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek']
referringExpression: The Superintendent slammed down his papers then picked them up and said

quoteText:
Excuse me, Mr. McBryde, you cannot go on. I am speaking to the
witness myself. And the public will be silent. If it continues to
talk, I have the court cleared. Miss Quested, address your remarks
to me, who am the Magistrate in charge of the case, and realize
their extreme gravity. Remember you speak on oath, Miss Quested.
subQuotationList:
['Excuse me, Mr. McBryde, you cannot go on. I am speaking to the
witness myself. And the public will be silent. If it continues to
talk, I have the court cleared. Miss Quested, address your remarks
to me, who am the Magistrate in charge of the case, and realize
their extreme gravity. Remember you speak on oath, Miss Quested.']
speaker: Mr. Das
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText: Dr. Aziz never
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Aziz never']
speaker: Adela Quested
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Mr. Das', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText: I stop these proceedings on medical grounds,
subQuotationList: ['I stop these proceedings on medical grounds,']
speaker: Major Callendar
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Mr. Das', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText: You withdraw the charge? Answer me,
subQuotationList: ['You withdraw the charge? Answer me,']
speaker: Mr. Das
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText: I withdraw everything.
subQuotationList: ['I withdraw everything.']
speaker: Adela Quested
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Mr. Das', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText:
Enough   sit down. Mr. McBryde, do you wish to continue in the face
of this?
subQuotationList: ['Enough   sit down. Mr. McBryde, do you wish to continue in the face\nof this?']
speaker: Mr. Das
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText: Are you mad?
subQuotationList: ['Are you mad?']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Mr. Das', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek']
referringExpression: The Superintendent gazed at his witness as if she was a broken machine and said

quoteText: Don't question her, sir; you have no longer the right.
subQuotationList: ["Don't question her, sir; you have no longer the right."]
speaker: Mr. Das
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText: Give me time to consider
subQuotationList: ['Give me time to consider']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Mr. Das', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek']

quoteText: Sahib, you will have to withdraw; this becomes a scandal,
subQuotationList: ['Sahib, you will have to withdraw; this becomes a scandal,']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Mr. Das', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText: He shall not, Call the other witnesses; we're none of us safe
subQuotationList: ['He shall not,', "Call the other witnesses; we're none of us safe"]
speaker: Mrs. Turton
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Major Callendar', 'Mr. Das', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText: Right, I withdraw.
subQuotationList: ['Right, I withdraw.']
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Mr. Das', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek']
referringExpression: The Superintendent moved to the support of his friends saying

quoteText:
The prisoner is released
without one stain on his character; the question of costs will be
decided elsewhere.
subQuotationList: ['The prisoner is released\nwithout one stain on his character; the question of costs will be\ndecided elsewhere.']
speaker: Mr. Das
addressees: ['Cyril Fielding', 'Ronny Heaslop', 'Mrs. Turton', 'Major Callendar', 'Adela Quested', 'Mr. Turton', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur', 'Mrs. Lesley', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mrs. Mcbryde', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Miss Derek', 'Mr. Mcbryde']

quoteText: What do you want here?
subQuotationList: ['What do you want here?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Where are you going, Miss Quested?
subQuotationList: ['Where are you going, Miss Quested?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I don't know.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: You can't wander about like that. Where's the car you came in?
subQuotationList: ["You can't wander about like that. Where's the car you came in?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I shall walk.
subQuotationList: ['I shall walk.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
What madness . . . there's supposed to be a riot on . . . the
police have struck, no one knows what'll happen next. Why don't
you keep to your own people?
subQuotationList: ["What madness . . . there's supposed to be a riot on . . . the\npolice have struck, no one knows what'll happen next. Why don't\nyou keep to your own people?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Ought I to join them?
subQuotationList: ['Ought I to join them?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
You can't, it's too late. How are you to get round to the private
entrance now? Come this way with me   quick   I'll put you into my
carriage.
subQuotationList: ["You can't, it's too late. How are you to get round to the private\nentrance now? Come this way with me   quick   I'll put you into my\ncarriage."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Cyril, Cyril, don't leave me,
subQuotationList: ["Cyril, Cyril, don't leave me,"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz
referringExpression: called the shattered voice of Aziz

quoteText: I'm coming back. . . . This way, and don't argue.
subQuotationList: ["I'm coming back. . . . This way, and don't argue."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Excuse manners, but I don't know anyone's position. Send my
carriage back any time to-morrow, if you please.
subQuotationList: ["Excuse manners, but I don't know anyone's position. Send my\ncarriage back any time to-morrow, if you please."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: But where am I to go in it?
subQuotationList: ['But where am I to go in it?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Where you like. How should I know your arrangements?
subQuotationList: ['Where you like. How should I know your arrangements?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
What   what have you been doing? Playing a
game, studying life, or what?
subQuotationList: ['What   what have you been doing?', 'Playing a\ngame, studying life, or what?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Sir, I intend these for you, sir,
subQuotationList: ['Sir, I intend these for you, sir,']
speaker: A Student

quoteText: I don't want the rubbish; get out.
subQuotationList: ["I don't want the rubbish; get out."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Sir, I am a horse, we shall be your horses,
subQuotationList: ['Sir, I am a horse, we shall be your horses,']
speaker: Rafi

quoteText: Fetch my sais, Rafi; there's a good chap.
subQuotationList: ["Fetch my sais, Rafi; there's a good chap."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: No, sir, this is an honour for us.
subQuotationList: ['No, sir, this is an honour for us.']
speaker: Rafi

quoteText: Hurry up, sir; we pull you in a procession.
subQuotationList: ['Hurry up, sir; we pull you in a procession.']
speaker: _unknowable

quoteText: I don't know whether this suits you, but anyhow you're safe,
subQuotationList: ["I don't know whether this suits you, but anyhow you're safe,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Sir, we fetch the others; sir, it is a
somewhat heavy load for our arms,
subQuotationList: ['Sir, we fetch the others; sir, it is a\nsomewhat heavy load for our arms,']
speaker: _unknowable

quoteText: Cyril, Cyril . . .
subQuotationList: ['Cyril, Cyril . . .']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: It is fate, It is fate,
subQuotationList: ['It is fate,', 'It is fate,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Why isn't Cyril following? Let us turn back.
subQuotationList: ["Why isn't Cyril following? Let us turn back."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Forward, forward, Down with the Collector, down with the
Superintendent of Police.
subQuotationList: ['Forward, forward,', 'Down with the Collector, down with the\nSuperintendent of Police.']
speaker: Mahmoud Ali

quoteText: Mr. Mahmoud Ali, this is not wise,
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Mahmoud Ali, this is not wise,']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText: Cyril, again you desert,
subQuotationList: ['Cyril, again you desert,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Yet some orderly demonstration is necessary, otherwise they will still think we are afraid.
subQuotationList: ['Yet some orderly demonstration is necessary,', 'otherwise they will still think we are afraid.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: Down with the Civil Surgeon . . . rescue Nureddin.
subQuotationList: ['Down with the Civil Surgeon . . . rescue Nureddin.']
speaker: Mahmoud Ali

quoteText: Nureddin?
subQuotationList: ['Nureddin?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: They are torturing him.
subQuotationList: ['They are torturing him.']
speaker: Mahmoud Ali

quoteText: Oh, my God . . .
subQuotationList: ['Oh, my God . . .']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
They are not. I will not have my grandson made an excuse for an
attack on the hospital,
subQuotationList: ['They are not. I will not have my grandson made an excuse for an\nattack on the hospital,']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText:
They are. Callendar boasted so before the trial. I heard through
the tatties; he said,
subQuotationList: ['They are. Callendar boasted so before the trial. I heard through\nthe tatties; he said,']
speaker: Mahmoud Ali

quoteText: Oh, my God, my God. . . . He called him a nigger, did he?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, my God, my God. . . . He called him a nigger, did he?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: They put pepper instead of antiseptic on the wounds.
subQuotationList: ['They put pepper instead of antiseptic on the wounds.']
speaker: Mahmoud Ali

quoteText:
Mr. Mahmoud Ali, impossible; a little roughness will not hurt the
boy, he needs discipline.
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Mahmoud Ali, impossible; a little roughness will not hurt the\nboy, he needs discipline.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur

quoteText:
Pepper. Civil Surgeon said so. They hope to destroy us one by one;
they shall fail.
subQuotationList: ['Pepper. Civil Surgeon said so. They hope to destroy us one by one;\nthey shall fail.']
speaker: Mahmoud Ali

quoteText: Man can but die the once,
subQuotationList: ['Man can but die the once,']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText:
Oh, forgive me, Oh, Dr. Aziz, forgive the wicked lies I
told.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, forgive me,', 'Oh, Dr. Aziz, forgive the wicked lies I\ntold.']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText:
I was afraid, I was
mislaid, I was mislaid here, there, and
everywhere as regards your character. Oh, forgive the poor old
hakim who gave you milk when ill! Oh, Nawab Bahadur, whoever
merciful, is it my poor little dispensary you require? Take every
cursed bottle.
subQuotationList:
['I was afraid, I was
mislaid,', 'I was mislaid here, there, and
everywhere as regards your character. Oh, forgive the poor old
hakim who gave you milk when ill! Oh, Nawab Bahadur, whoever
merciful, is it my poor little dispensary you require? Take every
cursed bottle.']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['The Nawab Badahur'], ['The Nawab Badahur']]]

quoteText:
Promptness, sir, promptness
similar to you,
subQuotationList: ['Promptness, sir, promptness\nsimilar to you,']
speaker: Dr. Panna Lal

quoteText:
We will have rejoicings to-night, Mr.
Hamidullah, I depute you to bring out our friends Fielding and
Amritrao, and to discover whether the latter will require special
food. The others will keep with me. We shall not go out to Dilkusha
until the cool of the evening, of course. I do not know the feelings
of other gentlemen; for my own part, I have a slight headache, and
I wish I had thought to ask our good Panna Lal for aspirin.
subQuotationList:
['We will have rejoicings to-night,', 'Mr.
Hamidullah, I depute you to bring out our friends Fielding and
Amritrao, and to discover whether the latter will require special
food. The others will keep with me. We shall not go out to Dilkusha
until the cool of the evening, of course. I do not know the feelings
of other gentlemen; for my own part, I have a slight headache, and
I wish I had thought to ask our good Panna Lal for aspirin.']
speaker: The Nawab Badahur
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz', 'Hamidullah', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'The Nawab Badahur']], [['Hamidullah'], ['Hamidullah'], ['The Nawab Badahur', 'Hamidullah', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mahmoud Ali'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Mr. Amritrao'], ['The Nawab Badahur', 'Hamidullah', 'Mr. Amritrao', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Mahmoud Ali', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Panna Lal']]]

quoteText: a sort of interview,
subQuotationList: ['a sort of interview,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Have you any explanation of my extraordinary
behaviour?
subQuotationList: ['Have you any explanation of my extraordinary\nbehaviour?']
speaker: Adela Quested
referringExpression: She asked whether she could have a sort of interview and when he made no reply said

quoteText:
None, Why make such a charge if you were going
to withdraw it?
subQuotationList: ['None,', 'Why make such a charge if you were going\nto withdraw it?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Why, indeed.
subQuotationList: ['Why, indeed.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I ought to feel grateful to you, I suppose, but
subQuotationList: ['I ought to feel grateful to you, I suppose, but']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I don't expect gratitude. I only thought you might care to hear
what I have to say.
subQuotationList: ["I don't expect gratitude. I only thought you might care to hear\nwhat I have to say."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Oh, well, I don't
think a discussion between us is desirable. To put it frankly, I
belong to the other side in this ghastly affair.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, well,', "I don't\nthink a discussion between us is desirable. To put it frankly, I\nbelong to the other side in this ghastly affair."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Would it not interest you to hear my side?
subQuotationList: ['Would it not interest you to hear my side?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Not much.
subQuotationList: ['Not much.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I shouldn't tell you in confidence, of course. So you can hand on
all my remarks to your side, for there is one great mercy that has
come out of all to-day's misery: I have no longer any secrets. My
echo has gone   I call the buzzing sound in my ears an echo. You see,
I have been unwell ever since that expedition to the caves, and
possibly before it.
subQuotationList:
["I shouldn't tell you in confidence, of course. So you can hand on
all my remarks to your side, for there is one great mercy that has
come out of all to-day's misery: I have no longer any secrets. My
echo has gone   I call the buzzing sound in my ears an echo. You see,
I have been unwell ever since that expedition to the caves, and
possibly before it."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: What kind of illness?
subQuotationList: ['What kind of illness?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: That was my first thought, the day of the arrest: hallucination.
subQuotationList: ['That was my first thought, the day of the arrest: hallucination.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Do you think that would be so? What should have given me an hallucination?
subQuotationList: ['Do you think that would be so?', 'What should have given me an hallucination?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
One of three things certainly happened in the Marabar, One of four
things. Either Aziz is guilty, which is what your friends think;
or you invented the charge out of malice, which is what my friends
think; or you have had an hallucination. I'm very much
inclined now that you tell me that
you felt unwell before the expedition   it's an important piece of
evidence   I believe that you yourself broke the strap of the
field-glasses; you were alone in that cave the whole time.
subQuotationList:
['One of three things certainly happened in the Marabar,', "One of four
things. Either Aziz is guilty, which is what your friends think;
or you invented the charge out of malice, which is what my friends
think; or you have had an hallucination. I'm very much
inclined", "now that you tell me that
you felt unwell before the expedition   it's an important piece of
evidence   I believe that you yourself broke the strap of the
field-glasses; you were alone in that cave the whole time."]
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']], [['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: Perhaps. . . .
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps. . . .']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Can you remember when you first felt out of sorts?
subQuotationList: ['Can you remember when you first felt out of sorts?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: When I came to tea with you there, in that garden-house.
subQuotationList: ['When I came to tea with you there, in that garden-house.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
A somewhat unlucky party. Aziz and old Godbole were both ill after
it too.
subQuotationList: ['A somewhat unlucky party. Aziz and old Godbole were both ill after\nit too.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I was not ill   it is far too vague to mention: it is all mixed up
with my private affairs. I enjoyed the singing . . . but just about
then a sort of sadness began that I couldn't detect at the time . . .
no, nothing as solid as sadness: living at half pressure
expresses it best. Half pressure. I remember going on to polo with
Mr. Heaslop at the Maidan. Various other things happened   it doesn't
matter what, but I was under par for all of them. I was certainly
in that state when I saw the caves, and you suggest (nothing shocks
or hurts me)   you suggest that I had an hallucination there, the
sort of thing   though in an awful form   that makes some women think
they've had an offer of marriage when none was made.
subQuotationList:
["I was not ill   it is far too vague to mention: it is all mixed up
with my private affairs. I enjoyed the singing . . . but just about
then a sort of sadness began that I couldn't detect at the time . . .
no, nothing as solid as sadness: living at half pressure
expresses it best. Half pressure. I remember going on to polo with
Mr. Heaslop at the Maidan. Various other things happened   it doesn't
matter what, but I was under par for all of them. I was certainly
in that state when I saw the caves, and you suggest (nothing shocks
or hurts me)   you suggest that I had an hallucination there, the
sort of thing   though in an awful form   that makes some women think
they've had an offer of marriage when none was made."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: You put it honestly, anyhow.
subQuotationList: ['You put it honestly, anyhow.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I was brought up to be honest; the trouble is it gets me nowhere.
subQuotationList: ['I was brought up to be honest; the trouble is it gets me nowhere.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: It'll get us to heaven.
subQuotationList: ["It'll get us to heaven."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Will it?
subQuotationList: ['Will it?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: If heaven existed.
subQuotationList: ['If heaven existed.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Do you not believe in heaven, Mr. Fielding, may I ask?
subQuotationList: ['Do you not believe in heaven, Mr. Fielding, may I ask?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I do not. Yet I believe that honesty gets us there.
subQuotationList: ['I do not. Yet I believe that honesty gets us there.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: How can that be?
subQuotationList: ['How can that be?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Let us go back to hallucinations. I was watching you carefully
through your evidence this morning, and if I'm right, the
hallucination (what you call half pressure   quite as good a word)
disappeared suddenly.
subQuotationList:
["Let us go back to hallucinations. I was watching you carefully
through your evidence this morning, and if I'm right, the
hallucination (what you call half pressure   quite as good a word)
disappeared suddenly."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
My belief   and of course I was listening carefully, in hope you
would make some slip   my belief is that poor McBryde exorcised you.
As soon as he asked you a straightforward question, you gave a
straightforward answer, and broke down.
subQuotationList:
['My belief   and of course I was listening carefully, in hope you
would make some slip   my belief is that poor McBryde exorcised you.
As soon as he asked you a straightforward question, you gave a
straightforward answer, and broke down.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: Exorcise in that sense. I thought you meant I'd seen a ghost.
subQuotationList: ["Exorcise in that sense. I thought you meant I'd seen a ghost."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I don't go to that length!
subQuotationList: ["I don't go to that length!"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: People whom I respect very much believe in ghosts, My friend Mrs. Moore does.
subQuotationList: ['People whom I respect very much believe in ghosts,', 'My friend Mrs. Moore does.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: She's an old lady.
subQuotationList: ["She's an old lady."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I think you need not be impolite to her, as well as to her son.
subQuotationList: ['I think you need not be impolite to her, as well as to her son.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
I did not intend to be rude. I only meant it is difficult, as we
get on in life, to resist the supernatural. I've felt it coming on
me myself. I still jog on without it, but what a temptation, at
forty-five, to pretend that the dead live again; one's own dead;
no one else's matter.
subQuotationList:
["I did not intend to be rude. I only meant it is difficult, as we
get on in life, to resist the supernatural. I've felt it coming on
me myself. I still jog on without it, but what a temptation, at
forty-five, to pretend that the dead live again; one's own dead;
no one else's matter."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Because the dead don't live again.
subQuotationList: ["Because the dead don't live again."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I fear not.
subQuotationList: ['I fear not.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: So do I.
subQuotationList: ['So do I.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: What does Dr. Aziz say of me?
subQuotationList: ['What does Dr. Aziz say of me?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
He   he has not been capable of thought in his misery, naturally
he's very bitter,
subQuotationList: ["He   he has not been capable of thought in his misery, naturally\nhe's very bitter,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
But let me conclude my analysis.
We are agreed that he is not a villain and that you are not one,
and we aren't really sure that it was an hallucination. There's a
fourth possibility which we must touch on: was it somebody else?
subQuotationList:
["But let me conclude my analysis.
We are agreed that he is not a villain and that you are not one,
and we aren't really sure that it was an hallucination. There's a
fourth possibility which we must touch on: was it somebody else?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested', 'Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText: The guide.
subQuotationList: ['The guide.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Exactly, the guide. I often think so. Unluckily Aziz hit him on
the face, and he got a fright and disappeared. It is most
unsatisfactory, and we hadn't the police to help us, the guide was
of no interest to them.
subQuotationList:
["Exactly, the guide. I often think so. Unluckily Aziz hit him on
the face, and he got a fright and disappeared. It is most
unsatisfactory, and we hadn't the police to help us, the guide was
of no interest to them."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Perhaps it was the guide,
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps it was the guide,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Or could it have been one of that gang of Pathans who have been
drifting through the district?
subQuotationList: ['Or could it have been one of that gang of Pathans who have been\ndrifting through the district?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Someone who was in another cave, and followed me when the guide
was looking away? Possibly.
subQuotationList: ['Someone who was in another cave, and followed me when the guide\nwas looking away? Possibly.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Hullo, my dear Fielding, So I run
you down at last. Can you come out at once to Dilkusha?
subQuotationList: ['Hullo, my dear Fielding,', 'So I run\nyou down at last. Can you come out at once to Dilkusha?']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: At once?
subQuotationList: ['At once?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I hope to leave in a moment, don't let me interrupt,
subQuotationList: ["I hope to leave in a moment, don't let me interrupt,"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
The telephone has been broken; Miss Quested can't ring up her
friends,
subQuotationList: ["The telephone has been broken; Miss Quested can't ring up her\nfriends,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
A great deal has been broken, more than will ever be mended, Still, there should be some way of transporting this
lady back to the civil lines. The resources of civilization are
numerous.
subQuotationList: ['A great deal has been broken, more than will ever be mended,', 'Still, there should be some way of transporting this\nlady back to the civil lines. The resources of civilization are\nnumerous.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
Miss Quested has been explaining a little about her conduct of
this morning.
subQuotationList: ['Miss Quested has been explaining a little about her conduct of\nthis morning.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding
referringExpression: Fielding who thought the meeting might as well be friendly said

quoteText:
Perhaps the age of miracles has returned. One must be prepared
for everything, our philosophers say.
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps the age of miracles has returned. One must be prepared\nfor everything, our philosophers say.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
It must have seemed a miracle to the onlookers, The fact is that I realized before it
was too late that I had made a mistake, and had just enough presence
of mind to say so. That is all my extraordinary conduct amounts
to.
subQuotationList:
['It must have seemed a miracle to the onlookers,', 'The fact is that I realized before it
was too late that I had made a mistake, and had just enough presence
of mind to say so. That is all my extraordinary conduct amounts
to.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: All it amounts to, indeed,
subQuotationList: ['All it amounts to, indeed,']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
Speaking as a private individual, in a purely informal
conversation, I admired your conduct, and I was delighted when our
warm-hearted students garlanded you. But, like Mr. Fielding, I am
surprised; indeed, surprise is too weak a word. I see you drag my
best friend into the dirt, damage his health and ruin his prospects
in a way you cannot conceive owing to your ignorance of our society
and religion, and then suddenly you get up in the witness-box: Am I mad? I keep asking myself. Is it a dream, and if
so, when did it start? And without doubt it is a dream that has
not yet finished. For I gather you have not done with us yet, and
it is now the turn of the poor old guide who conducted you round
the caves.
subQuotationList:
['Speaking as a private individual, in a purely informal
conversation, I admired your conduct, and I was delighted when our
warm-hearted students garlanded you. But, like Mr. Fielding, I am
surprised; indeed, surprise is too weak a word. I see you drag my
best friend into the dirt, damage his health and ruin his prospects
in a way you cannot conceive owing to your ignorance of our society
and religion, and then suddenly you get up in the witness-box:', 'Am I mad? I keep asking myself. Is it a dream, and if
so, when did it start? And without doubt it is a dream that has
not yet finished. For I gather you have not done with us yet, and
it is now the turn of the poor old guide who conducted you round
the caves.']
speaker: Hamidullah
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']], [['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: Not at all, we were only discussing possibilities,
subQuotationList: ['Not at all, we were only discussing possibilities,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
An interesting pastime, but a lengthy one. There are one hundred
and seventy million Indians in this notable peninsula, and of
course one or other of them entered the cave. Of course some Indian
is the culprit, we must never doubt that. And since, my dear
Fielding, these possibilities will take you some time
subQuotationList:
['An interesting pastime, but a lengthy one. There are one hundred
and seventy million Indians in this notable peninsula, and of
course one or other of them entered the cave. Of course some Indian
is the culprit, we must never doubt that. And since, my dear
Fielding, these possibilities will take you some time']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
don't you think you had better come out to the Nawab
Bahadur's   or I should say to Mr. Zulfiqar's, for that is the name
he now requires us to call him by.
subQuotationList: ["don't you think you had better come out to the Nawab\nBahadur's   or I should say to Mr. Zulfiqar's, for that is the name\nhe now requires us to call him by."]
speaker: Hamidullah
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['The Nawab Badahur'], ['The Nawab Badahur'], ['The Nawab Badahur'], ['The Nawab Badahur']]]

quoteText: Gladly, in a minute . . .
subQuotationList: ['Gladly, in a minute . . .']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I have just settled my movements, I shall go
to the Dak Bungalow.
subQuotationList: ['I have just settled my movements,', 'I shall go\nto the Dak Bungalow.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Not the Turtons'? I thought you
were their guest.
subQuotationList: ["Not the Turtons'?", 'I thought you\nwere their guest.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
I have
a better idea than that, Miss Quested. You must stop here at the
College. I shall be away at least two days, and you can have the
place entirely to yourself, and make your plans at your convenience.
subQuotationList:
['I have
a better idea than that, Miss Quested. You must stop here at the
College. I shall be away at least two days, and you can have the
place entirely to yourself, and make your plans at your convenience.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding
referringExpression: Fielding though he continued to sway with Hamidullah was thinking on independent lines and said

quoteText:
I don't agree at all, The idea is a thoroughly bad one. There may quite well be
another demonstration to-night, and suppose an attack is made on
the College. You would be held responsible for this lady's safety,
my dear fellow.
subQuotationList:
["I don't agree at all,", "The idea is a thoroughly bad one. There may quite well be
another demonstration to-night, and suppose an attack is made on
the College. You would be held responsible for this lady's safety,
my dear fellow."]
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: They might equally attack the Dak Bungalow.
subQuotationList: ['They might equally attack the Dak Bungalow.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Exactly, but the responsibility there ceases to be yours.
subQuotationList: ['Exactly, but the responsibility there ceases to be yours.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: Quite so. I have given trouble enough.
subQuotationList: ['Quite so. I have given trouble enough.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Do you hear? The lady admits it herself. It's not an attack from
our people I fear   you should see their orderly conduct at the
hospital; what we must guard against is an attack secretly arranged
by the police for the purpose of discrediting you. McBryde keeps
plenty of roughs for this purpose, and this would be the very
opportunity for him.
subQuotationList:
["Do you hear? The lady admits it herself. It's not an attack from
our people I fear   you should see their orderly conduct at the
hospital; what we must guard against is an attack secretly arranged
by the police for the purpose of discrediting you. McBryde keeps
plenty of roughs for this purpose, and this would be the very
opportunity for him."]
speaker: Hamidullah
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Mr. Mcbryde']]]

quoteText: Never mind. She is not going to the Dak Bungalow,
subQuotationList: ['Never mind. She is not going to the Dak Bungalow,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Then where is she to go? We shall never have done with her!
subQuotationList: ['Then where is she to go? We shall never have done with her!']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
But where is she to have her dinner, where is she to sleep? I say
here, here, and if she is hit on the head by roughs, she is hit on
the head. That is my contribution. Well, Miss Quested?
subQuotationList: ['But where is she to have her dinner, where is she to sleep? I say\nhere, here, and if she is hit on the head by roughs, she is hit on\nthe head. That is my contribution. Well, Miss Quested?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText:
You are very kind. I should have said yes, I think, but I agree
with Mr. Hamidullah. I must give no more trouble to you. I believe
my best plan is to return to the Turtons, and see if they will
allow me to sleep, and if they turn me away I must go to the Dak.
The Collector would take me in, I know, but Mrs. Turton said this
morning that she would never see me again.
subQuotationList:
['You are very kind. I should have said yes, I think, but I agree
with Mr. Hamidullah. I must give no more trouble to you. I believe
my best plan is to return to the Turtons, and see if they will
allow me to sleep, and if they turn me away I must go to the Dak.
The Collector would take me in, I know, but Mrs. Turton said this
morning that she would never see me again.']
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Hamidullah'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Turton'], ['Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Turton'], ['Mr. Turton', 'Mrs. Turton'], ['Mr. Turton'], ['Mrs. Turton'], ['Mrs. Turton']]]

quoteText:
Far better stop here than expose yourself to insults from that
preposterous woman.
subQuotationList: ['Far better stop here than expose yourself to insults from that\npreposterous woman.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Do you find her preposterous? I used to. I don't now.
subQuotationList: ["Do you find her preposterous? I used to. I don't now."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Well, here's our solution, Here
comes the City Magistrate. He comes in a third-class band-ghari
for purposes of disguise, he comes unattended, but here comes the
City Magistrate.
subQuotationList:
["Well, here's our solution,", 'Here
comes the City Magistrate. He comes in a third-class band-ghari
for purposes of disguise, he comes unattended, but here comes the
City Magistrate.']
speaker: Hamidullah
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested', 'Hamidullah', 'Cyril Fielding']], [['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Ronny Heaslop']]]

quoteText: At last,
subQuotationList: ['At last,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: He comes, he comes, he comes. I cringe. I tremble.
subQuotationList: ['He comes, he comes, he comes. I cringe. I tremble.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: Will you ask him what he wants, Mr. Fielding?
subQuotationList: ['Will you ask him what he wants, Mr. Fielding?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: He wants you, of course.
subQuotationList: ['He wants you, of course.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: He may not even know I'm here.
subQuotationList: ["He may not even know I'm here."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I'll see him first, if you prefer.
subQuotationList: ["I'll see him first, if you prefer."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Really, really.
Need you have exposed Mr. Fielding to this further discomfort? He
is far too considerate.
subQuotationList: ['Really, really.\nNeed you have exposed Mr. Fielding to this further discomfort? He\nis far too considerate.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
He has some news for you, You'll find him on the
verandah. He prefers not to come in.
subQuotationList: ['He has some news for you,', "You'll find him on the\nverandah. He prefers not to come in."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Does he tell me to come out to him?
subQuotationList: ['Does he tell me to come out to him?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Whether he tells you or not, you will go, I think,
subQuotationList: ['Whether he tells you or not, you will go, I think,']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: Perfectly right,
subQuotationList: ['Perfectly right,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Thank goodness, that's over,
subQuotationList: ["Thank goodness, that's over,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: It was insulting of him not to come in.
subQuotationList: ['It was insulting of him not to come in.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
He couldn't very well after my behaviour to him at the Club.
Heaslop doesn't come out badly. Besides, Fate has treated him
pretty roughly to-day. He has had a cable to the effect that his
mother's dead, poor old soul.
subQuotationList:
["He couldn't very well after my behaviour to him at the Club.
Heaslop doesn't come out badly. Besides, Fate has treated him
pretty roughly to-day. He has had a cable to the effect that his
mother's dead, poor old soul."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Ronny Heaslop']]]

quoteText: Oh, really. Mrs. Moore. I'm sorry,
subQuotationList: ["Oh, really. Mrs. Moore. I'm sorry,"]
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: She died at sea.
subQuotationList: ['She died at sea.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: The heat, I suppose.
subQuotationList: ['The heat, I suppose.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: Presumably.
subQuotationList: ['Presumably.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: May is no month to allow an old lady to travel in.
subQuotationList: ['May is no month to allow an old lady to travel in.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
Quite so. Heaslop ought never to have let her go, and he knows
it. Shall we be off?
subQuotationList: ['Quite so. Heaslop ought never to have let her go, and he knows\nit. Shall we be off?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Let us wait until the happy couple leave the compound clear . . .
they really are intolerable dawdling there. Ah well, Fielding,
you don't believe in Providence, I remember. I do. This is Heaslop's
punishment for abducting our witness in order to stop us establishing
our alibi.
subQuotationList:
["Let us wait until the happy couple leave the compound clear . . .
they really are intolerable dawdling there. Ah well, Fielding,
you don't believe in Providence, I remember. I do. This is Heaslop's
punishment for abducting our witness in order to stop us establishing
our alibi."]
speaker: Hamidullah
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Hamidullah', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested', 'Ronny Heaslop'], ['Adela Quested', 'Ronny Heaslop'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Mrs. Moore']]]

quoteText:
You go rather too far there. The poor old lady's evidence could
have had no value, shout and shriek Mahmoud Ali as he will. She
couldn't see through the Kawa Dol even if she had wanted to. Only
Miss Quested could have saved him.
subQuotationList:
["You go rather too far there. The poor old lady's evidence could
have had no value, shout and shriek Mahmoud Ali as he will. She
couldn't see through the Kawa Dol even if she had wanted to. Only
Miss Quested could have saved him."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Hamidullah'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mahmoud Ali'], ['Mahmoud Ali'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Dr. Aziz']]]

quoteText: She loved Aziz, he says, also India, and he loved her.
subQuotationList: ['She loved Aziz, he says, also India, and he loved her.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
Love is of no value in a witness, as a barrister ought to know.
But I see there is about to be an Esmiss Esmoor legend at
Chandrapore, my dear Hamidullah, and I will not impede its growth.
subQuotationList: ['Love is of no value in a witness, as a barrister ought to know.\nBut I see there is about to be an Esmiss Esmoor legend at\nChandrapore, my dear Hamidullah, and I will not impede its growth.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Oh, this is unbearable!
subQuotationList: ['Oh, this is unbearable!']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: Mr. Fielding, has Ronny told you of this new misfortune?
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Fielding, has Ronny told you of this new misfortune?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Ah me!
subQuotationList: ['Ah me!']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Heaslop is waiting for you, I think.
subQuotationList: ['Heaslop is waiting for you, I think.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I do so long to be alone. She was my best friend, far more to me
than to him. I can't bear to be with Ronny . . . I can't explain
. . . Could you do me the very great kindness of letting me stop
after all?
subQuotationList:
["I do so long to be alone. She was my best friend, far more to me
than to him. I can't bear to be with Ronny . . . I can't explain
. . . Could you do me the very great kindness of letting me stop
after all?"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I should be pleased, but does Mr. Heaslop wish it?
subQuotationList: ['I should be pleased, but does Mr. Heaslop wish it?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I didn't ask him, we are too much upset   it's so complex, not like
what unhappiness is supposed to be. Each of us ought to be alone,
and think. Do come and see Ronny again.
subQuotationList: ["I didn't ask him, we are too much upset   it's so complex, not like\nwhat unhappiness is supposed to be. Each of us ought to be alone,\nand think. Do come and see Ronny again."]
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Adela Quested', 'Ronny Heaslop'], ['Adela Quested', 'Ronny Heaslop'], ['Ronny Heaslop']]]

quoteText: I think he should come in this time, Do ask him to come.
subQuotationList: ['I think he should come in this time,', 'Do ask him to come.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I came to
bring Miss Quested away, but her visit to the Turtons has ended,
and there is no other arrangement so far, mine are bachelor quarters
now
subQuotationList:
['I came to
bring Miss Quested away, but her visit to the Turtons has ended,
and there is no other arrangement so far, mine are bachelor quarters
now']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText:
Say no more, Miss Quested stops
here. I only wanted to be assured of your approval. Miss Quested,
you had better send for your own servant if he can be found, but
I will leave orders with mine to do all they can for you, also I'll
let the Scouts know. They have guarded the College ever since it
was closed, and may as well go on. I really think you'll be as safe
here as anywhere. I shall be back Thursday.
subQuotationList:
["Say no more, Miss Quested stops
here. I only wanted to be assured of your approval. Miss Quested,
you had better send for your own servant if he can be found, but
I will leave orders with mine to do all they can for you, also I'll
let the Scouts know. They have guarded the College ever since it
was closed, and may as well go on. I really think you'll be as safe
here as anywhere. I shall be back Thursday."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText:
We hear, sir, that your mother has died.
May we ask where the cable came from?
subQuotationList: ['We hear, sir, that your mother has died.\nMay we ask where the cable came from?']
speaker: Hamidullah
referringExpression: Hamidullah determined to spare the enemy no incidental pain had said to Ronny

quoteText: Aden.
subQuotationList: ['Aden.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop

quoteText: Ah, you were boasting she had reached Aden, in court.
subQuotationList: ['Ah, you were boasting she had reached Aden, in court.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
But she died on leaving Bombay, She was dead
when they called her name this morning. She must have been buried
at sea.
subQuotationList: ['But she died on leaving Bombay,', 'She was dead\nwhen they called her name this morning. She must have been buried\nat sea.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
It is clearly
to be understood, sir, that neither Mr. Fielding nor any of us are
responsible for this lady's safety at Government College,
subQuotationList: ["It is clearly\nto be understood, sir, that neither Mr. Fielding nor any of us are\nresponsible for this lady's safety at Government College,"]
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
Mr. Amritrao, have you considered what sum Miss Quested ought to
pay as compensation?
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Amritrao, have you considered what sum Miss Quested ought to\npay as compensation?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Twenty thousand rupees.
subQuotationList: ['Twenty thousand rupees.']
speaker: Mr. Amritrao

quoteText: Aziz, are you awake?
subQuotationList: ['Aziz, are you awake?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: No, so let us have a talk; let us dream plans for the future.
subQuotationList: ['No, so let us have a talk; let us dream plans for the future.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I am useless at dreaming.
subQuotationList: ['I am useless at dreaming.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Good night then, dear fellow.
subQuotationList: ['Good night then, dear fellow.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Are you content with our day's work, Cyril?
subQuotationList: ["Are you content with our day's work, Cyril?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz
referringExpression: the voice on his left continued

quoteText: Are you?
subQuotationList: ['Are you?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Except that I ate too much.
subQuotationList: ['Except that I ate too much.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I say,
Panna Lal and Callendar 'll get the sack.
subQuotationList: ["I say,\nPanna Lal and Callendar 'll get the sack."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: There'll be a general move at Chandrapore.
subQuotationList: ["There'll be a general move at Chandrapore."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: And you'll get promotion.
subQuotationList: ["And you'll get promotion."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: They can't well move me down, whatever their feelings.
subQuotationList: ["They can't well move me down, whatever their feelings."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
In any case we spend our holidays together, and visit Kashmir,
possibly Persia, for I shall have plenty of money. Paid to me on
account of the injury sustained by my character, While with me you shall never spend a single pie.
This is what I have always wished, and as the result of my
misfortunes it has come.
subQuotationList:
['In any case we spend our holidays together, and visit Kashmir,
possibly Persia, for I shall have plenty of money. Paid to me on
account of the injury sustained by my character,', 'While with me you shall never spend a single pie.
This is what I have always wished, and as the result of my
misfortunes it has come.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: You have won a great victory . . .
subQuotationList: ['You have won a great victory . . .']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I know, my dear chap, I know; your voice need not become so solemn
and anxious. I know what you are going to say next: Let, oh let
Miss Quested off paying, so that the English may say,
subQuotationList: ['I know, my dear chap, I know; your voice need not become so solemn\nand anxious. I know what you are going to say next: Let, oh let\nMiss Quested off paying, so that the English may say,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
The approval of your compatriots no longer interests me, I have
become anti-British, and ought to have done so sooner, it would
have saved me numerous misfortunes.
subQuotationList: ['The approval of your compatriots no longer interests me, I have\nbecome anti-British, and ought to have done so sooner, it would\nhave saved me numerous misfortunes.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Including knowing me.
subQuotationList: ['Including knowing me.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I say, shall we go and pour water on to Mohammed Latif's face? He
is so funny when this is done to him asleep.
subQuotationList: ["I say, shall we go and pour water on to Mohammed Latif's face? He\nis so funny when this is done to him asleep."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Yes, certainly you
must let off Miss Quested easily. She must pay all your costs, that
is only fair, but do not treat her like a conquered enemy.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, certainly you\nmust let off Miss Quested easily. She must pay all your costs, that\nis only fair, but do not treat her like a conquered enemy.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Is she wealthy? I depute you to find out.
subQuotationList: ['Is she wealthy? I depute you to find out.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
The sums mentioned at dinner when you all got so excited   they
would ruin her, they are perfectly preposterous. Look here . . .
subQuotationList: ['The sums mentioned at dinner when you all got so excited   they\nwould ruin her, they are perfectly preposterous. Look here . . .']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I am looking, though it gets a bit dark. I see Cyril Fielding to
be a very nice chap indeed and my best friend, but in some ways a
fool. You think that by letting Miss Quested off easily I shall
make a better reputation for myself and Indians generally. No, no.
It will be put down to weakness and the attempt to gain promotion
officially. I have decided to have nothing more to do with British
India, as a matter of fact. I shall seek service in some Moslem
State, such as Hyderabad, Bhopal, where Englishmen cannot insult
me any more. Don't counsel me otherwise.
subQuotationList:
["I am looking, though it gets a bit dark. I see Cyril Fielding to
be a very nice chap indeed and my best friend, but in some ways a
fool. You think that by letting Miss Quested off easily I shall
make a better reputation for myself and Indians generally. No, no.
It will be put down to weakness and the attempt to gain promotion
officially. I have decided to have nothing more to do with British
India, as a matter of fact. I shall seek service in some Moslem
State, such as Hyderabad, Bhopal, where Englishmen cannot insult
me any more. Don't counsel me otherwise."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: In the course of a long talk with Miss Quested . . .
subQuotationList: ['In the course of a long talk with Miss Quested . . .']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I don't want to hear your long talks.
subQuotationList: ["I don't want to hear your long talks."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Be quiet. In the course of a long talk with Miss Quested I have
begun to understand her character. It's not an easy one, she being
a prig. But she is perfectly genuine and very brave. When she saw
she was wrong, she pulled herself up with a jerk and said so. I
want you to realize what that means. All her friends around her,
the entire British Raj pushing her forward. She stops, sends the
whole thing to smithereens. In her place I should have funked it.
But she stopped, and almost did she become a national heroine, but
my students ran us down a side street before the crowd caught
flame. Do treat her considerately. She really mustn't get the worst
of both worlds. I know what all these
subQuotationList:
["Be quiet. In the course of a long talk with Miss Quested I have
begun to understand her character. It's not an easy one, she being
a prig. But she is perfectly genuine and very brave. When she saw
she was wrong, she pulled herself up with a jerk and said so. I
want you to realize what that means. All her friends around her,
the entire British Raj pushing her forward. She stops, sends the
whole thing to smithereens. In her place I should have funked it.
But she stopped, and almost did she become a national heroine, but
my students ran us down a side street before the crowd caught
flame. Do treat her considerately. She really mustn't get the worst
of both worlds. I know what all these"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText:
will want, but you mustn't listen to them. Be
merciful. Act like one of your six Mogul Emperors, or all the six
rolled into one.
subQuotationList: ["will want, but you mustn't listen to them. Be\nmerciful. Act like one of your six Mogul Emperors, or all the six\nrolled into one."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Not even Mogul Emperors showed mercy until they received an
apology.
subQuotationList: ['Not even Mogul Emperors showed mercy until they received an\napology.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
She'll apologize if that's the trouble, Look, I'll make you an offer. Dictate to me whatever form of words
you like, and this time to-morrow I'll bring it back signed. This
is not instead of any public apology she may make you in law. It's
an addition.
subQuotationList:
["She'll apologize if that's the trouble,", "Look, I'll make you an offer. Dictate to me whatever form of words
you like, and this time to-morrow I'll bring it back signed. This
is not instead of any public apology she may make you in law. It's
an addition."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Will she sign that?
subQuotationList: ['Will she sign that?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Well good night, good night, it's time to go to sleep, after
that.
subQuotationList: ["Well good night, good night, it's time to go to sleep, after\nthat."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Good night, I suppose it is.
subQuotationList: ['Good night, I suppose it is.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Oh, I wish you wouldn't make that kind of remark, It is the one thing in you I can't put up with.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, I wish you wouldn't make that kind of remark,", "It is the one thing in you I can't put up with."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I put up with all things in you, so what is to be done?
subQuotationList: ['I put up with all things in you, so what is to be done?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Well, you hurt me by saying it; good night.
subQuotationList: ['Well, you hurt me by saying it; good night.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Cyril, I have had an idea which will satisfy your tender
mind: I shall consult Mrs. Moore.
subQuotationList: ['Cyril, I have had an idea which will satisfy your tender\nmind: I shall consult Mrs. Moore.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Her opinion will solve everything; I can trust her so absolutely.
If she advises me to pardon this girl, I shall do so. She will
counsel me nothing against my real and true honour, as you might.
subQuotationList: ['Her opinion will solve everything; I can trust her so absolutely.\nIf she advises me to pardon this girl, I shall do so. She will\ncounsel me nothing against my real and true honour, as you might.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText: Let us discuss that to-morrow morning.
subQuotationList: ['Let us discuss that to-morrow morning.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Is it not strange? I keep on forgetting she has left India. During
the shouting of her name in court I fancied she was present. I had
shut my eyes, I confused myself on purpose to deaden the pain. Now
this very instant I forgot again. I shall be obliged to write. She
is now far away, well on her way towards Ralph and Stella.
subQuotationList:
['Is it not strange? I keep on forgetting she has left India. During
the shouting of her name in court I fancied she was present. I had
shut my eyes, I confused myself on purpose to deaden the pain. Now
this very instant I forgot again. I shall be obliged to write. She
is now far away, well on her way towards Ralph and Stella.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: To whom?
subQuotationList: ['To whom?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: To those other children.
subQuotationList: ['To those other children.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I have not heard of other children.
subQuotationList: ['I have not heard of other children.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Just as I have two boys and a girl, so has Mrs. Moore. She told
me in the mosque.
subQuotationList: ['Just as I have two boys and a girl, so has Mrs. Moore. She told\nme in the mosque.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I knew her so slightly.
subQuotationList: ['I knew her so slightly.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I have seen her but three times, but I know she is an Oriental.
subQuotationList: ['I have seen her but three times, but I know she is an Oriental.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
You are so fantastic. . . . Miss Quested, you won't treat her
generously; while over Mrs. Moore there is this elaborate chivalry.
Miss Quested anyhow behaved decently this morning, whereas the old
lady never did anything for you at all, and it's pure conjecture
that she would have come forward in your favour, it only rests on
servants' gossip. Your emotions never seem in proportion to their
objects, Aziz.
subQuotationList:
["You are so fantastic. . . . Miss Quested, you won't treat her
generously; while over Mrs. Moore there is this elaborate chivalry.
Miss Quested anyhow behaved decently this morning, whereas the old
lady never did anything for you at all, and it's pure conjecture
that she would have come forward in your favour, it only rests on
servants' gossip. Your emotions never seem in proportion to their
objects, Aziz."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Mrs. Moore'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz']]]

quoteText:
Is emotion a sack of potatoes, so much the pound, to be measured
out? Am I a machine? I shall be told I can use up my emotions by
using them, next.
subQuotationList: ['Is emotion a sack of potatoes, so much the pound, to be measured\nout? Am I a machine? I shall be told I can use up my emotions by\nusing them, next.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I should have thought you could. It sounds common sense. You can't
eat your cake and have it, even in the world of the spirit.
subQuotationList: ["I should have thought you could. It sounds common sense. You can't\neat your cake and have it, even in the world of the spirit."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
If you are right, there is no point in any friendship; it all
comes down to give and take, or give and return, which is
disgusting, and we had better all leap over this parapet and kill
ourselves. Is anything wrong with you this evening that you grow
so materialistic?
subQuotationList:
['If you are right, there is no point in any friendship; it all
comes down to give and take, or give and return, which is
disgusting, and we had better all leap over this parapet and kill
ourselves. Is anything wrong with you this evening that you grow
so materialistic?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Your unfairness is worse than my materialism.
subQuotationList: ['Your unfairness is worse than my materialism.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I see. Anything further to complain of?
subQuotationList: ['I see. Anything further to complain of?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Because it is far better you put all your difficulties
before me, if we are to be friends for ever. You do not like Mrs.
Moore, and are annoyed because I do; however, you will like her in
time.
subQuotationList:
['Because it is far better you put all your difficulties
before me, if we are to be friends for ever. You do not like Mrs.

subQuotationList: ["I'm sorry to say Mrs. Moore's dead."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
referringExpression: Fielding could not stand the tension any longer and blurted out

quoteText:
Aziz, he is trying to pull your leg; don't believe him, the
villain.
subQuotationList: ["Aziz, he is trying to pull your leg; don't believe him, the\nvillain."]
speaker: Hamidullah
referringExpression: Hamidullah who had been listening to all their talk and did not want the festive evening spoilt cried

quoteText: I do not believe him,
subQuotationList: ['I do not believe him,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
This
really is the end, and I gave her the final blow.
subQuotationList: ['This\nreally is the end,', 'and I gave her the final blow.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I had only seen the poor creature for a few hours
when she was taken ill; really this has been needlessly distressing,
it spoils one's home-coming.
subQuotationList: ["I had only seen the poor creature for a few hours\nwhen she was taken ill; really this has been needlessly distressing,\nit spoils one's home-coming."]
speaker: Lady Mellanby

quoteText:
There's propaganda
behind all this,
subQuotationList: ["There's propaganda\nbehind all this,"]
speaker: Mr. Mcbryde

quoteText:
the broad, the sensible,
the only possible charitable view from the first. Speaking
confidentially . . . mishandled by certain of our friends up the hill the hands of the clock move forward, not back,
subQuotationList: ['the broad, the sensible,\nthe only possible charitable view from the first. Speaking\nconfidentially . . .', 'mishandled by certain of our friends up the hill', 'the hands of the clock move forward, not back,']
speaker: Sir Gilbert

quoteText:
Of
course. I ought to have thought of it myself, my instincts never
help me. Why didn't I rush up to him after the trial? Yes, of
course I will write him an apology, but please will you dictate
it?
subQuotationList:
["Of
course. I ought to have thought of it myself, my instincts never
help me. Why didn't I rush up to him after the trial? Yes, of
course I will write him an apology, but please will you dictate
it?"]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Shall I write
another? Nothing matters if I can undo the harm I
have caused. I can do this right, and that right; but when the two
are put together they come wrong. That's the defect of my character.
I have never realized it until now. I thought that if I was just
and asked questions I would come through every difficulty.
subQuotationList:
['Shall I write
another?', "Nothing matters if I can undo the harm I
have caused. I can do this right, and that right; but when the two
are put together they come wrong. That's the defect of my character.
I have never realized it until now. I thought that if I was just
and asked questions I would come through every difficulty."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Our letter is a failure for a simple reason which we had
better face: you have no real affection for Aziz, or Indians
generally. The first time I saw you, you were
wanting to see India, not Indians, and it occurred to me: Ah, that
won't take us far. Indians know whether they are liked or not   they
cannot be fooled here. Justice never satisfies them, and that is
why the British Empire rests on sand.
subQuotationList:
['Our letter is a failure for a simple reason which we had
better face: you have no real affection for Aziz, or Indians
generally.', "The first time I saw you, you were
wanting to see India, not Indians, and it occurred to me: Ah, that
won't take us far. Indians know whether they are liked or not   they
cannot be fooled here. Justice never satisfies them, and that is
why the British Empire rests on sand."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Do I like
anyone, though?
subQuotationList: ['Do I like\nanyone, though?']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Mr. Fielding, we must all be
educated promptly.
subQuotationList: ['Mr. Fielding, we must all be\neducated promptly.']
speaker: _unknowable

quoteText:
give in
to the East, You can trust me, Cyril.
subQuotationList: ['give in\nto the East,', 'You can trust me, Cyril.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Can't you see that I'm
grateful to you for your help and want to reward you?
subQuotationList: ["Can't you see that I'm\ngrateful to you for your help and want to reward you?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
If you want to reward me, let Miss Quested
off paying.
subQuotationList: ['If you want to reward me, let Miss Quested\noff paying.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I see your trick. I want revenge on them. Why
should I be insulted and suffer and the contents of my pockets read
and my wife's photograph taken to the police station? Also I want
the money   to educate my little boys, as I explained to her.
subQuotationList:
["I see your trick. I want revenge on them. Why
should I be insulted and suffer and the contents of my pockets read
and my wife's photograph taken to the police station? Also I want
the money   to educate my little boys, as I explained to her."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
That
Marabar case which broke down because the poor girl couldn't face
giving her evidence   that was another bad case.
subQuotationList: ["That\nMarabar case which broke down because the poor girl couldn't face\ngiving her evidence   that was another bad case."]
speaker: _unknowable
referringExpression: retired AngloIndians in Tunbridge Wells or Cheltenham still murmur to each other

quoteText:
I wish to thank you for the
help you have given Miss Quested. She will not of course trespass
on your hospitality further; she has as a matter of fact decided
to return to England. I have just arranged about her passage for
her. I understand she would like to see you.
subQuotationList:
['I wish to thank you for the
help you have given Miss Quested. She will not of course trespass
on your hospitality further; she has as a matter of fact decided
to return to England. I have just arranged about her passage for
her. I understand she would like to see you.']
speaker: Ronny Heaslop
referringExpression: Ronny who was about to be transferred to another part of the Province approached Fielding with his usual constraint and said
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText: I shall go round at once.
subQuotationList: ['I shall go round at once.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Far wiser of him, I ought to have spoken myself, but I drifted
on wondering what would happen. I would willingly have gone on
spoiling his life through inertia   one has nothing to do, one
belongs nowhere and becomes a public nuisance without realizing
it.
subQuotationList:
['Far wiser of him,', 'I ought to have spoken myself, but I drifted
on wondering what would happen. I would willingly have gone on
spoiling his life through inertia   one has nothing to do, one
belongs nowhere and becomes a public nuisance without realizing
it.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
I speak only of India.
I am not astray in England. I fit in there   no, don't think I shall
do harm in England. When I am forced back there, I shall settle
down to some career. I have sufficient money left to start myself,
and heaps of friends of my own type. I shall be quite all right. But oh, the trouble I've brought on everyone here. . . .
I can never get over it. My carefulness as to whether we
should marry or not . . . and in the end Ronny and I part and
aren't even sorry. We ought never to have thought of marriage.
Weren't you amazed when our engagement was originally announced?
subQuotationList:
["I speak only of India.
I am not astray in England. I fit in there   no, don't think I shall
do harm in England. When I am forced back there, I shall settle
down to some career. I have sufficient money left to start myself,
and heaps of friends of my own type. I shall be quite all right.", "But oh, the trouble I've brought on everyone here. . . .
I can never get over it. My carefulness as to whether we
should marry or not . . . and in the end Ronny and I part and
aren't even sorry. We ought never to have thought of marriage.
Weren't you amazed when our engagement was originally announced?"]
speaker: Adela Quested
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Adela Quested', 'Ronny Heaslop'], ['Ronny Heaslop'], ['Adela Quested', 'Ronny Heaslop'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested', 'Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText:
Not much. At my age one's seldom amazed, Marriage is too absurd in any case. It begins and continues for
such very slight reasons. The social business props it up on one
side, and the theological business on the other, but neither of
them are marriage, are they? I've friends who can't remember why
they married, no more can their wives. I suspect that it mostly
happens haphazard, though afterwards various noble reasons are
invented. About marriage I am cynical.
subQuotationList:
["Not much. At my age one's seldom amazed,", "Marriage is too absurd in any case. It begins and continues for
such very slight reasons. The social business props it up on one
side, and the theological business on the other, but neither of
them are marriage, are they? I've friends who can't remember why
they married, no more can their wives. I suspect that it mostly
happens haphazard, though afterwards various noble reasons are
invented. About marriage I am cynical."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I am not. This false start has been all my own fault. I was
bringing to Ronny nothing that ought to be brought, that was why
he rejected me really. I entered that cave thinking: Am I fond of
him? I have not yet told you that, Mr. Fielding. I didn't feel
justified. Tenderness, respect, personal intercourse   I tried to
make them take the place   of
subQuotationList:
["I am not. This false start has been all my own fault. I was
bringing to Ronny nothing that ought to be brought, that was why
he rejected me really. I entered that cave thinking: Am I fond of
him? I have not yet told you that, Mr. Fielding. I didn't feel
