speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: I no longer want love,
subQuotationList: ['I no longer want love,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
No more do I. My experiences here have cured me. But I want others
to want it.
subQuotationList: ['No more do I. My experiences here have cured me. But I want others\nto want it.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
But to go back to our first talk (for I suppose this is our last
one)   when you entered that cave, who did follow you, or did no one
follow you? Can you now say? I don't like it left in air.
subQuotationList: ["But to go back to our first talk (for I suppose this is our last\none)   when you entered that cave, who did follow you, or did no one\nfollow you? Can you now say? I don't like it left in air."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText:
Let us call it the guide, It will never
be known. It's as if I ran my finger along that polished wall in
the dark, and cannot get further. I am up against something, and
so are you. Mrs. Moore   she did know.
subQuotationList:
['Let us call it the guide,', "It will never
be known. It's as if I ran my finger along that polished wall in
the dark, and cannot get further. I am up against something, and
so are you. Mrs. Moore   she did know."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: How could she have known what we don't?
subQuotationList: ["How could she have known what we don't?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Telepathy, possibly.
subQuotationList: ['Telepathy, possibly.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Write to me when you get to England.
subQuotationList: ['Write to me when you get to England.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I shall, often. You have been excessively kind. Now that I'm
going, I realize it. I wish I could do something for you in return,
but I see you've all you want.
subQuotationList: ["I shall, often. You have been excessively kind. Now that I'm\ngoing, I realize it. I wish I could do something for you in return,\nbut I see you've all you want."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
I think so, I have never felt more
happy and secure out here. I really do get on with Indians, and
they do trust me. It's pleasant that I haven't had to resign my
job. It's pleasant to be praised by an L.-G. Until the next
earthquake I remain as I am.
subQuotationList:
['I think so,', "I have never felt more
happy and secure out here. I really do get on with Indians, and
they do trust me. It's pleasant that I haven't had to resign my
job. It's pleasant to be praised by an L.-G. Until the next
earthquake I remain as I am."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Of course this death has been troubling me.
subQuotationList: ['Of course this death has been troubling me.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Aziz was so fond of her too.
subQuotationList: ['Aziz was so fond of her too.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
But it has made me remember that we must all die: all these
personal relations we try to live by are temporary. I used to feel
death selected people, it is a notion one gets from novels, because
some of the characters are usually left talking at the end. Now
   death spares no one' begins to be real.
subQuotationList:
["But it has made me remember that we must all die: all these
personal relations we try to live by are temporary. I used to feel
death selected people, it is a notion one gets from novels, because
some of the characters are usually left talking at the end. Now
   death spares no one' begins to be real."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
Don't let it become too real, or you'll die yourself. That is the
objection to meditating upon death. We are subdued to what we work
in. I have felt the same temptation, and had to sheer off. I want
to go on living a bit.
subQuotationList:
["Don't let it become too real, or you'll die yourself. That is the
objection to meditating upon death. We are subdued to what we work
in. I have felt the same temptation, and had to sheer off. I want
to go on living a bit."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: So do I.
subQuotationList: ['So do I.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: And I do like you so very much, if I may say so,
subQuotationList: ['And I do like you so very much, if I may say so,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I'm glad, for I like you. Let's meet again.
subQuotationList: ["I'm glad, for I like you. Let's meet again."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: We will, in England, if I ever take home leave.
subQuotationList: ['We will, in England, if I ever take home leave.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: But I suppose you're not likely to do that yet.
subQuotationList: ["But I suppose you're not likely to do that yet."]
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText: Quite a chance. I have a scheme on now as a matter of fact.
subQuotationList: ['Quite a chance. I have a scheme on now as a matter of fact.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Oh, that would be very nice.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, that would be very nice.']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
To what duties, Miss Quested,
are you returning in your own country after your taste of the
tropics?
subQuotationList: ['To what duties, Miss Quested,\nare you returning in your own country after your taste of the\ntropics?']
speaker: The Missionary

quoteText:
Observe, I don't say to what do you turn, but to what do you
_re_-turn. Every life ought to contain both a turn and a _re_-turn.
This celebrated pioneer will make my
question clear. He turns to the East, he _re_-turns to the West.
You can see it from the cute position of his hands, one of which
holds a string of sausages.
subQuotationList:
["Observe, I don't say to what do you turn, but to what do you
_re_-turn. Every life ought to contain both a turn and a _re_-turn.
This celebrated pioneer", 'will make my
question clear. He turns to the East, he _re_-turns to the West.
You can see it from the cute position of his hands, one of which
holds a string of sausages.']
speaker: The Missionary

quoteText: I see,
subQuotationList: ['I see,']
speaker: Adela Quested

quoteText:
My dear Das, why, when you tried to send me to prison, should I
try to send Mr. Bhattacharya a poem? Eh? That is naturally entirely
a joke. I will write him the best I can, but I thought your magazine
was for Hindus.
subQuotationList:
['My dear Das, why, when you tried to send me to prison, should I
try to send Mr. Bhattacharya a poem? Eh? That is naturally entirely
a joke. I will write him the best I can, but I thought your magazine
was for Hindus.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: It is not for Hindus, but Indians generally,
subQuotationList: ['It is not for Hindus, but Indians generally,']
speaker: Mr. Das

quoteText: There is no such person in existence as the general Indian.
subQuotationList: ['There is no such person in existence as the general Indian.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
There was not, but there may be when you have written a poem. You
are our hero; the whole city is behind you, irrespective of creed.
subQuotationList: ['There was not, but there may be when you have written a poem. You\nare our hero; the whole city is behind you, irrespective of creed.']
speaker: Mr. Das

quoteText: I know, but will it last?
subQuotationList: ['I know, but will it last?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I fear not, And for
that reason, if I may say so, do not introduce too many Persian
expressions into the poem, and not too much about the bulbul.
subQuotationList: ['I fear not,', 'And for\nthat reason, if I may say so, do not introduce too many Persian\nexpressions into the poem, and not too much about the bulbul.']
speaker: Mr. Das

quoteText: Half a sec, Here you are. . . . Is not this better than a poem?
subQuotationList: ['Half a sec,', 'Here you are. . . . Is not this better than a poem?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Happy the man who can compose both.
subQuotationList: ['Happy the man who can compose both.']
speaker: Mr. Das

quoteText: You are full of compliments to-day.
subQuotationList: ['You are full of compliments to-day.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I know you bear me a grudge for trying that case, You are so kind and friendly,
but always I detect irony beneath your manner.
subQuotationList: ['I know you bear me a grudge for trying that case,', 'You are so kind and friendly,\nbut always I detect irony beneath your manner.']
speaker: Mr. Das

quoteText: No, no, what nonsense!
subQuotationList: ['No, no, what nonsense!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Excellent,
subQuotationList: ['Excellent,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I wish they did not remind
me of cow-dung
subQuotationList: ['I wish they did not remind\nme of cow-dung']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
referringExpression: Aziz patting a stout shoulder and thinking

quoteText: Some Moslems are very violent.
subQuotationList: ['Some Moslems are very violent.']
speaker: Mr. Das

quoteText:
Excuse my mistakes, realize
my limitations. Life is not easy as we know it on the earth.
subQuotationList: ['Excuse my mistakes, realize\nmy limitations. Life is not easy as we know it on the earth.']
speaker: Mr. Das

quoteText: Oh, well, about this poem   how did you hear I sometimes scribbled?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, well, about this poem   how did you hear I sometimes scribbled?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Professor Godbole often mentioned it, before his departure for
Mau.
subQuotationList: ['Professor Godbole often mentioned it, before his departure for\nMau.']
speaker: Mr. Das

quoteText: How did he hear?
subQuotationList: ['How did he hear?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: He too was a poet; do you not divine each other?
subQuotationList: ['He too was a poet; do you not divine each other?']
speaker: Mr. Das

quoteText:
My great mistake has been taking our rulers as
a joke,
subQuotationList: ['My great mistake has been taking our rulers as\na joke,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
It is far the wisest way to take them, but not possible in the
long run. Sooner or later a disaster such as yours occurs, and
reveals their secret thoughts about our character. If God himself
descended from heaven into their club and said you were innocent,
they would disbelieve him. Now you see why Mahmoud Ali and self
waste so much time over intrigues and associate with creatures like
Ram Chand.
subQuotationList:
['It is far the wisest way to take them, but not possible in the
long run. Sooner or later a disaster such as yours occurs, and
reveals their secret thoughts about our character. If God himself
descended from heaven into their club and said you were innocent,
they would disbelieve him. Now you see why Mahmoud Ali and self
waste so much time over intrigues and associate with creatures like
Ram Chand.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: I cannot endure committees. I shall go right away.
subQuotationList: ['I cannot endure committees. I shall go right away.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Where to? Turtons and Burtons, all are the same.
subQuotationList: ['Where to? Turtons and Burtons, all are the same.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: But not in an Indian state.
subQuotationList: ['But not in an Indian state.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I believe the Politicals are obliged to have better manners. It
amounts to no more.
subQuotationList: ['I believe the Politicals are obliged to have better manners. It\namounts to no more.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
I do want to get away from British India, even to a poor job. I
think I could write poetry there. I wish I had lived in Babur's
time and fought and written for him. Gone, gone, and not even any
use to say
subQuotationList:
["I do want to get away from British India, even to a poor job. I
think I could write poetry there. I wish I had lived in Babur's
time and fought and written for him. Gone, gone, and not even any
use to say"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
for it weakens us while we say it. We need
a king, Hamidullah; it would make our lives easier. As it is, we
must try to appreciate these quaint Hindus. My notion now is to
try for some post as doctor in one of their states.
subQuotationList:
['for it weakens us while we say it. We need
a king, Hamidullah; it would make our lives easier. As it is, we
must try to appreciate these quaint Hindus. My notion now is to
try for some post as doctor in one of their states.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Oh, that is going much too far.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, that is going much too far.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: It is not going as far as Mr. Ram Chand.
subQuotationList: ['It is not going as far as Mr. Ram Chand.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
But the money, the money   they will never pay an adequate salary,
those savage Rajahs.
subQuotationList: ['But the money, the money   they will never pay an adequate salary,\nthose savage Rajahs.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: I shall never be rich anywhere, it is outside my character.
subQuotationList: ['I shall never be rich anywhere, it is outside my character.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: If you had been sensible and made Miss Quested pay
subQuotationList: ['If you had been sensible and made Miss Quested pay']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
I chose not to. Discussion of the past is useless, I have allowed her to keep her fortune
and buy herself a husband in England, for which it will be very
necessary. Don't mention the matter again.
subQuotationList: ['I chose not to. Discussion of the past is useless,', "I have allowed her to keep her fortune\nand buy herself a husband in England, for which it will be very\nnecessary. Don't mention the matter again."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Very well, but your life must continue a poor man's; no holidays
in Kashmir for you yet, you must stick to your profession and rise
to a highly paid post, not retire to a jungle-state and write
poems. Educate your children, read the latest scientific periodicals,
compel European doctors to respect you. Accept the consequences of
your own actions like a man.
subQuotationList:
["Very well, but your life must continue a poor man's; no holidays
in Kashmir for you yet, you must stick to your profession and rise
to a highly paid post, not retire to a jungle-state and write
poems. Educate your children, read the latest scientific periodicals,
compel European doctors to respect you. Accept the consequences of
your own actions like a man."]
speaker: Hamidullah
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz']]]

quoteText:
We are not in the law courts.
There are many ways of being a man; mine is to express what is
deepest in my heart.
subQuotationList: ['We are not in the law courts.\nThere are many ways of being a man; mine is to express what is\ndeepest in my heart.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
referringExpression: Aziz winked at him slowly and said

quoteText: To such a remark there is certainly no reply,
subQuotationList: ['To such a remark there is certainly no reply,']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
Have you heard
this naughty rumour that Mohammed Latif has got hold of?
subQuotationList: ['Have you heard\nthis naughty rumour that Mohammed Latif has got hold of?']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: Which?
subQuotationList: ['Which?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
When Miss Quested stopped in the College, Fielding used to visit
her . . . rather too late in the evening, the servants say.
subQuotationList: ['When Miss Quested stopped in the College, Fielding used to visit\nher . . . rather too late in the evening, the servants say.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText: A pleasant change for her if he did,
subQuotationList: ['A pleasant change for her if he did,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: But you understand my meaning?
subQuotationList: ['But you understand my meaning?']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
Just! Still, your meaning
doesn't help me out of my difficulties. I am determined to leave
Chandrapore. The problem is, for where? I am determined to write
poetry. The problem is, about what? You give me no assistance. But who does give me assistance? No one is my friend.
All are traitors, even my own children. I have had enough of
friends.
subQuotationList:
["Just! Still, your meaning
doesn't help me out of my difficulties. I am determined to leave
Chandrapore. The problem is, for where? I am determined to write
poetry. The problem is, about what? You give me no assistance.", 'But who does give me assistance? No one is my friend.
All are traitors, even my own children. I have had enough of
friends.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
referringExpression: The young man winked again and said

quoteText:
I was going to suggest we go behind the purdah, but your three
treacherous children are there, so you will not want to.
subQuotationList: ['I was going to suggest we go behind the purdah, but your three\ntreacherous children are there, so you will not want to.']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
I am sorry, it is ever since I was in prison my temper is strange;
take me, forgive me.
subQuotationList: ['I am sorry, it is ever since I was in prison my temper is strange;\ntake me, forgive me.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Nureddin's mother is visiting my wife now. That is all right, I
think.
subQuotationList: ["Nureddin's mother is visiting my wife now. That is all right, I\nthink."]
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
They come before me separately, but not so far together. You had
better prepare them for the united shock of my face.
subQuotationList: ['They come before me separately, but not so far together. You had\nbetter prepare them for the united shock of my face.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
No, let us surprise them without warning, far too much nonsense
still goes on among our ladies. They pretended at the time of your
trial they would give up purdah; indeed, those of them who can
write composed a document to that effect, and now it ends in
humbug. You know how deeply they all respect Fielding, but not one
of them has seen him. My wife says she will, but always when he
calls there is some excuse   she is not feeling well, she is ashamed
of the room, she has no nice sweets to offer him, only Elephants'
Ears, and if I say Elephants' Ears are Mr. Fielding's favourite
sweet, she replies that he will know how badly hers are made, so
she cannot see him on their account. For fifteen years, my dear
boy, have I argued with my begum, for fifteen years, and never
gained a point, yet the missionaries inform us our women are
down-trodden. If you want a subject for a poem, take this: The
Indian lady as she is and not as she is supposed to be.
subQuotationList:
["No, let us surprise them without warning, far too much nonsense
still goes on among our ladies. They pretended at the time of your
trial they would give up purdah; indeed, those of them who can
write composed a document to that effect, and now it ends in
humbug. You know how deeply they all respect Fielding, but not one
of them has seen him. My wife says she will, but always when he
calls there is some excuse   she is not feeling well, she is ashamed
of the room, she has no nice sweets to offer him, only Elephants'
Ears, and if I say Elephants' Ears are Mr. Fielding's favourite
sweet, she replies that he will know how badly hers are made, so
she cannot see him on their account. For fifteen years, my dear
boy, have I argued with my begum, for fifteen years, and never
gained a point, yet the missionaries inform us our women are
down-trodden. If you want a subject for a poem, take this: The
Indian lady as she is and not as she is supposed to be."]
speaker: Hamidullah
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Hamidullah', 'Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Hamidullah Begum'], ['Hamidullah Begum'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Hamidullah Begum'], ['Hamidullah Begum'], ['Hamidullah Begum'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Hamidullah Begum'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Hamidullah Begum'], ['Hamidullah Begum'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz']]]

quoteText:
That pure-minded fellow. However, he
will blame the Indian climate. Everything is our fault really. Now,
have I not discovered an important piece of news for you, Cyril?
subQuotationList: ['That pure-minded fellow. However, he\nwill blame the Indian climate. Everything is our fault really. Now,\nhave I not discovered an important piece of news for you, Cyril?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Not very, Listen to mine. At the conference, it
was settled. . . .
subQuotationList: ['Not very,', 'Listen to mine.', 'At the conference, it\nwas settled. . . .']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
This evening will do for schoolmastery. I should go straight to
the Minto now, the cholera looks bad. We begin to have local cases
as well as imported. In fact, the whole of life is somewhat sad.
The new Civil Surgeon is the same as the last, but does not yet
dare to be. That is all any administrative change amounts to. All
my suffering has won nothing for us. But look here, Cyril, while
I remember it. There's gossip about you as well as McBryde. They
say that you and Miss Quested became also rather too intimate
friends. To speak perfectly frankly, they say you and she have been
guilty of impropriety.
subQuotationList:
["This evening will do for schoolmastery. I should go straight to
the Minto now, the cholera looks bad. We begin to have local cases
as well as imported. In fact, the whole of life is somewhat sad.
The new Civil Surgeon is the same as the last, but does not yet
dare to be. That is all any administrative change amounts to. All
my suffering has won nothing for us. But look here, Cyril, while
I remember it. There's gossip about you as well as McBryde. They
say that you and Miss Quested became also rather too intimate
friends. To speak perfectly frankly, they say you and she have been
guilty of impropriety."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Mr. Mcbryde'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: They would say that.
subQuotationList: ['They would say that.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
It's all over the town, and may injure your reputation. You know,
everyone is by no means your supporter. I have tried all I could
to silence such a story.
subQuotationList: ["It's all over the town, and may injure your reputation. You know,\neveryone is by no means your supporter. I have tried all I could\nto silence such a story."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Don't bother. Miss Quested has cleared out at last.
subQuotationList: ["Don't bother. Miss Quested has cleared out at last."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
It is those who stop in the country, not those who leave it, whom
such a story injures. Imagine my dismay and anxiety. I could
scarcely get a wink of sleep. First my name was coupled with her
and now it is yours.
subQuotationList:
['It is those who stop in the country, not those who leave it, whom
such a story injures. Imagine my dismay and anxiety. I could
scarcely get a wink of sleep. First my name was coupled with her
and now it is yours.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Don't use such exaggerated phrases.
subQuotationList: ["Don't use such exaggerated phrases."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: As what?
subQuotationList: ['As what?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: As dismay and anxiety.
subQuotationList: ['As dismay and anxiety.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Have I not lived all my life in India? Do I not know what produces
a bad impression here?
subQuotationList: ['Have I not lived all my life in India? Do I not know what produces\na bad impression here?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Yes, but the scale, the scale. You always get the scale wrong, my
dear fellow. A pity there is this rumour, but such a very small
pity   so small that we may as well talk of something else.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, but the scale, the scale. You always get the scale wrong, my\ndear fellow. A pity there is this rumour, but such a very small\npity   so small that we may as well talk of something else.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
You mind for Miss Quested's sake, though. I can see from your
face.
subQuotationList: ["You mind for Miss Quested's sake, though. I can see from your\nface."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: As far as I do mind. I travel light.
subQuotationList: ['As far as I do mind. I travel light.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Cyril, that boastfulness about travelling light will be your ruin.
It is raising up enemies against you on all sides, and makes me
feel excessively uneasy.
subQuotationList: ['Cyril, that boastfulness about travelling light will be your ruin.\nIt is raising up enemies against you on all sides, and makes me\nfeel excessively uneasy.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: What enemies?
subQuotationList: ['What enemies?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I have given you list after list of
the people who cannot be trusted in this city. In your position I
should have the sense to know I was surrounded by enemies. You
observe I speak in a low voice. It is because I see your sais is
new. How do I know he isn't a spy?
subQuotationList:
["I have given you list after list of
the people who cannot be trusted in this city. In your position I
should have the sense to know I was surrounded by enemies. You
observe I speak in a low voice. It is because I see your sais is
new. How do I know he isn't a spy?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Every
third servant is a spy.
subQuotationList: ['Every\nthird servant is a spy.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Now, what is the matter?
subQuotationList: ['Now, what is the matter?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Do you contradict my last remark?
subQuotationList: ['Do you contradict my last remark?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
It simply doesn't affect me. Spies are as thick as mosquitoes,
but it's years before I shall meet the one that kills me. You've
something else in your mind.
subQuotationList: ["It simply doesn't affect me. Spies are as thick as mosquitoes,\nbut it's years before I shall meet the one that kills me. You've\nsomething else in your mind."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I've not; don't be ridiculous.
subQuotationList: ["I've not; don't be ridiculous."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: You have. You're cross with me about something or other.
subQuotationList: ["You have. You're cross with me about something or other."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
So
you and Madamsell Adela used to amuse one another in the evening,
naughty boy.
subQuotationList: ['So\nyou and Madamsell Adela used to amuse one another in the evening,\nnaughty boy.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
You little rotter! Well, I'm damned. Amusement indeed. Is
it likely at such a time?
subQuotationList: ["You little rotter! Well, I'm damned. Amusement indeed. Is\nit likely at such a time?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
referringExpression: he lost his head and cried

quoteText:
Oh, I beg your pardon, I'm sure. The licentious Oriental
imagination was at work,
subQuotationList: ["Oh, I beg your pardon, I'm sure. The licentious Oriental\nimagination was at work,"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
You see, Aziz, the circumstances . . . also the girl was still
engaged to Heaslop, also I never felt . . .
subQuotationList: ['You see, Aziz, the circumstances . . . also the girl was still\nengaged to Heaslop, also I never felt . . .']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Yes, yes; but you didn't contradict what I said, so I thought it
was true. Oh dear, East and West. Most misleading. Will you please
put your little rotter down at his hospital?
subQuotationList: ["Yes, yes; but you didn't contradict what I said, so I thought it\nwas true. Oh dear, East and West. Most misleading. Will you please\nput your little rotter down at his hospital?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: You're not offended?
subQuotationList: ["You're not offended?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Most certainly I am not.
subQuotationList: ['Most certainly I am not.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: If you are, this must be cleared up later on.
subQuotationList: ['If you are, this must be cleared up later on.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
It has been, I believe absolutely what
you say, and of that there need be no further question.
subQuotationList: ['It has been,', 'I believe absolutely what\nyou say, and of that there need be no further question.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
But the way I said it must be cleared up. I was unintentionally
rude. Unreserved regrets.
subQuotationList: ['But the way I said it must be cleared up. I was unintentionally\nrude. Unreserved regrets.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: The fault is entirely mine.
subQuotationList: ['The fault is entirely mine.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
But I believe you, I believe. Mohammed
Latif shall be severely punished for inventing this.
subQuotationList: ['But I believe you, I believe. Mohammed\nLatif shall be severely punished for inventing this.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Oh, leave it alone, like all gossip   it's merely one of those
half-alive things that try to crowd out real life. Take no notice,
it'll vanish, like poor old Mrs. Moore's tombs.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, leave it alone, like all gossip   it's merely one of those\nhalf-alive things that try to crowd out real life. Take no notice,\nit'll vanish, like poor old Mrs. Moore's tombs."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Mohammed Latif has taken to intriguing. We are already much
displeased with him. Will it satisfy you if we send him back to
his family without a present?
subQuotationList: ['Mohammed Latif has taken to intriguing. We are already much\ndispleased with him. Will it satisfy you if we send him back to\nhis family without a present?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: We'll discuss M.L. at dinner.
subQuotationList: ["We'll discuss M.L. at dinner."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Dinner. This is most unlucky       I
forgot. I have promised to dine with Das.
subQuotationList: ['Dinner. This is most unlucky       I\nforgot. I have promised to dine with Das.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Bring Das to me.
subQuotationList: ['Bring Das to me.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: He will have invited other friends.
subQuotationList: ['He will have invited other friends.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
You are coming to dinner with me as arranged, I don't stand this. You are coming to dinner with
me. You come.
subQuotationList: ['You are coming to dinner with me as arranged,', "I don't stand this. You are coming to dinner with\nme. You come."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Good morning; so you
are back, I should be glad if you will put in
your appearance at the club this evening.
subQuotationList: ['Good morning; so you\nare back,', 'I should be glad if you will put in\nyour appearance at the club this evening.']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText:
I have accepted re-election, sir. Do you regard it as necessary
I should come? I should be glad to be excused; indeed, I have a
dinner engagement this evening.
subQuotationList: ['I have accepted re-election, sir. Do you regard it as necessary\nI should come? I should be glad to be excused; indeed, I have a\ndinner engagement this evening.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
It is not a question of your feelings, but of the wish of the
Lieutenant-Governor. Perhaps you will ask me whether I speak
officially. I do. I shall expect you this evening at six. We shall
not interfere with your subsequent plans.
subQuotationList:
['It is not a question of your feelings, but of the wish of the
Lieutenant-Governor. Perhaps you will ask me whether I speak
officially. I do. I shall expect you this evening at six. We shall
not interfere with your subsequent plans.']
speaker: Mr. Turton

quoteText:
It is no good, we all build upon sand; and the more modern the country gets, the
worse'll be the crash. In the old eighteenth century, when cruelty
and injustice raged, an invisible power repaired their ravages.
Everything echoes now; there's no stopping the echo. The original
sound may be harmless, but the echo is always evil.
subQuotationList:
['It is no good,', "we all build upon sand; and the more modern the country gets, the
worse'll be the crash. In the old eighteenth century, when cruelty
and injustice raged, an invisible power repaired their ravages.
Everything echoes now; there's no stopping the echo. The original
sound may be harmless, but the echo is always evil."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
In other words, probably
never; for I am going quite soon to England.
subQuotationList: ['In other words, probably\nnever; for I am going quite soon to England.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I thought you might end in England,
subQuotationList: ['I thought you might end in England,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I am only going for a little time. On official business. My
service is anxious to get me away from Chandrapore for a bit. It
is obliged to value me highly, but does not care for me. The
situation is somewhat humorous.
subQuotationList:
['I am only going for a little time. On official business. My
service is anxious to get me away from Chandrapore for a bit. It
is obliged to value me highly, but does not care for me. The
situation is somewhat humorous.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
What is the nature of the business? Will it leave you much spare
time?
subQuotationList: ['What is the nature of the business? Will it leave you much spare\ntime?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Enough to see my friends.
subQuotationList: ['Enough to see my friends.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I expected you to make such a reply. You are a faithful friend.
Shall we now talk about something else?
subQuotationList: ['I expected you to make such a reply. You are a faithful friend.\nShall we now talk about something else?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Willingly. What subject?
subQuotationList: ['Willingly. What subject?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Poetry, Let us discuss why
poetry has lost the power of making men brave. My mother's father
was also a poet, and fought against you in the Mutiny. I might
equal him if there was another mutiny. As it is, I am a doctor,
who has won a case and has three children to support, and whose
chief subject of conversation is official plans.
subQuotationList:
['Poetry,', "Let us discuss why
poetry has lost the power of making men brave. My mother's father
was also a poet, and fought against you in the Mutiny. I might
equal him if there was another mutiny. As it is, I am a doctor,
who has won a case and has three children to support, and whose
chief subject of conversation is official plans."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Let us talk about poetry.
subQuotationList: ['Let us talk about poetry.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
You people are sadly circumstanced. Whatever are you to
write about? You cannot say,
subQuotationList: ['You people are sadly circumstanced. Whatever are you to\nwrite about? You cannot say,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
for evermore. We
know it's faded. Yet you can't have patriotic poetry of the    India,
my India' type, when it's nobody's India.
subQuotationList: ["for evermore. We\nknow it's faded. Yet you can't have patriotic poetry of the    India,\nmy India' type, when it's nobody's India."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I like this conversation. It may lead to something interesting.
subQuotationList: ['I like this conversation. It may lead to something interesting.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
You are quite right in thinking that poetry must touch life. When
I knew you first, you used it as an incantation.
subQuotationList: ['You are quite right in thinking that poetry must touch life. When\nI knew you first, you used it as an incantation.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I was a child when you knew me first. Everyone was my friend then.
The Friend: a Persian expression for God. But I do not want to be
a religious poet either.
subQuotationList: ['I was a child when you knew me first. Everyone was my friend then.\nThe Friend: a Persian expression for God. But I do not want to be\na religious poet either.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I hoped you would be.
subQuotationList: ['I hoped you would be.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Why, when you yourself are an atheist?
subQuotationList: ['Why, when you yourself are an atheist?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
There is something in religion that may not be true, but has not
yet been sung.
subQuotationList: ['There is something in religion that may not be true, but has not\nyet been sung.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Explain in detail.
subQuotationList: ['Explain in detail.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Something that the Hindus have perhaps found.
subQuotationList: ['Something that the Hindus have perhaps found.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Let them sing it.
subQuotationList: ['Let them sing it.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Hindus are unable to sing.
subQuotationList: ['Hindus are unable to sing.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Cyril, you sometimes make a sensible remark. That will do for
poetry for the present. Let us now return to your English visit.
subQuotationList: ['Cyril, you sometimes make a sensible remark. That will do for\npoetry for the present. Let us now return to your English visit.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: We haven't discussed poetry for two seconds,
subQuotationList: ["We haven't discussed poetry for two seconds,"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I suppose
you will visit Miss Quested.
subQuotationList: ['I suppose\nyou will visit Miss Quested.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: If I have time. It will be strange seeing her in Hampstead.
subQuotationList: ['If I have time. It will be strange seeing her in Hampstead.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: What is Hampstead?
subQuotationList: ['What is Hampstead?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: An artistic and thoughtful little suburb of London
subQuotationList: ['An artistic and thoughtful little suburb of London']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
And there she lives in comfort: you will enjoy seeing her. . . .
Dear me, I've got a headache this evening. Perhaps I am going to
have cholera. With your permission, I'll leave early.
subQuotationList: ["And there she lives in comfort: you will enjoy seeing her. . . .\nDear me, I've got a headache this evening. Perhaps I am going to\nhave cholera. With your permission, I'll leave early."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: When would you like the carriage?
subQuotationList: ['When would you like the carriage?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Don't trouble   I'll bike.
subQuotationList: ["Don't trouble   I'll bike."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
But you haven't got your bicycle. My carriage fetched you   let it
take you away.
subQuotationList: ["But you haven't got your bicycle. My carriage fetched you   let it\ntake you away."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Sound reasoning, I have not got my
bicycle. But I am seen too often in your carriage. I am thought to
take advantage of your generosity by Mr. Ram Chand.
subQuotationList: ['Sound reasoning,', 'I have not got my\nbicycle. But I am seen too often in your carriage. I am thought to\ntake advantage of your generosity by Mr. Ram Chand.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Aziz, you have forgiven me the stupid remark I made this morning?
subQuotationList: ['Aziz, you have forgiven me the stupid remark I made this morning?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: When you called me a little rotter?
subQuotationList: ['When you called me a little rotter?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Yes, to my eternal confusion. You know how fond I am of you.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, to my eternal confusion. You know how fond I am of you.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
That is nothing, of course, we all of us make mistakes. In a
friendship such as ours a few slips are of no consequence.
subQuotationList: ['That is nothing, of course, we all of us make mistakes. In a\nfriendship such as ours a few slips are of no consequence.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Huzoor?
subQuotationList: ['Huzoor?']
speaker: Hassan

quoteText:
Look at those flies on the ceiling. Why have you not drowned
them?
subQuotationList: ['Look at those flies on the ceiling. Why have you not drowned\nthem?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Huzoor, they return.
subQuotationList: ['Huzoor, they return.']
speaker: Hassan

quoteText: Like all evil things.
subQuotationList: ['Like all evil things.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: When he breaks a plate, does it become two plates?
subQuotationList: ['When he breaks a plate, does it become two plates?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Glasses and a new teapot will similarly be required, also for
myself a coat.
subQuotationList: ['Glasses and a new teapot will similarly be required, also for\nmyself a coat.']
speaker: Hassan

quoteText:
Certainly of late he no
longer addressed us with his former frankness, not to expect too much   he and she are, after all, both members of
another race.
subQuotationList: ['Certainly of late he no\nlonger addressed us with his former frankness,', 'not to expect too much   he and she are, after all, both members of\nanother race.']
speaker: Hamidullah
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Cyril Fielding'], ['Mahmoud Ali', 'Hamidullah', 'Dr. Aziz'], ['Cyril Fielding']], [['Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested']]]

quoteText: Where are my twenty thousand rupees?
subQuotationList: ['Where are my twenty thousand rupees?']
speaker: Hamidullah

quoteText:
Tukaram, Tukaram,
   Thou art my father and mother and everybody.
   Tukaram, Tukaram,
   Thou art my father and mother and everybody.
   Tukaram, Tukaram,
   Thou art my father and mother and everybody.
   Tukaram, Tukaram,
   Thou art my father and mother and everybody.
   Tukaram. . . .

quoteText: Sorry,

subQuotationList: ['Dear old Godbole,']
speaker: Professor Godbole

subQuotationList: ['I study nothing, I respect']

quoteText:
I
am an Indian at last,
subQuotationList: ['I\nam an Indian at last,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Ah, that is bhakti;
ah, my young friend, that is different and very good. Ah, India,
who seems not to move, will go straight there while the other
nations waste their time. May I translate this particular one into
Hindi? In fact, it might be rendered into Sanskrit almost, it is
so enlightened. Yes, of course, all your other poems are very good
too. His Highness was saying to Colonel Maggs last time he came
that we are proud of you

quoteText: Free prisoners.
subQuotationList: ['Free prisoners.']
speaker: A Young Mohammedan's Mother

quoteText: They will not hurt us, whose lives are chaste,
subQuotationList: ['They will not hurt us, whose lives are chaste,']
speaker: Ahmed
referringExpression: Ahmed apprized by Mohammed Latif of the character of the bee said

quoteText:
Which
of you is to be pardoned?
subQuotationList: ['Which\nof you is to be pardoned?']
speaker: _group

quoteText: It always improves,
subQuotationList: ['It always improves,']
speaker: The Medicine Man

quoteText: Throw stones?
subQuotationList: ['Throw stones?']
speaker: Karim

quoteText: Put powdered glass in their pan?
subQuotationList: ['Put powdered glass in their pan?']
speaker: Ahmed

quoteText: Ahmed, come here for such wickedness.
subQuotationList: ['Ahmed, come here for such wickedness.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Hullo, gentlemen, are you in trouble?
subQuotationList: ['Hullo, gentlemen, are you in trouble?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

subQuotationList: ["Lie down in a pool of water, my dear sir   here are plenty. Don't\ncome near me. . . . I cannot control them, they are State bees;\ncomplain to His Highness of their behaviour."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Come, pull yourself together and be
a man.
subQuotationList: ['Come, pull yourself together and be\na man.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
referringExpression: He went up to the stranger and pulled a couple of stings out of his wrist remarking

quoteText:
How do you do, Aziz, after all this time? I heard you were settled
in here, I
suppose a couple of stings don't signify.
subQuotationList: ['How do you do, Aziz, after all this time? I heard you were settled\nin here,', "I\nsuppose a couple of stings don't signify."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Not the least. I'll send an embrocation over to the Guest House.
I heard you were settled in there.
subQuotationList: ["Not the least. I'll send an embrocation over to the Guest House.\nI heard you were settled in there."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Why have you not answered my letters?
subQuotationList: ['Why have you not answered my letters?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Is there a short cut down
to our carriage? We must give up our walk. The weather's
pestilential.
subQuotationList: ["Is there a short cut down\nto our carriage? We must give up our walk. The weather's\npestilential."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
referringExpression: Fielding checked his antics rather sharply then said

quoteText: Yes. That way.
subQuotationList: ['Yes. That way.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Are you not coming down yourself?
subQuotationList: ['Are you not coming down yourself?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: How goes it, Aziz?
subQuotationList: ['How goes it, Aziz?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: In my usual health.
subQuotationList: ['In my usual health.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Are you making anything out of your life here?
subQuotationList: ['Are you making anything out of your life here?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: How much do you make out of yours?
subQuotationList: ['How much do you make out of yours?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Who is in charge of the Guest House?
subQuotationList: ['Who is in charge of the Guest House?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: His Highness's Private Secretary, probably.
subQuotationList: ["His Highness's Private Secretary, probably."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Where is he, then?
subQuotationList: ['Where is he, then?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I don't know.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Because not a soul's been near us since we arrived.
subQuotationList: ["Because not a soul's been near us since we arrived."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Really.
subQuotationList: ['Really.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I wrote beforehand to the Durbar, and asked if a visit was
convenient. I was told it was, and arranged my tour accordingly;
but the Guest House servants appear to have no definite instructions,
we can't get any eggs, also my wife wants to go out in the boat.
subQuotationList:
["I wrote beforehand to the Durbar, and asked if a visit was
convenient. I was told it was, and arranged my tour accordingly;
but the Guest House servants appear to have no definite instructions,
we can't get any eggs, also my wife wants to go out in the boat."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: There are two boats.
subQuotationList: ['There are two boats.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Exactly, and no oars.
subQuotationList: ['Exactly, and no oars.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Colonel Maggs broke the oars when here last.
subQuotationList: ['Colonel Maggs broke the oars when here last.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: All four?
subQuotationList: ['All four?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: He is a most powerful man.
subQuotationList: ['He is a most powerful man.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
If the weather lifts, we want to see your torchlight procession
from the water this evening, I wrote to Godbole about
it, but he has taken no notice; it's a place of the dead.
subQuotationList: ['If the weather lifts, we want to see your torchlight procession\nfrom the water this evening,', "I wrote to Godbole about\nit, but he has taken no notice; it's a place of the dead."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Perhaps your letter never reached the Minister in question.
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps your letter never reached the Minister in question.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Will there be any objection to English people watching the
procession?
subQuotationList: ['Will there be any objection to English people watching the\nprocession?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I know nothing at all about the religion here. I should never
think of watching it myself.
subQuotationList: ['I know nothing at all about the religion here. I should never\nthink of watching it myself.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
We had a very different reception both at Mudkul and Deora, they
were kindness itself at Deora, the Maharajah and Maharani wanted
us to see everything.
subQuotationList: ['We had a very different reception both at Mudkul and Deora, they\nwere kindness itself at Deora, the Maharajah and Maharani wanted\nus to see everything.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: You should never have left them.
subQuotationList: ['You should never have left them.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Jump in, Ralph
subQuotationList: ['Jump in, Ralph']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Jump in, Mr. Quested, and Mr. Fielding.
subQuotationList: ['Jump in, Mr. Quested, and Mr. Fielding.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Who on earth is Mr. Quested?
subQuotationList: ['Who on earth is Mr. Quested?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Do I mispronounce that well known name? Is he not your wife's
brother?
subQuotationList: ["Do I mispronounce that well known name? Is he not your wife's\nbrother?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Who on earth do you suppose I've married?
subQuotationList: ["Who on earth do you suppose I've married?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: I'm only Ralph Moore,
subQuotationList: ["I'm only Ralph Moore,"]
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
Quested? Quested? Don't you know that my wife was Mrs. Moore's
daughter?
subQuotationList: ["Quested? Quested? Don't you know that my wife was Mrs. Moore's\ndaughter?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Perhaps this explains your odd attitude?
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps this explains your odd attitude?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: And pray what is wrong with my attitude?
subQuotationList: ['And pray what is wrong with my attitude?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: The preposterous letter you allowed Mahmoud Ali to write for you.
subQuotationList: ['The preposterous letter you allowed Mahmoud Ali to write for you.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: This is a very useless conversation, I consider.
subQuotationList: ['This is a very useless conversation, I consider.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
However did you make such a mistake? It's almost unbelievable.
I should think I wrote you half a dozen times, mentioning my wife
by name. Miss Quested! What an extraordinary notion!
subQuotationList: ['However did you make such a mistake?', "It's almost unbelievable.\nI should think I wrote you half a dozen times, mentioning my wife\nby name. Miss Quested! What an extraordinary notion!"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Miss Quested is
our best friend, she introduced us, but . . . what an amazing
notion. Aziz, we must thrash this misunderstanding out later on.
It is clearly some devilry of Mahmoud Ali's. He knows perfectly
well I married Miss Moore. He called her    Heaslop's sister' in his
insolent letter to me.
subQuotationList:
["Miss Quested is
our best friend, she introduced us, but . . . what an amazing
notion. Aziz, we must thrash this misunderstanding out later on.
It is clearly some devilry of Mahmoud Ali's. He knows perfectly
well I married Miss Moore. He called her    Heaslop's sister' in his
insolent letter to me."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Mahmoud Ali'], ['Mahmoud Ali'], ['Mahmoud Ali'], ['Mahmoud Ali']]]

quoteText:
So she is, and here is Heaslop's
brother, and you his brother-in-law, and good-bye. What does it
matter to me who you marry? Don't trouble me here at Mau is all I
ask. I do not want you, I do not want one of you in my private
life, with my dying breath I say it. Yes, yes, I made a foolish
blunder; despise me and feel cold. I thought you married my enemy.
I never read your letter. Mahmoud Ali deceived me. I thought you'd
stolen my money, but it's as if you stole it. I forgive
Mahmoud Ali all things, because he loved me. My heart is for my own
people henceforward, Please do not follow us,
whomever you marry. I wish no Englishman or Englishwoman to be my
friend.
subQuotationList:
["So she is, and here is Heaslop's
brother, and you his brother-in-law, and good-bye.", "What does it

ask. I do not want you, I do not want one of you in my private
life, with my dying breath I say it. Yes, yes, I made a foolish

I never read your letter. Mahmoud Ali deceived me. I thought you'd
stolen my money, but", "it's as if you stole it. I forgive

quoteText: Ah, you might make me late
subQuotationList: ['Ah, you might make me late']
speaker: Professor Godbole

quoteText: Sorry,
subQuotationList: ['Sorry,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Ah, no, he married the sister
of Mr. Heaslop. Ah, exactly, I have known that for over a year
subQuotationList: ['Ah, no, he married the sister\nof Mr. Heaslop. Ah, exactly, I have known that for over a year']
speaker: Professor Godbole
referringExpression: The other smiled and again mentioned the Guest House party and when he heard that Fieldings wife was not Miss Quested after all remarked

quoteText:
Why did you not tell me? Your silence plunged me
into a pretty pickle.
subQuotationList: ['Why did you not tell me? Your silence plunged me\ninto a pretty pickle.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Never be angry with me. I am, as far as my limitations permit,
your true friend; besides, it is my holy festival.
subQuotationList: ['Never be angry with me. I am, as far as my limitations permit,\nyour true friend; besides, it is my holy festival.']
speaker: Professor Godbole
referringExpression: Godbole who had never been known to tell anyone anything smiled again and said

quoteText: Oh, oh, who is that?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, oh, who is that?']
speaker: Ralph
referringExpression: said a nervous and respectful voice

quoteText:
State
doctor, ridden over to enquire, very little English,
subQuotationList: ['State\ndoctor, ridden over to enquire, very little English,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Born of too old a mother,
subQuotationList: ['Born of too old a mother,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I was unable to call earlier owing to pressure of work. How are
the celebrated bee-stings?
subQuotationList: ['I was unable to call earlier owing to pressure of work. How are\nthe celebrated bee-stings?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I   I was resting, they thought I had better; they throb rather.
subQuotationList: ['I   I was resting, they thought I had better; they throb rather.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
Come here, please,
allow me to look.
subQuotationList: ['Come here, please,\nallow me to look.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: You said this morning
subQuotationList: ['You said this morning']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
The best of doctors make mistakes. Come here, please, for the
diagnosis under the lamp. I am pressed for time.
subQuotationList: ['The best of doctors make mistakes. Come here, please, for the\ndiagnosis under the lamp. I am pressed for time.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Aough
subQuotationList: ['Aough']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: What is the matter, pray?
subQuotationList: ['What is the matter, pray?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Your hands are unkind.
subQuotationList: ['Your hands are unkind.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
What the devil have my hands to do with you? This is a most
strange remark. I am a qualified doctor, who will not hurt you.
subQuotationList: ['What the devil have my hands to do with you? This is a most\nstrange remark. I am a qualified doctor, who will not hurt you.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
referringExpression: he put them behind his back before replying

quoteText: I don't mind pain, there is no pain.
subQuotationList: ["I don't mind pain, there is no pain."]
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: No pain?
subQuotationList: ['No pain?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Not really.
subQuotationList: ['Not really.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: Excellent news,
subQuotationList: ['Excellent news,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: But there is cruelty.
subQuotationList: ['But there is cruelty.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
I have brought you some salve, but how to put it on in your
present nervous state becomes a problem,
subQuotationList: ['I have brought you some salve, but how to put it on in your\npresent nervous state becomes a problem,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Please leave it with me.
subQuotationList: ['Please leave it with me.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: Certainly not. It returns to my dispensary at once.
subQuotationList: ['Certainly not. It returns to my dispensary at once.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Now, do you want me to treat your stings, or do you prefer an
English doctor? There is one at Asirgarh. Asirgarh is forty miles
away, and the Ringnod dam broken. Now you see how you are placed.
I think I had better see Mr. Fielding about you; this is really
great nonsense, your present behaviour.
subQuotationList:
['Now, do you want me to treat your stings, or do you prefer an
English doctor? There is one at Asirgarh. Asirgarh is forty miles
away, and the Ringnod dam broken. Now you see how you are placed.
I think I had better see Mr. Fielding about you; this is really
great nonsense, your present behaviour.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: They are out in a boat,
subQuotationList: ['They are out in a boat,']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
They have not gone in the direction
of Mau, I hope. On a night like this the people become most
fanatical.
subQuotationList: ['They have not gone in the direction\nof Mau, I hope. On a night like this the people become most\nfanatical.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: You should not treat us like this,
subQuotationList: ['You should not treat us like this,']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: Like what?
subQuotationList: ['Like what?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Dr. Aziz, we have done you no harm.
subQuotationList: ['Dr. Aziz, we have done you no harm.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
Aha, you know my name, I see. Yes, I am Aziz. No, of course your
great friend Miss Quested did me no harm at the Marabar.
subQuotationList: ['Aha, you know my name, I see. Yes, I am Aziz. No, of course your\ngreat friend Miss Quested did me no harm at the Marabar.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Radhakrishna Radhakrishna,
   Radhakrishna Radhakrishna,
   Krishnaradha Radhakrishna,
   Radhakrishna Radhakrishna,
subQuotationList:
['Radhakrishna Radhakrishna,
   Radhakrishna Radhakrishna,
   Krishnaradha Radhakrishna,
   Radhakrishna Radhakrishna,']
speaker: _unknowable

quoteText: I must go back now, good night,
subQuotationList: ['I must go back now, good night,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Don't you think me unkind any more?
subQuotationList: ["Don't you think me unkind any more?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz
referringExpression: he remembered how detestable he had been and said

quoteText: No.
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: How can you tell, you strange fellow?
subQuotationList: ['How can you tell, you strange fellow?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Not difficult, the one thing I always know.
subQuotationList: ['Not difficult, the one thing I always know.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: Can you always tell whether a stranger is your friend?
subQuotationList: ['Can you always tell whether a stranger is your friend?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: Then you are an Oriental.
subQuotationList: ['Then you are an Oriental.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Take this, think of me when you use it. I shall
never want it back. I must give you one little present, and it is
all I have got; you are Mrs. Moore's son.
subQuotationList: ["Take this, think of me when you use it. I shall\nnever want it back. I must give you one little present, and it is\nall I have got; you are Mrs. Moore's son."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I am that,
subQuotationList: ['I am that,']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
But you are Heaslop's brother also, and alas, the two nations
cannot be friends.
subQuotationList: ["But you are Heaslop's brother also, and alas, the two nations\ncannot be friends."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: I know. Not yet.
subQuotationList: ['I know. Not yet.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: Did your mother speak to you about me?
subQuotationList: ['Did your mother speak to you about me?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: In her letters, in her letters. She loved you.
subQuotationList: ['In her letters, in her letters. She loved you.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
Yes, your mother was my best friend in all the world. This is our monsoon, the best
weather, How I wish she could
have seen them, our rains. Now is the time when all things are
happy, young and old. They are happy out there with their savage
noise, though we cannot follow them; the tanks are all full so they
dance, and this is India. I wish you were not with officials, then
I would show you my country, but I cannot. Perhaps I will just take
you out on the water now, for one short half-hour.
subQuotationList:
['Yes, your mother was my best friend in all the world.', 'This is our monsoon, the best
weather,', 'How I wish she could
have seen them, our rains. Now is the time when all things are
happy, young and old. They are happy out there with their savage
noise, though we cannot follow them; the tanks are all full so they
dance, and this is India. I wish you were not with officials, then
I would show you my country, but I cannot. Perhaps I will just take
you out on the water now, for one short half-hour.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Was
that the Rajah?
subQuotationList: ['Was\nthat the Rajah?']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: What   what do you mean?
subQuotationList: ['What   what do you mean?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Row back.
subQuotationList: ['Row back.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: But there's no Rajah   nothing
subQuotationList: ["But there's no Rajah   nothing"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Row back, you will see what I mean.
subQuotationList: ['Row back, you will see what I mean.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: There . . .
subQuotationList: ['There . . .']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
I can't tell you what that is, I'm sure, His
Highness is dead. I think we should go back at once.
subQuotationList: ["I can't tell you what that is, I'm sure,", 'His\nHighness is dead. I think we should go back at once.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Shall
we go back now?
subQuotationList: ['Shall\nwe go back now?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: There is still the procession.
subQuotationList: ['There is still the procession.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
I'd rather not go nearer   they have such strange customs, and might
hurt you.
subQuotationList: ["I'd rather not go nearer   they have such strange customs, and might\nhurt you."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: A little nearer.
subQuotationList: ['A little nearer.']
speaker: Ralph

quoteText: Radhakrishna Radhakrishna Radhakrishna Radhakrishna Krishnaradha,
subQuotationList: ['Radhakrishna Radhakrishna Radhakrishna Radhakrishna Krishnaradha,']
speaker: _unknowable

quoteText:
Mr. Moore, don't tell anyone that the Rajah is dead. It is a
secret still, I am supposed not to say. We pretend he is alive
until after the festival, to prevent unhappiness. Do you want to
go still nearer?
subQuotationList:
["Mr. Moore, don't tell anyone that the Rajah is dead. It is a
secret still, I am supposed not to say. We pretend he is alive
until after the festival, to prevent unhappiness. Do you want to
go still nearer?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: Ralph

quoteText:
God
is love.
subQuotationList: ['God\nis love.']
speaker: _unknowable

quoteText:
As I fell into our largest Mau tank
under circumstances our other friends will relate, I thought how
brave Miss Quested was, and decided to tell her so, despite my
imperfect English. Through you I am happy here with my children
instead of in a prison, of that I make no doubt. My children shall
be taught to speak of you with the greatest affection and respect.
subQuotationList:
['As I fell into our largest Mau tank
under circumstances our other friends will relate, I thought how
brave Miss Quested was, and decided to tell her so, despite my
imperfect English. Through you I am happy here with my children
instead of in a prison, of that I make no doubt. My children shall
be taught to speak of you with the greatest affection and respect.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Miss Quested will be greatly pleased. I am glad you have seen her
courage at last.
subQuotationList: ['Miss Quested will be greatly pleased. I am glad you have seen her\ncourage at last.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
I want to do kind actions all round and wipe out the wretched
business of the Marabar for ever. I have been so disgracefully
hasty, thinking you meant to get hold of my money: as bad a mistake
as the cave itself.
subQuotationList:
['I want to do kind actions all round and wipe out the wretched
business of the Marabar for ever. I have been so disgracefully
hasty, thinking you meant to get hold of my money: as bad a mistake
as the cave itself.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Aziz, I wish you would talk to my wife. She too believes that the
Marabar is wiped out.
subQuotationList: ['Aziz, I wish you would talk to my wife. She too believes that the\nMarabar is wiped out.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: How so?
subQuotationList: ['How so?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I don't know, perhaps she might tell you, she won't tell me. She
has ideas I don't share   indeed, when I'm away from her I think them
ridiculous. When I'm with her, I suppose because I'm fond of her,
I feel different, I feel half dead and half blind. My wife's after
something. You and I and Miss Quested are, roughly speaking, not
after anything. We jog on as decently as we can, you a little in
front   a laudable little party. But my wife is not with us.
subQuotationList:
["I don't know, perhaps she might tell you, she won't tell me. She
has ideas I don't share   indeed, when I'm away from her I think them
ridiculous. When I'm with her, I suppose because I'm fond of her,
I feel different, I feel half dead and half blind. My wife's after
something. You and I and Miss Quested are, roughly speaking, not
after anything. We jog on as decently as we can, you a little in
front   a laudable little party. But my wife is not with us."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Dr. Aziz'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested'], ['Adela Quested', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Adela Quested', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz'], ['Adela Quested', 'Dr. Aziz', 'Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText:
What are you meaning? Is Stella not faithful to you, Cyril? This
fills me with great concern.
subQuotationList: ['What are you meaning? Is Stella not faithful to you, Cyril? This\nfills me with great concern.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
If you won't
talk about the Marabar to Stella, why won't you talk to Ralph? He
is a wise boy really. And (same metaphor) he rides a little behind
her, though with her.
subQuotationList:
["If you won't
talk about the Marabar to Stella, why won't you talk to Ralph? He
is a wise boy really. And (same metaphor) he rides a little behind
her, though with her."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Tell him also, I have nothing to say to him, but he is indeed a
wise boy and has always one Indian friend. I partly love him
because he brought me back to you to say good-bye. For this is
good-bye, Cyril, though to think about it will spoil our ride and
make us sad.
subQuotationList:
['Tell him also, I have nothing to say to him, but he is indeed a
wise boy and has always one Indian friend. I partly love him
because he brought me back to you to say good-bye. For this is
good-bye, Cyril, though to think about it will spoil our ride and
make us sad.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Ralph'], ['Ralph'], ['Ralph'], ['Ralph'], ['Ralph'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz', 'Cyril Fielding'], ['Dr. Aziz', 'Cyril Fielding']]]

quoteText:
No, we won't think about it. From her point of view, Mau has been a success. It calmed
her   both of them suffer from restlessness. She found something
soothing, some solution of her queer troubles here.
subQuotationList: ["No, we won't think about it.", 'From her point of view, Mau has been a success. It calmed\nher   both of them suffer from restlessness. She found something\nsoothing, some solution of her queer troubles here.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Do you know anything about this Krishna business?
subQuotationList: ['Do you know anything about this Krishna business?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
My dear chap, officially they call it Gokul Ashtami. All the State
offices are closed, but how else should it concern you and me?
subQuotationList: ['My dear chap, officially they call it Gokul Ashtami. All the State\noffices are closed, but how else should it concern you and me?']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Gokul is the village where Krishna was born   well, more or less
born, for there's the same hovering between it and another village
as between Bethlehem and Nazareth. What I want to discover is its
spiritual side, if it has one.
subQuotationList:
["Gokul is the village where Krishna was born   well, more or less
born, for there's the same hovering between it and another village
as between Bethlehem and Nazareth. What I want to discover is its
spiritual side, if it has one."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
It is useless discussing Hindus with me. Living with them teaches
me no more. When I think I annoy them, I do not. When I think I
don't annoy them, I do. Perhaps they will sack me for tumbling on
to their dolls'-house; on the other hand, perhaps they will double
my salary. Time will prove. Why so curious about them?
subQuotationList:
["It is useless discussing Hindus with me. Living with them teaches
me no more. When I think I annoy them, I do not. When I think I
don't annoy them, I do. Perhaps they will sack me for tumbling on
to their dolls'-house; on the other hand, perhaps they will double
my salary. Time will prove. Why so curious about them?"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
It's difficult to explain. I never really understood or liked
them, except an occasional scrap of Godbole. Does the old fellow
still say
subQuotationList: ["It's difficult to explain. I never really understood or liked\nthem, except an occasional scrap of Godbole. Does the old fellow\nstill say"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Oh, presumably.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, presumably.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
I can't explain, because it isn't in words at all,
but why do my wife and her brother like Hinduism, though they take
no interest in its forms? They won't talk to me about this. They
know I think a certain side of their lives is a mistake, and are
shy. That's why I wish you would talk to them, for at all events
you're Oriental.
subQuotationList:
["I can't explain, because it isn't in words at all,
but why do my wife and her brother like Hinduism, though they take
no interest in its forms? They won't talk to me about this. They
know I think a certain side of their lives is a mistake, and are
shy. That's why I wish you would talk to them, for at all events
you're Oriental."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
referringExpression: Fielding sighed opened his lips shut them then said

quoteText:
Oh, shut up, Don't spoil our last hour with foolish
questions. Leave Krishna alone, and talk about something sensible.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, shut up,', "Don't spoil our last hour with foolish\nquestions. Leave Krishna alone, and talk about something sensible."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
no
further use for politeness,
subQuotationList: ['no\nfurther use for politeness,']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: Very well, and we have no use for you,
subQuotationList: ['Very well, and we have no use for you,']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Away from us, Indians go to seed at
once. Look at the King-Emperor High School! Look at you, forgetting
your medicine and going back to charms. Look at your poems.
subQuotationList: ['Away from us, Indians go to seed at\nonce. Look at the King-Emperor High School! Look at you, forgetting\nyour medicine and going back to charms. Look at your poems.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Jolly
good poems, I'm getting published Bombay side.
subQuotationList: ["Jolly\ngood poems, I'm getting published Bombay side."]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Yes, and what do
they say? Free our women and India will be free. Try it, my lad.
Free your own lady in the first place, and see who'll wash Ahmed
Karim and Jamila's faces. A nice situation!
subQuotationList:
["Yes, and what do
they say? Free our women and India will be free. Try it, my lad.
Free your own lady in the first place, and see who'll wash Ahmed
Karim and Jamila's faces. A nice situation!"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Clear out, all you Turtons and Burtons. We
wanted to know you ten years back   now it's too late. If we see you
and sit on your committees, it's for political reasons, don't you
make any mistake. Clear out, clear out, I
say. Why are we put to so much suffering? We used to blame you,
now we blame ourselves, we grow wiser. Until England is in
difficulties we keep silent, but in the next European war   aha, aha!
Then is our time.
subQuotationList:
["Clear out, all you Turtons and Burtons. We
wanted to know you ten years back   now it's too late. If we see you
and sit on your committees, it's for political reasons, don't you
make any mistake.", 'Clear out, clear out, I
say. Why are we put to so much suffering? We used to blame you,
now we blame ourselves, we grow wiser. Until England is in
difficulties we keep silent, but in the next European war   aha, aha!
Then is our time.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Who do you want instead of the English? The Japanese?
subQuotationList: ['Who do you want instead of the English? The Japanese?']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: No, the Afghans. My own ancestors.
subQuotationList: ['No, the Afghans. My own ancestors.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Oh, your Hindu friends will like that, won't they?
subQuotationList: ["Oh, your Hindu friends will like that, won't they?"]
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText: It will be arranged   a conference of Oriental statesmen.
subQuotationList: ['It will be arranged   a conference of Oriental statesmen.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: It will indeed be arranged.
subQuotationList: ['It will indeed be arranged.']
speaker: Cyril Fielding

quoteText:
Old story of    We will rob every man and rape every woman from
Peshawar to Calcutta,' I suppose, which you get some nobody to
repeat and then quote every week in the _Pioneer_ in order to
frighten us into retaining you! We know!
subQuotationList:
["Old story of    We will rob every man and rape every woman from
Peshawar to Calcutta,' I suppose, which you get some nobody to
repeat and then quote every week in the _Pioneer_ in order to
frighten us into retaining you! We know!"]
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
India shall be a nation! No
foreigners of any sort! Hindu and Moslem and Sikh and all shall be
one! Hurrah! Hurrah for India! Hurrah! Hurrah!
subQuotationList: ['India shall be a nation! No\nforeigners of any sort! Hindu and Moslem and Sikh and all shall be\none! Hurrah! Hurrah for India! Hurrah! Hurrah!']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText:
Down with the English anyhow.
That's certain. Clear out, you fellows, double quick, I say. We
may hate one another, but we hate you most. If I don't make you
go, Ahmed will, Karim will, if it's fifty five-hundred years we
shall get rid of you, yes, we shall drive every blasted Englishman
into the sea, and then and then, you and I shall be friends.
subQuotationList:
["Down with the English anyhow.
That's certain. Clear out, you fellows, double quick, I say. We
may hate one another, but we hate you most. If I don't make you
go, Ahmed will, Karim will, if it's fifty five-hundred years we
shall get rid of you, yes, we shall drive every blasted Englishman
into the sea, and then", 'and then,', 'you and I shall be friends.']
speaker: Dr. Aziz

quoteText: Why can't we be friends now? It's what I want. It's what you want.
subQuotationList: ["Why can't we be friends now?", "It's what I want. It's what you want."]
speaker: Cyril Fielding
